The discussion class mainly focuses on bilingual discussions in English and Chinese. We will use self-made handouts and supplement them with online resources such as PowerPoint presentations, China Daily, CGTN, The New York Times, Washington Post, Los Angeles Times, CNN, South China Morning Post, and others to stay updated with current news in English.

The purpose of this class is to familiarize ourselves with the vocabulary and basic writing styles commonly used in English news. This will enable us to understand and discuss various categories of news topics, both domestic and international.
zh_law_content: 以英语讲解为主 讨论课中英文双语进行 使用自编 讲义 配合网  ＰｏｗｅｒＰｏｉｎｔ 络资源上的当天的英语新闻 如 Ｃｈｉｎａ Ｄａｉｌｙ ＣＧＴＮ Ｔｈｅ Ｎｅｗ Ｙｏｒｋ Ｔｉｍｅｓ了解Ｗａｓｈｉｎｇｔｏｎ Ｐｏｓｔ Ｌｏｓ Ａｎｇｅｌｅｓ Ｔｉｍｅｓ ＣＮＮ Ｓｏｕｔｈ Ｃｈｉｎａ Ｍｏｒｎｉｎｇ Ｐｏｓｔ ｅｔｃ．国内外大事 熟悉英语新闻中的分类词汇和基本文体

law_content: This course covers how to use economic tools to analyze the behavior of the labor market. The course content covers three parts. First, it teaches the economic theory of labor economics, allowing students to grasp basic concepts and principles, including labor demand, supply, and wage determination. Second, it explains empirical analysis methods in economics, including difference-in-differences, instrumental variables, and regression discontinuity. Lastly, it introduces cutting-edge research in the field of labor economics.
zh_law_content: 本课程介绍如何运用经济学工具分析劳动力市场的行为 课程内容涵盖三个部分 一是教授劳动经济学的经济理论 使同学掌握基本概念与原理 包括劳  动力需求 供给 工资决定等专题 二是讲解经济学实证分析方法 包括双差法 工具变量 断点回归等 三是介绍劳动经济学领域前沿研究

law_content: Health economics is an important branch of economics that emerged in the 20th century. It mainly studies various economic issues related to scarce health resources in the 2070s. The main content of this course includes research methods in health economics, supply and demand of healthcare services, evaluation methods in health economics, asymmetric information issues in healthcare service markets, funding allocation and utilization of healthcare expenses, international comparisons of healthcare financing systems, and reform issues in the Chinese healthcare system, etc. The purpose of offering this course is to help students master the basic principles of health economics, understand the main models of healthcare market operation, comprehend healthcare financing systems, including the operational mechanisms of typical international health insurance systems, and initially cultivate students' ability to observe and analyze theoretical and policy issues in the field of healthcare using economic and healthcare service research methods.
zh_law_content: 卫生经济学是 世纪 年代兴起的一个重要的经济学分支学科 主要研究２０ ７０ 与稀缺的卫生资源相关的各种经济学问题 本课程的主要内容包括卫生经济学研究方法 卫生服务的供给与需求 卫生经济评价方法 医疗卫生服务市场  的非对称信息问题 卫生费用的筹集分配和使用 医疗融资体系的国际比较  中国卫生体系改革问题等等 开设该课程的目的是帮助学生掌握卫生经济学的基本原理 了解医疗卫生市场运行的主要模式 理解医疗融资制度 包括国  际典型医疗保险制度的运作机制 并初步培养学生结合经济学和卫生服务研究的方法 观察和分析医疗卫生领域理论与政策问题的能力

law_content: This course aims to provide students with an in-depth understanding of the application of microeconometric methods in academic papers published in top international economic journals. Students will analyze and explore the cutting-edge research methods used in this field. Additionally, the course will provide a large-scale random sampling household survey panel data from China, which will serve as the basis for students to apply the learned international research methods and write an academic paper using panel data.
zh_law_content: 本课程通过剖析发表在国际顶级经济学学术刊物上的 以微观计量经济学为主要研究方法的学术论文 使选课同学深入了解该领域国际前沿研究方法的应用 与此同时 该课程还将提供一套关于我国的大型随机抽样入户实地调 查面板数据 并要求选课同学应用所学的国际前沿研究方法和使（ｐａｎｅｌ ｄａｔａ）用该数据写一篇学术论文

law_content: This course mainly explores the contradictions between limited resources and unlimited human desires from the perspective of economics in the history of Chinese civilization, including the records and reflections of ancient Chinese thinkers on this issue. It covers the economic thoughts of various schools of thought in pre-Qin period, as well as economic policies and the economic thoughts of relevant figures in different historical periods from Qin and Han dynasties to the late Qing dynasty.
zh_law_content: 本课程主要从经济学视角探讨人类文明起源以来中国历代先贤对 资源有限“而人欲无穷 之间矛盾的记录和思考 主要包括先秦诸子百家经济思想 自秦”  汉直至晚清各历史时期经济政策和相关人物经济思想等内容

law_content: The main focus of this course is on the formation and development of Western economics, with a particular emphasis on introducing and evaluating the historical background, key features, basic content, and impact on socio-economic development of representative or dominant economic thoughts or theories that emerged from the Mercantilist era to the period before Keynes. It aims to elucidate the laws and trends of the evolution of economic thoughts or theories. This course consists of three major parts: the pre-classical economics period, classical economics period, and neoclassical economics period.
zh_law_content: 本课程以西方经济学的产生 形成和发展为主线 着重介绍和评价西方国家自 重商时代开始到凯恩斯之前具有代表性或居支配地位的经济思想或学说产生的历史背景 主要特点 基本内容 以及它们对社会经济发展的影响 阐明经济   思想或经济理论发展演变的规律和趋势 本课程包括前古典经济学时期 古 典经济学时期和新古典经济学时期三大部分

law_content: Economic history is an important branch of applied economics. Its content lies in using economic methods to analyze historical changes, explain the economic reasons behind major historical events, and thus elucidate the laws of historical evolution from an economic perspective. Many significant modern economic events and policies can find their prototypes in history. Therefore, economic history can provide certain references for today's economic development and economic policies. This course discusses the development and changes of Chinese economic history against the backdrop of world economic history, with a focus on the late imperial period to modern times. The teaching hours will be divided into stages and combined with specialized topics. This course will introduce some cutting-edge achievements in economic research on historical development in recent years.
zh_law_content: 经济史是应用经济学的一个重要分支学科 其内容在于利用经济学方法分析历史变迁 解释重大历史事件背后的经济原因 进而从经济学角度阐释历史演 变的规律 很多现代重大经济事件和经济政策都可以在历史上找到缩影 因此； 经济史可以为今天的经济发展和经济政策提供某些借鉴本课程在世界经济史的背景下阐述中国经济史的发展和变迁 重点放在帝制晚期到近代 授学时将分阶段讲授与专题讲授相结合 本课程将介绍经济学 近年来在历史发展研究 的一些前沿成果

law_content: This course focuses on industrialization and examines the development process and experiences of major economic entities from the pre-industrial era to the present, with a scope that covers the global economy. It provides a historical perspective and economic concepts to understand the world economy.
zh_law_content: 本课程以工业化为主线 以世界经济为考察范围 讲述自前工业化时代至近现 代主要经济体的发展过程与经验 提供理解全球经济的历史视角与经济学理念

law_content: The industrial organization theory studies the organizational structure within industries and the inter-firm relationships. It focuses on the behavior of firms within a given organizational structure, including their business strategies, production decisions, pricing behavior, non-price strategic behavior, and the market performance resulting from these behaviors.
zh_law_content: 产业组织理论是以 产业 为研究对象 主要研究产业内部 企业之间的组织“ ”  结构和在一定的组织结构条件下企业的经营战略 产出决策 定价行为 非价  格策略性行为 以及由其行为带来的市场绩效

law_content: Information economics is a branch of study that uses game theory as a research tool to investigate the equilibrium and behavior of various participants in games under information asymmetry. This course consists of two main parts. The first part focuses on game theory, which covers static and dynamic games as well as games with complete and incomplete information. The second part focuses on information economics, which includes classical models of adverse selection, signal theory, and mechanism design theory.
zh_law_content: 信息经济学是以博弈论为研究工具 研究信息不对称下各个博弈参与方的均衡以及行为 本课程的主要内容由两个大的部分组成 第一部分是博弈论的 内容 包含静态与动态的博弈以及完全信息与不完全信息的博弈 第二部分 是信息经济学 包括经典的逆向选择模型 信号理论以及机制设计理论

law_content: "Capital: A Critique of Political Economy" is considered the greatest and most mature work on economics by Karl Marx and is a must-read classic for studying Marxist political economics. "Selected Readings from Capital" is a intermediate-level course on political economics.
zh_law_content: 资本论 作为马克思最伟大和最成熟的经济学著作 是我们学习马克思主义《 》 政治经济学必读的经典著作 资本论 选读 是中级程度的政治经济学课

law_content: Development economics takes the development of the economies of developing countries as its research object. It studies the laws governing how developing countries can overcome poverty and achieve overall improvement in the standard of living for their people, as well as the specific processes and conditions of development. It also aims to formulate policies and strategies for achieving economic, social, and institutional reforms as soon as possible. This course consists of four parts comprising ten chapters in total. The first part, the introduction, includes two chapters that mainly discuss the research objects and learning objectives of development economics, introduce the characteristics of developing countries, and explore the differences and connections between economic development and economic growth. The second part, the dual economy development model, includes three chapters that primarily explore the transfer and employment of surplus labor in rural areas under a dual economy, the relationship between industrialization and agricultural sector development, the process of China's dual economic structural transformation, and the main problems it faces. The third part, modern economic growth theory, includes three chapters that mainly discuss the intrinsic connection between material capital accumulation, population and human capital, and economic growth, as well as analyze the characteristics and trends of China's economic growth. The fourth part, structuralist theory of economic development, includes two chapters that primarily explore the structuralist school of thought in Latin America.
zh_law_content: 发展经济学以发展中国家经济为研究对象 研究发展中国家如何摆脱贫困状态得以发展成为人民生活水平普遍提高的现代经济的规律 研究发展的具体过程和条件 以及为早日实现经济 社会和体制变革所应制定的政策和战略  该课程包括四篇共十章内容：第一篇 导论 包括两章 主要讨论发展经济学研究的对象和学习目的 介绍“ ”  发展中国家的特征 讨论经济发展与经济增长的区别和联系 第二篇 二元经济发展模型 包括三章 主要探讨二元经济条件下农村富余“ ” 劳动力的转移和就业 工业化与农业部门发展的关系 中国二元经济结构转变 进程及其面临的主要问题第三篇 现代经济增长理论 包括三章 主要探讨物质资本积累 人口和人力“ ”  资本积累 技术进步与经济增长的内在联系 分析中国经济增长的特征和趋 势第四篇 经济发展的结构主义理论 包括两章 主要探讨拉美学派的结构主义

law_content: Applied econometrics is an important branch of modern economics. It focuses on real economic problems and utilizes mathematical and statistical methods, while also emphasizing the analysis of empirical data. This course, as a compulsory subject for undergraduate students majoring in economics, provides a systematic introduction to the theoretical framework and basic methods of applied econometrics. It also emphasizes training in computer operation skills and the study and discussion of classical literature. The aim is to cultivate students' practical application abilities of relevant models and their empirical analysis abilities for real economic problems. The course content includes linear and nonlinear least squares estimation methods, maximum likelihood estimation, time series and panel data models, limited dependent variable models (including discrete choice models, truncated and censored data models, and count data models), endogeneity and instrumental variable estimation, simultaneous equation models, and nonparametric and semiparametric estimation methods.
zh_law_content: 应用计量经济学是现代经济学的重要分支学科 它以现实经济问题为研究对象 以数理统计学为方法依托 同时注重对实证数据分析规律的总结 本课程  作为经济学专业本科生的必修课 将系统介绍应用计量经济学的理论框架和基本方法 同时注重对计算机操作技巧的训练和对经典文献的研读讨论 以期 培养学生对相关模型的实际应用能力和对现实经济问题的实证分析能力 课程内容安排 线性和非线性最小二乘估计方法 极大似然估计 时间序列和面：  板数据模型 有限因变量模型 包括离散选择模型 截取与断尾数据模型 计数 （  数据模型 内生性与工具变量估计 联立方程模型 非参数与半参数估计方法）  等

law_content: This course introduces students to time series models and their applications in economic and financial data. The course will provide a detailed overview of linear and nonlinear models. We will first cover traditional time series methods and models, then move on to dynamic modeling and regression methods. Nonlinear models such as autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity and threshold autoregressive models will also be discussed. Additionally, we will explore commonly used tools in finance and economics such as cointegration, error correction models, and vector autoregressive models.
zh_law_content: 本课程向学生介绍时间序列模型 以及这些模型在经济和金融数据中的应用 本课程会详细介绍线性模型 非线性模型也会涉及 我们首先会详细介绍传 统的时间序列方法 模型 然后动态建模和回归方法 还会介绍非线———ＡＲＭＡ  性模型 例如自回归条件异方差 门阈自回归模型 另外 近年来时间序列模   型在金融和经济学中常用的工具 例如协整 误差修正模型 向量自回归模型

law_content: This course is a compulsory course for students in the Economics department after they are divided into different majors in the second semester of their sophomore year. The course is organized in groups, with a designated instructor determining the research destination and topic. Students are required to utilize the summer break to immerse themselves in real society, combining theory with practice. Through field visits, questionnaire surveys, and discussions, they are expected to complete a one-week research task.
zh_law_content: 该课程是学生在大二下学期专业分流后进入经济学系学习的必修课程 该课程以小组为单位 由指导教师确定调研目的地和调研主题 组织学生利用暑期 深入现实社会 将理论与实际相结合 通过实地考察 问卷调查 座谈访问等方   式 完成为期一周的调研任务

law_content: As a compulsory course for various majors, this course will comprehensively cover topics related to international trade practices, international trade policies, systems and organizations, as well as fundamental theories of international trade. Through this course, students are required to have a good understanding of relevant international trade conventions and their trade policies, and be able to conduct theoretical analysis. The specific teaching contents are as follows: Trade Theory 1. Introduction 2. Classical trade theory thoughts 3. Classical trade theory models 4. Additions and extensions to classical trade theory Summary Trade foundation and barriers: Theoretical section test accounts for 20% of the total score. Classroom discussions, homework reviews, and assignments account for 15% of the total score. Trade policies.
zh_law_content: 作为各专业必修课 本课程将较为全面地讲授有关国际贸易实务 国际贸易政 策 制度与组织 国际贸易基础理论等内容 通过本课程的学习 要求学生通晓   有关的国际贸易惯例及其贸易政策 并能够进行一定的理论分析 具体教学 内容如下：贸易理论一 导论 二 经典贸易理论思想 三 经典贸易理论模型    四 经典贸易理论的补充与拓展小结 贸易的基础与障碍１：理论部分测试 占总成绩（ ２０％）课堂讨论 作业讲评 作业 占总成绩／ （ １ ５％）贸易政策

law_content: The course covers various aspects of international financial communication, including the movement of currencies, capital, and credit between countries, as well as the international and national political, economic, and social factors that shape and develop international financial relationships. Specific topics include balance of payments, foreign exchange and exchange rates, international reserves, and foreign exchange management. It also explores international monetary systems, international financial markets, and other related subjects. The course encompasses fundamental theories, practical applications, and policies in international finance.
zh_law_content: 本课程研究国际间资金融通的各方面内容 包括国际间的货币运动 资本运动和信贷运动 以及支配国际金融关系变化和发展的国际和各国政治 经济社会因素 具体内容有国际收支 外汇及外汇汇率 国际储备 外汇管理    国际货币制度 国际金融市场等 内容涉及国际金融基本理论 实务及政策

law_content: This course explains the global capital allocation and investment opportunities arising from the mechanism of capital mobility and the formation of the international monetary system, as well as the development of classical investment theories. It also explores the interactive relationship between China and foreign investment through the lens of China's practical situation. The course will utilize software from a futures company for practical simulated operations.
zh_law_content: 本课程从资本流动和国际货币体系的形成机理角度说明全球资金配置及由此带来的投资机会 以及所形成的经典投资理论流派等 最后结合中国实际 讲  解中国与外资的互动关系 课程将使用某期货公司的软件进行实际操作模拟

law_content: Teaching the history of world economy since the year___
zh_law_content: 讲授自 年以来的世界经济史

law_content: This course covers major current issues in the fields of international trade, international finance, international investment, and international economic cooperation. It also explores the mechanisms and evolution of mature market economies, developing market economies, and transitional market economies. The course emphasizes the impact of major countries' development on the global economic landscape and their influence on developing countries.
zh_law_content: 本课程内容涵盖国际贸易 国际金融 国际投资和国际经济合作领域的当前的 重大现实课题 也会比较成熟型市场经济 发展型市场经济和转轨型市场经济 的机制与演进 重点说明主要国家的发展对世界经济格局的影响和对后发展

law_content: The objective of this course is to analyze and explain the development and characteristics of China as an open economic entity, particularly in foreign trade, foreign investment, and utilizing foreign capital. It also aims to examine the typical facts of China's involvement in international division of labor and the impact on its economic growth and development. Furthermore, it analyzes China's economic and trade relations with major countries around the world. By studying this course, students are expected to gain a good understanding of the basic principles of international economics and open economy, and be able to apply these principles to analyze China's open economy effectively.
zh_law_content: 本课程旨在分析和解释中国作为开放经济体的发展与特色 尤其是对外贸易 对外投资 利用外资 参与国际分工典型事实及其对中国经济增长 经济发展  的影响 并分析中国与世界主要国家的经济贸易关系 希望学生通过本课程 的学习对国际经济学 开放经济的基本原理有很好的掌握和理解 并能运用这／ 些基本原理对开放的中国经济进行分析

law_content: The main contents of this course include an overview of the financial system, interest rates and their determinants, bank management, monetary supply process, financial innovation, and monetary policy.
zh_law_content: 本课程主要内容包括 金融体系概览 利率及其决定 银行管理 货币供给过：   程 金融创新 货币政策等内容

law_content: Introduction to Financial Economics teaches the modern financial theories that have emerged since the 20th century. These theories have been incorporated into various courses such as investment theory and corporate finance. The principles derived from modern financial economics have been unified into a theoretical framework, including the important concepts of no-arbitrage assumption and general equilibrium framework. The central problems studied in modern financial economics revolve around the pricing of financial assets, portfolio analysis, capital asset pricing model (CAPM), arbitrage pricing theory (APT), market efficiency theory, and other pricing models. These theories, including the efficient market hypothesis (EMH), the Modigliani-Miller (MM) theorem, are essential components of the financial economics theory. Chapter One discusses the development history and methodology of financial economics, Chapter Two focuses on the analysis of expected utility functions, and Chapter Three covers modern portfolio selection theory.
zh_law_content: 金融经济学导论 讲授 世纪 年代以来的现代金融理论 并将出现在“ ” ２０ ５０ 投资学 公司财务 等课程中来源于现代理论金融经济学中的各种原理 方“ ”“ ” 法纳入统一的理论框架中 现代金融经济学中最重要的是无套利假设和一般均衡框架 所研究的中心问题是在不确定的金融市场环境下对金融资产定价 投资组合分析 资本资产定价模型 套利定价理论 期（ＭＰＴ） （ＣＡＰＭ） （ＡＰＴ）权定价理论 市场有效性理论 定理等都是金融经济学理论体系的 （ＥＭＨ）ＭＭ组成部分第一章 金融经济学的发展史和方法论第二章 期望效用函数分析第三章 现代投资组合选择理论

law_content: This course is one of the important foundational courses in microfinance theory. Through the study of this course, students will systematically master the basic principles and methods of corporate financing, investment, dividend distribution, and short-term financial management. Building on the understanding of the basic concepts of corporate finance and the mastery of basic methods of corporate financial management, this course introduces the basic ways and methods of corporate investment and financing. It enables students to identify risks faced in corporate financial management and analyze them to propose preliminary solutions. At the same time, students will be able to perform relevant financial decision analysis. The course aims to cultivate students' knowledge in microfinance, their ability to provide financial services for microeconomic entities, and their ability to manage financial assets to some extent.
zh_law_content: 本课程是微观金融理论的重要基础课程之一 通过本门课程的学习 使学生 系统掌握公司筹资 投资 分派股利以及短期财务管理的基本原理和方法 在  理解公司金融的基本概念 掌握公司金融管理基本方法的基础上 介绍公司投 资和融资的基本方式和方法 使得学生能够识别公司金融管理所面临的风险 并能加以分析 以提出初步的解决办法 同时能够进行相关的金融决策分析 ； 培养学生具有微观金融知识 能够为微观主体提供金融服务并具有一定的管理金融资产的能力

law_content: This course is based on contemporary investment theory and practices in recent years, with a focus on the theory and practical operations of investment and capital markets since 1963. The main topics include: fundamentals of investment, securities markets and their transactions, valuation of non-fixed income securities, fixed income securities, derivative financial instruments, portfolio theory of securities investment, investment management, acquisitions and mergers in capital markets, and securities investment funds.
zh_law_content: 本课程以 年以来的当代投资学为基础 重点介绍投资学与资本市场的基１９６３ 本理论和实务操作 主要内容包括 ：投资学基础 证券市场及其交易 非固定收益证券的价值评估１． ２． ３．固定收益证券 衍生金融工具 证券投资组合理论 投资管理４． ５． ６． ７．资本市场上的收购与兼并 证券投资基金

law_content: This course will introduce the relevant techniques for hedging, pricing, and designing financial instruments, and will discuss the pricing theories of forwards, futures, options, and swaps, as well as their applications and operations in different situations.
zh_law_content: 本课程将介绍金融工具对冲 定价及设计的相关技术 并将讨论远期 期货 期   权及互换的定价理论以及它们在不同场合下的运用及操作

law_content: Risk Management and Insurance is an important discipline in the field of economics. Principles of Insurance is the introductory course of this discipline. It introduces the basic principles of risk management, insurance, and social security. The main teaching content of this course includes risks and risk management, insurance system, insurance contracts, insurance market, life insurance, property insurance, insurance company operations and management, social insurance, etc. The purpose of offering this course is to guide students in systematically mastering the basic principles of insurance, understanding insurance products, insurance companies, and insurance markets.
zh_law_content: 风险管理与保险学 是经济学领域的一个重要学科 而 保险学原理 则是该“ ”  《 》学科的专业入门课程 它介绍风险管理 保险与社会保障的基本原理 本课程  的主要教学内容包括 风险与风险管理 保险制度 保险合同 保险市场 人身：    保险 财产保险 保险公司经营管理 社会保险等 开设本课程的目的是为了   引导同学们系统掌握保险学的基本原理 理解保险产品 保险公司和保险市场

law_content: Risk management is a science that studies how to respond to future uncertainties. This course first teaches the principles of risk, explaining the nature of risk, the cost of risk, and the procedures and objectives of risk management. Then, it analyzes the risks of property damage, legal liability, human capital, and financial risks faced by enterprises. Based on this analysis, it introduces commonly used risk decision models and explains in detail the mechanisms of insurance and hedging, two important risk management measures, as well as other factors that influence enterprise risk management. Finally, it discusses some practical applications of risk management.
zh_law_content: 风险管理是研究如何应对未来不确定性的一门科学 本课程首先讲授风险原理 说明风险的本质 风险的成本以及风险管理的程序与目标 然后对企业面  临的财产损毁风险 法律责任风险 人力资本风险和金融风险进行风险分析  在此基础上 介绍常用的风险决策模型 并详细解释保险和套期保值这两类重 要风险管理措施的机制以及影响企业风险管理的其他因素 最后 讲解风险 管理的一些实践应用

law_content: Insurance economics is a discipline that uses general economic theory to study issues related to the insurance field. The "Introduction to Insurance Economics" course aims to introduce the basic concepts of insurance economics and discuss major issues in insurance theory and practice based on domestic and international cutting-edge research achievements. It helps students deepen their understanding of insurance principles, gain a preliminary grasp of the method of systematically analyzing insurance issues using normative economic models, and stimulate their research interests.
zh_law_content: 保险经济学是用一般经济理论来研究有关保险领域问题的一门学科 保险 “经济学导论 课程主要是希望通过介绍保险经济学的基本概念以及国内外前”沿研究成果 探讨保险理论与实践的重大问题 帮助学生加深对保险原理的理 解 初步掌握用规范的经济学范式系统分析保险问题的方法 激发学生的研究 兴趣

law_content: This course is mainly targeted towards undergraduate students majoring in risk management and insurance, teaching the application of actuarial science in survival models and life insurance products, while also covering some non-life actuarial topics. The course aims to introduce several typical life insurance products and calculate issues related to premiums and reserves, enabling students to gain a deeper understanding of the operational methods of life insurance companies. The non-life section of the course focuses on principles and introductions, allowing students to develop a preliminary understanding of non-life insurance companies.
zh_law_content: 本课程主要面向风险管理与保险专业本科生讲授精算学在生存模型和寿险产品里的应用 兼顾部分非寿险精算 本课程希望通过介绍几种典型的寿险险 种以及一些寿险险种的保费和准备金的计算问题 使得同学们能够进一步掌握寿险保险公司的运营方式 本课程的非寿险部分着重在原理和介绍方面 令同学们对非寿险公司产生初步的了解

law_content: This course is applicable to majors in economics and management and aims to enable undergraduate students to learn and master professional knowledge in financial enterprise accounting. It also aims to cultivate students' practical operational abilities in financial enterprise accounting, accounting statement preparation, and financial statement analysis. Its prerequisite course is Principles of Accounting.
zh_law_content: 本课程适用于经济学 管理学相关专业 旨在让本科学生学习掌握金融企业会 计方面的专业知识 培养学生在金融企业会计核算 会计报表编制以及财务报 告分析方面的实际操作能力 其先修课程是 会计学原理

law_content: Social insurance is one of the core courses in the fields of finance and insurance. This course mainly introduces the emergence and development of social " " insurance, the connotation and extension of social insurance, population prediction methods, and the impact of population aging on social insurance. The course also covers the ability of pay-as-you-go and funded systems to address the issue of population aging and their impact on savings. Additionally, the course covers the financing and investment of social insurance funds, and specifically introduces insurance projects such as pension insurance, healthcare insurance, unemployment insurance, accident insurance, and maternity insurance. By studying this course, students can accurately grasp and apply the basic theory and knowledge of social insurance, become familiar with the development process and reform of typical national social insurance systems, master the classical models and literature in the field of social insurance, and be able to use the learned theories and policies to interpret and analyze the hot and difficult issues in China's social insurance and social security field.
zh_law_content: 社会保险 是财政学专业和保险专业的主干课程之一 本课程主要介绍社会“ ” 保险的产生与发展 社会保险的内涵和外延 人口预测方法以及人口老龄化对 ；社会保险的影响 现收现付制和基金制解决人口老龄化问题的能力和对储蓄；的影响 社会保险基金的筹资与投资 并专题介绍了养老保险 医疗保险 失业； ；  保险 工伤保险 生育保险等保险项目 通过学习该课程 学生能准确掌握和运用社会保险的基本理论和知识 熟悉典型国家社会保险制度的发展历程及其改革等内容 掌握社会保险领域的经典模型和文献 并能运用所学的理论和 政策解释和分析我国社会保险和社会保障领域的热点和难点问题

law_content: Public finance is an economic branch that studies the government's revenue and expenditure activities and their impact on resource allocation and income distribution. It mainly includes the welfare economics foundation of public finance, market failures and fiscal functions, public choice in budget planning, basic theories of taxation and tax systems, theories of public expenditure, theories of public debt, and coordination of the relationship between central and local finance.
zh_law_content: 财政学是研究政府收支活动及其对资源配置与收入分配产生影响的经济学分支 主要包括 财政学的福利经济学基础 市场缺陷与财政职能 预算方案的公 ： ； ；共选择 税收基本理论与税收制度 财政支出理论 公债理论 中央和地方财政； ； ； ；关系的协调等内容

law_content: Welfare economics is an important branch of modern economics. In broad and essential terms, it is a theory of choice for a social "way of life" that attempts, in a realistic spirit, to answer an imaginative question: how should a society as a whole organize its social life, given the given human nature, material conditions, and historical cultural conditions, in order to maximize the well-being of each member of society? A more rigorous and explicit definition is that welfare economics is the scientific study, using the methods of economics, of how to define social welfare based on individual welfare, as well as how to arrange social systems and employ public policies reasonably to enhance social welfare. This course is a compulsory course for undergraduate students majoring in finance in the School of Economics. It aims to introduce the basic principles and perspectives of modern welfare economics, as well as address a series of major issues facing the world today.
zh_law_content: 福利经济学是现代经济学之一重要分支 从广义和本质上讲 它是一种 社会  “生活方式的选择理论 它试图本着现实精神回答一个极具想象力的问题 即”  在给定的人性 物质和历史文化条件下 作为一个整体的社会应当以怎样的方 式来组织其社会生活 以最大限度地促进每个社会成员的幸福 一个更严谨 而明确的定义是 福利经济学是以经济学的方法 来研究如何在个体福利的基 础上定义社会福利 以及如何合理地安排社会制度和运用公共政策来增进社会福利的科学本课程为经济学院财政系本科生的专业必修课 旨在通过对现代福利经济学的基本原理与观点的介绍 以及对当今世界所面临的一系列重大问题的

law_content: The course content is divided into three parts: descriptive statistics, probability fundamentals, and inferential statistics. Descriptive statistics include the collection and organization of statistical data, as well as the calculation and analysis of statistical data. Probability fundamentals cover the basic theory of probability and probability distributions. Inferential statistics include parameter estimation, hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, statistical decision-making, regression analysis, and correlation analysis. In addition, there are also basic descriptive methods in economic statistics, such as statistical indices and time series analysis.
zh_law_content: 课程内容分三大部分 描述统计学 概率基础 推论统计 描述统计包括 统： ； ；  ：计数据的搜集和整理 统计数据的计算和分析 概率基础包括 概率与概本分 ； ：布的基本理论 模型和运算 推论统计包括 参数估计 参数检验 方差分析 统 ； ：   计决策 回归和相关分析 另外 还有一些经济统计的基本描述方法 如统计   指数 时间数列分析等

law_content: The budget is a series of plans and reports that reflect the government's projected financial management situation, with the annual income and expenditure plan as the core. It encompasses the principles, methods, policies, etc. of budget formulation and serves as a guiding document for the operation of the country. Once approved, all departments must strictly implement it. In nature, the budget is a legally binding document. In form, the budget is the annual financial income and expenditure plan of the country. In content, the budget reflects the process of the government's centralized allocation of financial resources. In terms of function, the budget is an important means for the country's macroeconomic regulation and promotion of social development. In terms of procedure, the budget is formed through political procedures. In terms of its relationship with finance, the budget is the mechanism and basic institutional framework for financial operation. A good budget system is a necessary guarantee for a country's stable and healthy development. It includes a complete information disclosure mechanism that allows the public to understand what the government has done and what it is preparing to do, enhancing understanding and trust in the government. It also requires a complete budget process and sound budget management system to supervise and control the formulation, implementation, audit, and evaluation of the budget. Budget economics is an approach to viewing the budget from an economic perspective, using economic research methods to solve problems that arise in the budget formulation and implementation process, and analyzing and understanding the role, mechanisms, principles, and connections with various aspects of the budget in the overall national economic system. This also requires us to use economic means to improve the process of budget formulation, such as how to make it more reasonable.
zh_law_content: 预算就是以年度收支计划为核心的 反映政府未来预计财政经营状况的一系列计划和报表 它同时涵盖着预算编制的原则 方法 政策等 是国家运作的指   导性文件 一经通过 各部门都必须严格执行  从性质上看 预算是具有法律效力的文件 从形式上看 预算是国家的年度财政收支计划 从内容上看 预算体现了政府集中分配财力的过程 从作用上看 预算是国家宏观调控和促进社会发展的重要手段 从程序上看 预算是通过政治程序形成的 从与财政的关系上看 预算是财政运行的机制及其基本制度框架 一个好的预算体系是一个国家平稳 健康发展的必要保证 它同时包含着 一套完整的信息披露机制 可以让百姓了解政府这一年做了什么 准备做什 么 增强对政府的了解和信任 它同时要求有一套完整的预算流程以及健全 的预算管理制度 监督和控制预算的编制与执行 审计与评价  预算经济学就是以经济学的角度去看预算 用经济学的研究方法解决预算的编制和执行过程中出现的问题 利用经济学的思维方式去剖析和理解预算在整个国民经济体系的运作过程中所起到的作用 与各方面的联系 作用的 机制和原理 这同时要求我们利用经济手段完善预算编制的过程 如何更合理

law_content: This course is an introductory course on insurance law, focusing on the law of insurance contracts. It is designed for students in the field of economic management and provides a brief introduction to the civil and commercial legal system, the basic principles of contract law, and some insurance regulatory laws. This course aims to help students in insurance and other related economic management fields understand the basic principles of insurance contracts and the legal relationships between various parties involved in insurance. It is suitable for students who wish to enter the insurance industry in the future or work in fields such as securities, consulting, investment, regulation, social insurance management, and academic research related to insurance.
zh_law_content: 本课程是保险法的入门课程 主要内容是保险合同法 并针对经济管理类学生 简要介绍民商法体系 合同法基本原理 及部分保险监管法 本课程帮助保险  专业及其他经济管理相关专业学生了解保险合同的基本原理 及保险各方主体之间的法律关系 课程适合于希望今后加入保险行业 或者从事与保险相 关的证券 咨询 投资 监管 社会保险管理 学术研究等方面工作的同学

law_content: This macroeconomics course primarily studies economic growth, business cycles, currency, inflation, government policies, unemployment, and asset pricing. The prerequisite knowledge for this course is intermediate microeconomics. Students are also required to have a basic understanding of algebra and calculus. This is not an easy course, so please be prepared.
zh_law_content: 这门宏观经济学课程主要研究经济增长 商业周期 货币 通货膨胀 政府政   策 失业和资产定价等 本课程的先修知识是中级微观经济学 本课程还要  求学生具备基本的代数和微积分知识 这不是一门容易的课程 所以请做好 准备

law_content: This course is a compulsory course for undergraduate students at the School of Management, Guanghua. It systematically teaches the basic theories and methods of marketing, as well as the dynamics and development trends of marketing in the era of social media and mobile internet. Based on the customer value framework, the course introduces how marketing in the mobile internet era creates customer value and obtains value returns. The main content includes customer value-oriented marketing concepts and strategies, discovering customer value, designing and delivering customer value, and obtaining value returns.
zh_law_content: 本课程为光华管理学院本科必修课 将系统地讲授营销学的基本理论与方法 以及在社交媒体和移动互联时代市场营销的动态与发展趋势 本课程以顾客价值框架为基础 系统介绍移动互联时代营销如何创造顾客价值和获取价值回报 其主要内容包括顾客价值导向的营销理念与战略 发现顾客价值 设计 ； ；与传递顾客价值 获取价值回报

law_content: This course is an introductory course on corporate finance, introducing basic concepts and techniques for establishing a framework for financial decision analysis. The course content can be divided into two parts: introducing concepts such as returns and risks, investment portfolios, and market efficiency, and covering basic concepts and techniques such as the Capital Asset Pricing Model. It also covers capital budgeting decisions and capital structure decisions. The second part of the course focuses on important corporate finance decisions such as mergers and acquisitions and real options.
zh_law_content: 本课程为公司理财的初级课程 介绍基本观念与技术 建立财务决策之分析架 构 课程内容可分成两部分 介绍报酬与风险概念 投资组合 市场效率 ：１．   资本资产定价模型等基本观念与技术 介绍资本预算决策 资本结构决策；２．  并购决策与实物期权等公司重要理财决策

law_content:
In the process of enterprise operation and development, data modeling and decision-making play a vital role. The purpose of this course is to enable students to grasp the basic principles and methods of management science related to data modeling and decision-making, cultivate the ability to think scientifically in management, and proficiently apply computer techniques to solve data management models. It aims to develop the ability to solve decision-making problems commonly faced in enterprise management. 

Part 1: Methods of data and information management, including database systems, computer languages, data mining platform construction, and object-oriented programming (OOP). 

Part 2: Operations research and linear programming, with a focus on graphical method, simplex method, modeling, and computer-based problem-solving. It also introduces the concept of dual programming, shadow prices, and integer programming. Students will learn modeling and computer-based problem-solving techniques. Nonlinear programming is also briefly introduced. Classroom lectures, discussions, case studies, and practical exercises will be conducted.

Part 3: Graph and network analysis, including minimum spanning tree, shortest path, maximum flow, minimum cost maximum flow, traveling salesman problem, and Chinese postman problem. Students will learn to establish corresponding linear programming models and solve them using computers. Classroom lectures, discussions, case studies, and practical exercises will be conducted.

Part 4: Decision theory, including decision rules, risk decision-making, decision trees, utility functions, and decision analysis. Case studies will be conducted, and computer-based problem-solving techniques will be utilized.
zh_law_content: 在企业运营与发展过程中 数据 模型与决策起着至关重要的作用 本课程教  学目的旨在 使学生掌握与数据 模型与决策相关的管理科学的基本原理和方： 法 培养科学管理的思维能力 以及熟练应用计算机管理数据 求解模型的技；  能 解决企业经营管理中经常需要面对的决策问题的能力； 第一部分 数据信息的管理方法数据信息与企业运营 数据库系统 计算机语言 模型 数据挖掘平台构建  ＯＯＰ  第二部分 规划论线性规划 本部分的重点 图解法 单纯形法 建模 用计算机解题 对偶规：     划 本部分的重点 对偶规划的概念 影子价格 整数规划 学会建模 用计算：    ： 机解题 介绍非线性规划 课堂讲解讨论 案例分析及上机实习   第三部分 图与网络分析：最小生成树 最短路 最大流 最小费用最大流 旅行商问题与中国邮递员问题   简介 建立相应的线性规划模型并用计算机求解 课堂讲解讨论 案例分析  及上机实习第四部分 决策论：决策法则 风险决策 决策树 效用函数与决策 案例分析并用计算机求解

law_content: This course mainly covers the nature of microeconomics, demand and supply, consumer behavior and market demand, firms and technology and costs, market structure, prices and output, market inputs, general equilibrium, welfare economics and political economics, time choices, etc. This course will be taught with case studies, focusing on the application of microeconomics.
zh_law_content: 本课程主要讲授微观经济学的性质 需求与供给 消费者行为与市场需求 厂  商 技术和成本 市场结构 价格和产量 市场投入 一般均衡 福利经济学和政－     治经济学 时间选择等 本课程将配合案例开展教学 注重微观经济学的应用

law_content: Accounting is the language of business. Accounting information should comprehensively and objectively reflect the financial condition and operating results of a company. It impacts the interests of investors, creditors, and operators, as well as the overall economic order of society. This course introduces the basic theory of accounting, basic methods, and their application in practice. The course content includes the structure and preparation of the balance sheet, income statement, and cash flow statement, conveying the basic information of the company's operations, as well as cost accounting, break-even analysis, budget management, performance evaluation, auditing, etc. From the perspective of accounting information users, the course emphasizes the correct decision-making by using accounting information.
zh_law_content: 会计是商业活动的语言 会计信息应全面客观地反映企业财务状况和经营成果 它影响到投资者 债权人 经营者的利益 也影响到整个社会的经济秩序    本课程介绍会计的基本理论 基本方法及其在实务中的运用 课程内容包括资产负债表 收益表与现金流量表三张报表的结构与编制 三张报表传达的企 ；业经营的基本信息 以及成本核算 本量利分析 预算管理与业绩评价 审计等   内容 课程从会计信息使用者的角度出发 着重考虑报表使用者利用会计信 息作出正确的决策

law_content: Business data analysis cannot be separated from analysis tools. Commonly used data analysis tools include Python, Matlab, and R. This course teaches the most commonly used programming and data analysis tools in the field of data science, specifically Python. The course covers three main aspects: language introduction, basic programming conventions and Python basics; the use of modules related to business analysis; and practical application of business data analysis using Python. Throughout the programming lessons, interesting case studies on business data analysis will be incorporated, covering data preprocessing, exploratory data analysis, data visualization, variable construction, model building, and model evaluation.
zh_law_content: 商务数据分析离不开分析工具 常用的数据分析工具有 等 ＰｙｔｈｏｎＭａｔｌａｂＲ 本课程学习数据科学领域中最常用的编程和数据分析工具 具体而Ｐｙｔｈｏｎ言 本课程主要涉及三方面内容 第一 语言介绍 基本编程规范和编  Ｐｙｔｈｏｎ 程基础 第二 中与商业分析相关的模块使用 第三 商务数据分； Ｐｙｔｈｏｎ ； Ｐｙｔｈｏｎ析实战 在讲述编程的过程中 会穿插有趣的商务数据分析案例 覆盖数据预  处理 探索性数据分析 数据可视化 构建变量体系 建立模型和模型评估全过   程

law_content: This course mainly focuses on studying basic econometric models and estimation methods. We primarily concentrate on linear regression models and also analyze time series, panel data, instrumental variables, and discrete choice models.
zh_law_content: 本课程主要对基本的计量模型和估计方法进行研究 我们主要专注于线性回归模型 同时对时间序列 面板数据 工具变量和离散选择模型进行分析

law_content: A summary of the principles of economics can be divided into two parts: macroeconomics and microeconomics. It includes consumer theory, firms' theories, general equilibrium, monopolistic competition, industry, inflation, economic growth, government intervention, monetary policy, fiscal policy, etc. The goal is to understand and master the basic concepts of modern economics, grasp the basic framework and analytical logic of this discipline, and apply economic principles to observe, analyze, and explain relatively simple and typical economic phenomena and problems in real life.
zh_law_content: 概括介绍经济学原理 包括宏观经济学和微观经济学两部分 消费理论 厂商  理论 一般均衡 垄断竞争 实业 通货膨胀 经济增长 政府作用 货币政策 财       政政策等 理解和掌握现代经济学的最基本概念 了解这一学科的基本构架 和分析逻辑 并能够运用经济学原理观察 分析和解释现实生活中比较简单和 典型的经济现象和问题

law_content: Emphasize mastering contemporary tools for macroeconomic analysis to examine issues related to China's macroeconomic policies and current situation, including the determination of national income, output, employment, and price levels. Also, discuss economic models such as neoclassical, Keynesian, and monetarism, with a foundation in calculus knowledge. The topics to be explored will predominantly include economic growth, business fluctuations, inflation, and the interaction between real and monetary aspects.
zh_law_content: 强调掌握当代宏观经济学分析工具 探讨中国宏观经济政策和现状的有关问题 包括国民收入 产出 就业和价格水平的决定 同时也讨论新古典 凯恩    斯 货币主义等经济模型 需有微积分知识基础 探讨的议题将主要包括 经   ：济增长 景气波动 通货膨胀 实质面与货币面之间的互动关系等

law_content: This course provides intermediate level instruction on the basic knowledge of economic decision-making by microeconomic agents and the role of markets in resource allocation. The course first examines the decision-making of consumers and firms under conditions of perfect competition. It then introduces general equilibrium theory and discusses the welfare economics implications of competitive equilibrium. Finally, it explores several situations where market mechanisms fail to lead to efficient resource allocation, including imperfectly competitive market structures, the presence of externalities, the provision of public goods, and information asymmetry in economic transactions. This course is an important compulsory course for students majoring in economics.
zh_law_content: 本课程以中级程度讲授有关微观主体的经济决策和市场在资源配置方面作用的基本知识 本课程首先在完全竞争市场条件下 讨论消费者和厂商的决策 问题 然后介绍一般均衡理论 以及竞争均衡的福利经济学意义 最后转向  讨论市场机制不能导致有效资源配置的几种情况 即 不完全竞争的市场结 ：构 外部性的存在 公共品供给 以及经济交易中的信息不对称 本课程为经   济学专业的重要必修课程

law_content: This course will focus on introducing and analyzing topics related to the Chinese economy, with a main theme of driving economic development through institutional reform. The course will particularly emphasize the achievements and challenges faced by the Chinese economy since the reform and opening-up period. Students taking this course are required to have a general understanding of the Chinese economy, and on this basis, gain a deeper understanding of certain aspects. The instructor hopes to offer his/her insights on the phenomena of the Chinese economy for students' reference, discussion, and criticism. Furthermore, the instructor encourages students to present their own observations and perspectives, in order to collectively enhance their interest in and analytical abilities regarding issues in the Chinese economy.

law_content: This course will introduce the latest advances in political science, addressing cutting-edge issues in domestic and international political research. It will explore prominent schools of thought and important scholars in the field, focusing on fundamental questions such as politics, the state, government, governance, power, authority, rights, and legitimacy. The course will also highlight the latest research findings in areas such as freedom, democracy, equality, justice, rule of law, and human dignity - fundamental political values for humanity. Additionally, the course will briefly introduce important controversial topics in domestic and international political science, such as debates on national sovereignty, universal values, common values, the Chinese model, civil society, citizens' rights, and political legitimacy. It will also cover popular trends in domestic and international political science, including neoliberalism, neoconservatism, neo-Marxism, new authoritarianism, social democracy, and communitarianism.

law_content: This course is a specialized discussion on the principles of philosophy. It consists of three parts: an overview, basic principles, and the history of philosophy. The main part discusses the four fundamental principles of metaphysics, epistemology, ethics, and aesthetics, categorized according to theoretical philosophy and practical philosophy. The overview section explores the concepts of philosophy, the scope of philosophy, the relationship between philosophy and language, and the value of philosophy. The history of philosophy section mainly introduces the basic trends in Western philosophy and the most prominent schools of contemporary philosophy. The lecturer aims to provide students with an objective, comprehensive, and systematic understanding of Western philosophy through this panoramic description.

law_content: Abstract algebra, also known as modern algebra, is one of the important foundations of modern mathematics. It has wide applications in computer science, information and communication, physics, chemistry, and other fields. It is a compulsory course for various majors in higher education institutions. This course studies the structure theory of groups, rings, and fields, which are the three basic algebraic structures. The main topics include the basic structure theory of groups, permutation groups, group actions on sets and their applications in counting, theorem of finite generated groups, properties of solvable groups, the basic theory of rings including Sylow theory, the Chinese Remainder Theorem and its applications, factorization theory of rings, field extensions, basic theory and applications of finite fields, module theory, and an introduction to various theories.

law_content: Geometry and its exercise classes are the first geometry courses offered to all undergraduate students and some Yuanpei Experimental Class students at the School of Mathematical Sciences at Peking University. It is one of the most important foundational courses in our school. The course is responsible for nurturing students' geometric thinking and enhancing their geometric skills. It primarily introduces the theory of analytic geometry in three-dimensional space and also incorporates basic geometric ideas such as geometric invariants and the relationship between groups and geometry. It uses algebraic methods to discuss the geometric properties and invariants of space curves and surfaces, organically linking graphical representations and equations. The specific content includes vector algebra, planes and lines in space, properties of surfaces, coordinate transformations, simplification and properties of quadratic curve equations, orthogonal transformations and affine transformations, projective planes and projective transformations. Therefore, this course extends and expands the knowledge of plane analytic geometry for students, while also laying a solid foundation for multi-variable calculus and physics courses in the undergraduate stage.

law_content: In the past decade, the demand for parallel and distributed computing has experienced explosive growth. Through this course, students will gain a systematic understanding of the basic theories, programming methods, and applications of parallel and distributed computing in computer science and data science, thereby enhancing their abilities in algorithm design, programming, and application.

law_content: Theoretical Mechanics is a course in the physics department that is typically the first theoretical physics course encountered by undergraduate students majoring in physics. It serves as the foundation for several subsequent theoretical physics courses. The course primarily focuses on the methods of analytical mechanics, including the teachings of Lagrange, Hamilton, and Hamilton-Jacobi. These methods are then applied to a wide range of dynamical systems, including simple particle systems, systems with constraints and multiple degrees of freedom, and rigid bodies. Additionally, the course briefly introduces mechanics of continuous systems, such as classical mechanics of continuous media and classical field systems. This coursework provides a solid foundation for future courses, such as fluid mechanics and classical electrodynamics.

law_content: Electrodynamics is an important foundational theoretical course in the field of physics. It systematically explains the fundamental laws governing electromagnetic motion, the basic properties of electromagnetic fields, and their interactions with charged particles. The course also includes an introduction to special relativity, covering topics such as momentum and energy of electromagnetic fields, the motion of electromagnetic fields, described by Maxwell's equations and the Lorentz force formula. The course explores the application of separation of variables, electrostatic imaging, and Green's function methods in static electric and magnetic fields. It introduces the concept of gauge transformation and gauge invariance in electromagnetic fields, elucidating the physical significance of retarded solutions. Furthermore, it discusses the propagation and radiation of electromagnetic waves and the interaction between moving charged particles and electromagnetic fields. The historical background and practical basis for the development of special relativity are presented, along with the basic theory of relativity and Lorentz transformations. Finally, the course explores the propagation, dispersion, and dissipation of electromagnetic fields in media.

law_content: This course is an introduction to non-relativistic quantum mechanics, which systematically presents the principles governing the motion of microscopic particles. The content includes the basic concepts of quantum mechanics, wave functions, superposition principle, Schrödinger equation, operator representation and transformation of mechanical quantities, symmetry and conservation laws, uncertainty principle, and spin. The course also covers specific applications, handling techniques, and approximate equations for the motion of microscopic particles, including stationary perturbation theory, quantum transitions, scattering, and many-body problems. Through this course, students will comprehensively understand the characteristics of microscopic particle motion, particularly the understanding of wave-particle duality, and gain a thorough understanding of the techniques and methods used in the study of microscopic particle motion. The birth of quantum mechanics, including the maturity and crisis of physics at the end of the century, is also discussed, leading to an analysis of the crisis and the emergence of quantum theory, which successfully explains phenomena such as photoelectric effect, blackbody radiation, and atomic energy levels. The specific content covered includes the history of quantum theory, wave functions and the Schrödinger equation, including the statistical interpretation of wave functions and the introduction of quantization and operators. The description of states in coordinate and momentum spaces and the representation of operators are introduced, as well as the introduction of the one-dimensional stationary state problems and their solutions, operator representation of mechanical quantities, representation transformations, and the time evolution of mechanical quantities, central force problems, particle motion in electromagnetic fields, description of spin, algebraic methods in quantum mechanics, perturbation theory, non-perturbative methods, quantum transitions, scattering problems, hydrogen molecule structure, etc.

law_content: This course covers the basic knowledge and fundamental theories of solid-state physics, aiming to enable students to understand and master the fundamental concepts of solid-state physics and problem-solving methods, laying a solid foundation for further study, research, and practical work. The course content includes the various types of solid structures, crystal structures, lattice vibrations, the thermal properties of crystals, defects in solids, phase transitions, the free electron theory of metals, band theory, the motion of electrons in electric and magnetic fields, and the transport properties of solids. This course also partially covers some relatively specialized and currently important and active areas, such as semiconductor physics, superconductivity physics, surface physics, disordered systems, and the physics of low-dimensional and mesoscopic systems.

law_content: Modern physics experiments are comprehensive experimental courses offered to senior physics majors. They are divided into two parts: Modern Physics Experiment I and Modern Physics Experiment II, mainly offered in the spring and fall semesters respectively. These experiments cover a wide range of fields, including atomic and molecular physics, nuclear detection technology and applications, lasers and modern optics, vacuum and thin film manufacturing, X-ray electron diffraction and structural analysis, magnetic resonance, microwave, low temperature and superconductivity, semiconductor physics, nonlinear optics, and other areas. Many experiments represent milestone achievements in the development of modern physics and have won Nobel Prizes. They are representative in terms of experimental methods and techniques and also incorporate the scientific research achievements of our faculty. In recent years, advanced research-level large-scale instruments have been introduced, increasing the inclusion of experiments reflecting the forefront of physics. The experimental arrangements allow students to experience various modern physics experiments commonly using techniques such as spectroscopy, vacuum, nuclear detection, low temperature, scanning probes, and weak signal detection. Each experiment also has a certain amount of physics content to enhance students' ability to connect theory with practice and solve real-world problems. Students are required to perform independent experiments in different fields each semester. In the 7th semester, students with excellent grades in the first semester are allowed to choose open research-type frontier physics experiments.

law_content: The modern physics experiment is a comprehensive experimental course for senior physics students. It is divided into two parts: modern physics experiment 1 and modern physics experiment 2, which are offered in the spring and autumn semesters, respectively. The content includes atomic and molecular physics, nuclear detection techniques and applications, lasers and modern optics, vacuum and thin film preparation, X-ray and electron diffraction and structural analysis, magnetic resonance, microwave, low temperature and superconductivity, semiconductor physics, nonlinear physics, and other independent experimental projects in the field of modern physics, as well as open research-based cutting-edge physics experiments. The experiment arrangement allows students to be exposed to commonly used techniques in modern physics experiments such as spectroscopy, vacuum, nuclear detection, low temperature, scanning probes, and weak signal detection. Each experiment also has a certain physics content to improve students' ability to connect theory with practice and solve practical problems. Students will conduct seven independent experimental projects in different fields each semester. In the second semester, students who have achieved outstanding results in the first semester are allowed to choose open research-based cutting-edge physics experiments.

law_content: Frontier Physics Experiment is a research-oriented experimental course that is offered after Modern Physics Experiment and runs in parallel with it. It is only open to students who have excelled in Modern Physics Experiment. The course lasts for one semester and carries one credit. Students who take this course are expected to devote no less than 12 hours per week to the course, with at least 6 hours dedicated to laboratory work. The course adopts a teaching model where students are guided by leading researchers to conduct topic research. Students are required to focus on cutting-edge scientific problems, reference international high-level research literature, replicate the experimental work described in the selected literature, and provide a comprehensive evaluation of the validated work. Furthermore, students are encouraged to closely collaborate with their supervisors and aim to achieve innovative research outcomes. The final grade of the course is determined by the teacher's evaluation of the student's experimental notes, oral presentation, and research report.

law_content: Computational physics is an important branch of physics that utilizes computers to solve physical problems or analyze experimental results. It has relative independence but is an interdisciplinary field that intersects with theoretical physics, experimental physics, mathematics, and computer science. It plays a crucial role in the development of physics and its research goal is physics, with its core being numerical analysis, also known as numerical computation or scientific computing (in mathematics, numerical analysis is an important branch of mathematical science). Its research objects include numerical methods and related theories used to solve various mathematical problems with computers. Numerical computation and analysis hold a significant position in numerous disciplines and applications, including natural sciences, engineering, social sciences, such as physics, chemistry, materials science, life science, medicine, computer graphics, mechanics, astronomy and cosmology, atmospheric and oceanic science, nuclear science and its applications, aerospace, navigation, environmental science, engineering design and applications, economics, finance, demography, management science, etc. It is one of the three major research methods in modern science, along with theoretical analysis and scientific experimentation. Numerical computation is indispensable in many scientific and applied fields, such as theoretical design of nuclear weapons, weather forecasting and disaster warning, trajectory prediction of spacecraft, collision testing for automotive safety, design of new materials and drugs, etc. Large-scale scientific computation is closely related to national economy, national defense, and social development.

law_content: Basic Astronomy is an elective course in the Physics Department and a required course for undergraduate students majoring in Astronomy. It primarily introduces the fundamental concepts of astronomical observations, such as telescopes, celestial sphere and coordinate systems, time and calendars, celestial motions and distances. It also covers basic knowledge about planets, the solar system, stars, the Milky Way galaxy, extragalactic systems, and the structure and evolution of the universe. The course also introduces the main research methods and achievements in the field of Astronomy, laying a foundation for subsequent specialized courses.

law_content: The current international research in astrophysics is highly active and is one of the frontiers of physics. This course aims to understand several astronomical phenomena qualitatively and semi-quantitatively based on classical principles, including general relativity and quantum physics. It also seeks to comprehend the cosmic environment in which humanity exists and to appreciate the astronomical mega-science projects driven by major scientific questions as platforms for nurturing and advancing high-tech innovation, thereby promoting societal progress.

law_content: As one of the oldest natural sciences, astronomy plays an irreplaceable role in the development of human civilization. Astrophysics, which is the mainstream of astronomy and the most vibrant part of this field, is inseparable from many popular terms in the academic community, such as dark matter and dark energy, gravitational waves, black holes, and neutron stars. Several extreme environments exhibited by celestial processes provide excellent opportunities for understanding the fundamental laws of physics that cannot be simulated in terrestrial laboratories. The implementation of an increasing number of advanced space probes and observation methods beyond electromagnetism, including cosmic rays, neutrinos, and even gravitational waves, is expected to usher in a golden age of astrophysics in the 21st century. In order to adapt to this historical trend, top international universities have always regarded "Astrophysics" as a core compulsory course for undergraduate students majoring in astronomy and paid attention to popularizing astrophysics knowledge among physics students. This course, as a cornerstone foundational course, has been offered at Peking University to systematically introduce the discipline of astrophysics to undergraduate students majoring in astronomy or physics and cultivate their basic astrophysical qualities, which serves as a foundation for further learning other related courses.

The main content of the course includes macroscopic description of radiation fields: physical quantities, emission and absorption of radiation interacting with matter, transfer equations of radiation in gaseous matter, assumption of local thermodynamic equilibrium and possible deviations, line absorption of matter with radiation, compound fluorescence mechanism producing emission lines, physical mechanisms of line broadening, and how to establish stellar atmospheric models, etc.

law_content: Global climate change, such as drought, floods, heatwaves, and freezing, and natural disasters, as well as atmospheric pollution, wind power, hydroelectric power, solar energy, and other new energy developments, are having a wide and profound impact on human economy and social life. Atmospheric science focuses on the study of the Earth's atmosphere, and is a compatible discipline of theory and application. Its research aims to understand the physical, chemical, and dynamic properties of the atmosphere, including its state, phenomena, and changes, and to predict and analyze the physical processes in the atmosphere. In addition, atmospheric science also includes the interactions between the atmosphere and the land, ocean, and biosphere, and has extensive applications in various fields such as environmental science, oceanography, new energy, and human activities and daily life. Key research directions in atmospheric science currently include global climate change, extreme weather forecasting, air pollution monitoring, etc. This course is an introductory course to atmospheric science and also a physics-based elective course. It provides a concise and brief introduction to the basic concepts, research content, and methods of atmospheric science. Through this course, students can master the basic theories and methods of atmospheric science, laying a foundation for further professional study and application in daily life. The content mainly includes the Earth and its atmosphere, atmospheric radiation and greenhouse effect, atmospheric thermodynamics, cloud physics and precipitation, atmospheric chemistry and air pollution, atmospheric boundary layer, basic principles of atmospheric motion, fronts and cyclones, thunderstorms, typhoons and tornadoes, atmospheric circulation and ocean circulation, climate system and global warming, and weather forecasting.

law_content: This course teaches the principles and knowledge of atmospheric physics, including statics, thermodynamics, and radiative processes, which serve as the foundation for studying cloud physics, precipitation physics, satellite meteorology, and remote sensing. The course provides a detailed introduction and discussion on atmospheric thermodynamics and radiative processes based on the fundamentals of atmospheric statics. Atmospheric thermodynamics covers topics such as phase transitions of water in the atmosphere, isobaric processes, adiabatic processes, moist adiabatic processes, and mixing processes. It also covers the use and application of thermodynamic diagrams and static stability in the atmosphere. Atmospheric radiative processes discuss the interactions between radiation and matter, including solar radiation, longwave radiation, and radiation transmission involving scattering. Finally, the course includes a discussion on radiative balance and observations.

law_content: Meteorology is one of the many branches of atmospheric science. Meteorology is a ancient discipline with a history of thousands of years. In the 18th and 19th centuries, meteorological observation instruments were invented, and weather observations networks were established in only a few countries. In the 1930s, high-altitude observations and theoretical research laid the foundation for atmospheric dynamics and the Rossby wave weather prediction principle. In the second half of the 20th century, the development of computers promoted the advancement of numerical weather forecasting. Meteorology is also known as synoptic meteorology or large-scale meteorology, which is the science of describing or explaining weather phenomena or weather events, such as rain and snow. These weather phenomena or events occur in the atmosphere and can be described using atmospheric variables such as temperature, pressure, water vapor and its gradients, and the wind of atmospheric motion. The spatial structure and interaction of these variables change over time. These spatial structures are called weather systems. Weather systems of different scales can have decisive effects on the weather and climate of various regions.

law_content: The existing fundamentals of atmospheric physics and principles of atmospheric detection are the main foundational courses for undergraduate students majoring in atmospheric science. They serve as the basis for studying other specialized courses. The courses focus on basic theories of atmospheric physics, principles of atmospheric detection, and typical applications. Based on these two courses, small group discussions are organized, with teaching methods emphasizing student-led discussions and teacher guidance. This aims to deepen students' understanding of theoretical knowledge, familiarize them with the practical needs of scientific research, develop their problem-solving skills, and expose them to cutting-edge areas in atmospheric physics and detection. The topics covered in this course include summarizing the theories and methods of atmospheric physics and detection, latest advancements, hot and challenging issues, and prospects for the future. The course consists of a total of 11 discussion topics. Generally, there are fewer than 30 students majoring in atmospheric science. With the current small class size of less than 15 students, the students can be divided into 2 or 3 small groups. Each small group class has a duration of one week and is led by multiple frontline researchers or invited experts. Each student is required to give at least two thematic presentations, and each discussion is facilitated by one teacher.

law_content: Today's Chemistry is a compulsory course offered to freshmen majoring in chemistry at universities. The course covers inorganic chemistry, organic chemistry, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, chemical biology, applied chemistry, polymer chemistry, theoretical and computational chemistry, and other sub-disciplines of chemistry. Through typical literature reading, teacher lectures, and student discussions, students can understand the research fields, methods, and frontier developments of each sub-discipline, and have a preliminary understanding of the overall picture of the chemical discipline. At the same time, it guides students to develop the habit of proactive learning, enhances their ability to read literature, and to some extent cultivates their habit of independently consulting literature to understand the forefront of the discipline. In the classroom, students are encouraged to think independently, ask questions, and actively participate in discussions. Currently, Today's Chemistry course is organized in the form of small group lectures and discussions. Eight teachers provide relevant professional literature in advance, including required readings and optional readings, and propose several discussion questions related to the literature during the course. At the beginning of the semester, the literature and discussion topics are compiled into handouts and distributed to students. Students are divided into several small groups, each with two teaching assistants. Each teacher gives lectures on relatively fixed content, and students listen to different lectures in a predetermined order and participate in classroom discussions.

law_content: The laboratory is an important base for scientific research and talent cultivation, but it is also a place full of risks and frequent accidents, especially in chemical laboratories. Due to the use of various hazardous chemicals and electrical equipment, as well as exposure to high temperature, high pressure, vacuum, radiation, magnetic fields, and intense light, safety accidents can easily occur. Therefore, chemical experimenters should have solid knowledge and skills in laboratory safety and possess excellent safety quality. The School of Chemistry and Molecular Engineering at Peking University has always attached great importance to laboratory safety work. In order to ensure the safe and smooth conduct of chemical experiments for students, the course "Safety Technology in Chemical Laboratories" was first offered in domestic universities in 1993 as a compulsory course for chemistry majors. In 2016, this course was included in the core curriculum for chemistry majors. The teaching content of Safety Technology in Chemical Laboratories includes laboratory safety facilities, fire safety, pressure vessel safety, electrical safety, hazardous chemicals, basic safety operation in chemical experiments, personal protection during experiments, emergency handling of accidents, and laboratory hazardous waste disposal. This course covers a wide range of laboratory safety topics in science and engineering disciplines.

law_content: As an introductory course to the subject of chemistry, General Chemistry primarily introduces the basic concepts, principles, and methods of chemistry, as well as their development. The course covers a wide range of topics, including physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, inorganic chemistry, and even organic chemistry. However, these topics will be addressed in specialized courses in the future. In General Chemistry, the focus is on the form, change, structure, and properties of substances, explaining the most fundamental and universal chemical principles. The main contents include the basic laws of gases and liquids, chemical thermodynamics and equilibrium, chemical kinetics and reaction rate equations, atomic structure and quantum chemistry foundations, molecular structure and theory, crystal structure, coordination compounds, and elemental chemistry. Through the study of General Chemistry, students can not only learn the fundamental knowledge of chemistry but also understand the history and current status of the discipline, as well as the relationship between chemistry and society. They can gradually master basic methods and skills for thinking and problem-solving, cultivate the ability to think independently and solve problems, and lay a solid foundation for future learning.

law_content:
General Chemistry Laboratory is the first compulsory experimental course for undergraduate students majoring in chemistry and related fields. It is a seemingly simple but challenging course. It is both an independent course and a complementary component to the corresponding theoretical course, serving as a bridge between high school and university chemistry laboratory courses. This course mainly focuses on qualitative experiments with a few quantitative experiments. Its main objective is to help students understand the importance of experimental conditions and measurements. In addition to developing basic knowledge and skills in experiments, this course also emphasizes the cultivation of critical thinking. Students are encouraged to question and challenge existing experimental content and procedures, and through discussions with teachers, teaching assistants, and classmates, they can redesign experiments to solve problems. Through this course, students gradually learn to observe phenomena, analyze problems, and apply basic chemical principles to solve practical issues in experimental processes.

General Chemistry Laboratory classes are conducted in small groups, with each student working in the same laboratory for 16-18 experiments under the guidance of a teaching assistant. During the students' experiments, there is usually one main instructor who visits between 1-2 different laboratories to provide guidance. Each laboratory session includes three parts: pre-experiment instruction by the teacher, actual student experimentation, and classroom discussions. The teacher's explanation time is approximately 30 minutes per class, covering the basic principles, operations, precautions, safety issues, and addressing any problems from previous experiments.

law_content: This course comprehensively introduces organic chemistry, focusing on the reactions and properties of hydrocarbons, various functional groups, and general heterocyclic compounds. It covers the nomenclature, structural characteristics, physical properties, spectroscopic properties, main reaction mechanisms and applications of organic compounds, as well as the laboratory and industrial preparation methods for various compounds. The course systematically teaches the basic concepts, theories, and methods of organic chemistry, including organic reactions and reaction mechanisms, organic synthesis principles, and analytical methods of organic compounds. Through studying this course, students will acquire a systematic understanding of the core knowledge of organic chemistry, gain knowledge about the development history of organic chemistry and the trends and prospects in the frontier areas.

law_content: The organic chemistry experiment is a compulsory basic course offered to undergraduate students in the College of Chemistry and the Metallurgical College. The arrangement of the organic chemistry experiment course focuses on cultivating students' rigorous scientific attitude and good laboratory working style, enabling them to proficiently master the basic operations and skills of organic experiments, become professionals who can adapt to future development needs, and cultivate the habits of questioning, thinking, persisting in the face of difficulties, timely summarizing, and diligent communication. It aims to develop students' abilities in observation, analysis, judgment, expression, and evaluation. The teaching content of the organic chemistry experiment course includes learning basic operation techniques, learning basic reaction apparatus and feeding methods, controlling conditions, post-reaction treatment, and product purification, etc. synthesis methods.

law_content: Structural Chemistry is a core foundational course for undergraduate students in the School of Chemistry and Molecular Engineering. It is taught with two main branches: electronic configuration and geometric configuration. The course systematically teaches three theories and three types of structures: quantum mechanics theory and atomic structure, chemical bonding theory and molecular structure, and lattice theory and crystal structure. These foundations are essential for students to establish a micro-scale structural concept and principles, and to master modern characterization methods. This course is mainly designed for second-year undergraduate students. Apart from students in the School of Chemistry and Molecular Engineering, students from Yuanpei College and the School of Physics and Engineering also have the option to take this course, with an average enrollment of approximately __ students per year. The course adopts a blended teaching mode, including lectures for large classes, MOOC videos and quizzes, small-group discussions, and model experiments for building molecular and crystal structures, etc.

law_content: Physical Chemistry is a core foundational course for undergraduate students majoring in Chemistry and Materials Chemistry at our institute. The course covers the basic principles, methods, and applications of Chemical Thermodynamics, Chemical Kinetics, Electrochemistry, and Surface and Colloid Chemistry. The course achieves its objectives through classroom lectures, self-study, discussion sessions, problem-solving exercises, and examinations.

law_content: To develop good habits for graduation thesis and future scientific research work, it is important to establish a concept of "physics experiment heavily relies on physical measurement instruments and often relies on indirect measurement methods." In the arrangement of experiment content, it is essential to adhere to the preservation of classical experimental methods and measurement techniques, while guiding students to understand the development of modern measurement technology as secondary. In the data processing stage, students should be guided to gradually master computer plotting and data processing methods. During the experimental teaching process, by analyzing the design ideas of classical experiments, variable transformation, and data processing skills, students should be taught research methods and principles in physical chemistry in a general sense. At the same time, it is important to strictly control the quality of experimental reports, referring to the standards of scientific research papers, and standardize the handling and expression of experimental data as well as the analysis and discussion of results. Gradually, a scientific experimental assessment and grading system should be established and improved. Currently, the total planned class hours for physical chemistry experiments are XXX hours. The experiments include basic experiments, which are conducted in groups and in a rotating manner. Apart from building a UV-visible spectrophotometer, which requires two people to collaborate, the rest of the experiments are performed individually. The content covers the main branches of physical chemistry, including thermodynamics experiments, calorimetry techniques, phase equilibrium experiments, chemical equilibrium experiments, and the determination of other thermodynamic parameters (1). Kinetics experiments involve the determination of simple series reactions, complex reactions, and modern rapid reactions (2). Electrochemistry experiments involve cyclic voltammetry research, fuel cell characteristics, surface chemistry, and colloid chemistry (3).
