law_content: Quantitative analysis chemistry is one of the core foundational courses for students majoring in chemistry. It, along with instrumental analysis and intermediate analytical chemistry, forms a complete series of courses in analytical chemistry. Its theories and methods not only serve as the foundation for the analytical chemistry major but also for all other chemistry-related courses and professions. In addition to teaching students the basic principles and methods of analytical chemistry, it aims to cultivate their ability to engage in theoretical research and practical work, as well as to develop a rigorous scientific attitude. The course mainly targets first-year chemistry majors and is offered in both Chinese and English, allowing students to choose the language of instruction based on their needs and interests. The course covers a wide range of topics, including introduction, data statistics and analysis methods, volumetric titration methods, gravimetric analysis, molecular spectroscopic analysis methods, such as UV-Vis spectrophotometry, molecular fluorescence spectroscopy, infrared spectroscopy, and Raman spectroscopy, as well as separation methods in analytical chemistry and the approach and techniques for solving practical analytical chemistry problems.

law_content: The course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental knowledge and principles of biology, covering topics such as viruses, microorganisms, algae, terrestrial plants, protozoa, metazoans, ecology, evolutionary biology, and biodiversity conservation. It is designed for students majoring in life sciences, aiming to cultivate their overall understanding of the field of biology, knowledge of the evolutionary relationships and characteristics of various biological taxa, as well as a deep comprehension of the interactions between organisms and their environments. The purpose is to guide students to establish a correct value system regarding the relationship between humans and nature within the framework of the biological world.

Through famous research examples, I will demonstrate how to observe phenomena, propose questions and hypotheses, and validate these hypotheses through experiments, eventually leading to widely accepted theories. The specific content includes understanding the intrinsic connections among various organisms in the biological realm.

law_content: This course focuses on the chemical characteristics of major biomolecules in living organisms, including proteins, nucleic acids, carbohydrates, and lipids, as well as the chemical reactions involved in biological metabolism that provide cells with energy and building materials. law_content: Biochemical experiments are basic experimental courses that are paired with biochemical theory courses. This course is open to all undergraduate students in the School of Life Sciences, Yuanpei College, School of Chemistry and Molecular Engineering, and some undergraduate students from other colleges who are pursuing double degrees or minors. There are about [number] students enrolled in this course each academic year. The course content includes the separation, purification, quantitative measurement, and characterization of biomacromolecules. The experimental techniques involved include biomacromolecule preparation techniques, spectroscopic analysis techniques, chromatographic analysis techniques, electrophoresis techniques, and ultracentrifugation techniques, etc. The biochemical instruments used by students for learning and experimentation include centrifuges, adjustable pipettes, protein electrophoresis devices, protein semidry blotting apparatus, protein/nucleic acid detectors, spectrophotometers, and enzyme immunoassay instruments, etc. With the continuous development of biochemical theory and experimental techniques, the teaching content is constantly updated, with the addition of new technologies and the introduction of new experiments. The teaching content is subject to the teaching outline for each semester.

law_content: Genetics is a highly logical discipline with the ideas of genetic analysis permeating throughout its development history and guiding research in cutting-edge areas of the life sciences. It plays an irreplaceable role. This course starts with Mendel's laws and focuses on the structure, function, and patterns of inheritance and variation of genetic material, systematically introducing the basic principles of classical and modern genetics while also considering the development trends and hot topics in the field. Throughout the teaching process, emphasis is placed on the core ideas and methods of genetics, with a focus on developing students' abilities to analyze and solve problems. The goal is to not only provide students with knowledge of the historical development of genetics and a grasp of its basic concepts and theoretical framework but also enable them to correctly understand its relationships with other disciplines.

law_content: This course is closely integrated with the genetics course. Through the presentation of experimental design and concepts, as well as practical genetic experiments, it deepens understanding of the content taught in class and expands thinking space. This course combines experiments at the cellular chromosome level, genomic level, and functional genomic level. It includes not only classical validation experiments but also introduces modern gene function research experiments that are closely related to scientific research. First, by showcasing and teaching different model organisms such as flies, nematodes, and zebrafish, students are introduced to the importance of model organisms in genetic research. Through chromosome preparation, observation, and the introduction of Drosophila balancer chromosomes, students truly understand the role of chromosomes as carriers of genes and how genes transmit genetic information through chromosomes. Classical forward genetic validation experiments, such as a hybrid experiment, will simultaneously analyze and validate the three laws of genetics: independent assortment, segregation, and linkage. At the same time, the analysis of genetic distances between genes will be conducted. Gene interactions will be studied through genetic experiments on corn. In the modern post-genomic era, reverse genetic experiments emphasize the importance of gene mutations in studying gene function. By implementing the basic strategies of gene loss or gain of function, the purpose of studying gene phenotypes after gene mutations will be achieved. This systematic approach is known as the Swiss army knife of Drosophila genetics research. The induction of "Gal4/UAS" (Gal4/UAS (upstream activation sequence)) will be discussed.
zh_law_content: 本课程紧密配合遗传学课程而设置 通过从实验设计和理念的讲授 到实际的 遗传实验操作 加深对课堂讲授内容的理解 拓展思维的空间  本课程将细胞染色体水平 基因组水平 功能基因组水平的实验有机地融合在 一起 不仅包括经典的验证性实验 而且引入了与科研密切相关的现代基因功 能研究的实验 首先通过展示和讲授不同的模式动物 如果蝇 线虫和斑马 （ 鱼 让学生认识到模式动物的在遗传性研究中的重要性 通过染色体制备）  观察和引入果蝇平衡染色体的使用 让学生真正从实际使用的层面了解染色体是基因的载体 认识基因是如何通过染色体传递遗传信息的 经典的正向 遗传学验证性实验将通过一个杂交实验 可同时分析和验证遗传学的三大定律 基因的自由组合 分离定律 连锁定律 伴性遗传 同时分析基因间的遗（   ） 传距离 基因的互作则通过玉米的遗传实验实现 现代后基因组时代反向遗； 传学的实验 则强调基因突变对研究基因功能的重要性 通过功能丧失  （ｌｏｓｓ或者获得 的基本策略实现基因突变后研究目的ｏｆ ｆｕｎｃｔｉｏｎ） （ｇａｉｎ ｏｆ ｆｕｎｃｔｉｏｎ）基因表型的目的 系统 被称为果蝇遗传学研究的瑞士军刀 诱导“Ｇａｌ４／ＵＡＳ （ ）癌基因在果蝇中异位表达 可以实现功能获得的目的 而 利用 系统”  “ Ｆｌｐ／ＦＲＴ构建果蝇的 克隆 获得纯合突变克隆 可以实现功能丧失的目的Ｍｏｓｉａｃ （ ）” 同时传授这些系统的灵活和组合使用可以达到的不同目的 进而让学生自己设计实验 从而实现利用遗传性理念和工具在科学研究中研究基因功能的目的

law_content: This course is a supplementary discussion class for the compulsory course Genetics.
zh_law_content: 本课为专业必修课 遗传学 一课的配套讨论班

law_content: Molecular biology is the science of studying genes and their activities at the molecular level. This course will provide a comprehensive overview of the core knowledge of molecular biology from a genomic perspective. Emphasis will be placed on explaining the fundamental theories and main techniques of molecular biology, highlighting the latest advancements in genomics and proteomics research. This course values the sources of knowledge and grasps the forefront of research. While explaining systematic knowledge, it aims to provide students with research ideas on how to unravel the mysteries of life at the molecular level. The main topics include: 1. Major techniques for studying genes and their activities that have played significant roles in the development of molecular biology. 2. Prokaryotic and eukaryotic transcription and their regulation. 3. Transcriptional post-processing. 4. DNA-protein interactions. 5. Recombination and transposition of genes. 6. RNA and DNA metabolism. 7. Transcriptome and proteome and their interrelationships. Through this course, students will gain a systematic and comprehensive understanding of the basic principles of gene activity at the molecular level, while also developing their problem-solving ability and innovative thinking. This will lay a solid theoretical and technical foundation for students to apply molecular biological techniques to address important biological questions of their interest in the field of life sciences.
zh_law_content: 分子生物学是在分子水平研究基因及其活性的科学 本课程将从基因组的全局来讲解分子生物学核心知识 全面重点地阐述分子生物学的基本理论和主要技术 突出介绍分子生物学的前沿和动态 特别是基因组和白质组学研究的 最新进展 本课程重视知识来源 把握研究前沿 在讲解系统知识的同时 向   同学们提供怎样在分子水平解析生命奥秘的研究思路 其主要内容包括 ：１．研究基因及其活性的主要技术 沉淀在分子生物学发展过程中的重要事２．件 原核生物转录及其调控 真核生物转录及其调控 转录过程中３． ４． ５． ＤＮＡ与蛋白质的相互作用 的转录后加工 的重组与转座 基因６． ＲＮＡ ７． ＤＮＡ ８．组 转录组与蛋白质组及其相互关系 通过本课程的学习 使学生在分子水平  上对基因活动的基本规律有一个比较系统和全面的了解 同时培养同学们分析问题解决问题的能力和创新意识 为今后运用分子生物技术解析生命科学中自己感兴趣的重要生物学问题打下理论和技术的基础

law_content: This course aims to train students in basic experimental methods and techniques in molecular biology. Through the experimental process, students will learn the basic principles of molecular biology experiments and methods of result analysis, as well as acquire corresponding experimental skills and operational training. The course mainly includes the following parts: plasmid isolation and purification, DNA restriction enzyme digestion, DNA agarose gel electrophoresis, DNA amplification using PCR technique, preparation of competent cells of E. coli and introduction of exogenous genes, screening of DNA positive clones and induction of exogenous gene expression in prokaryotic cells, and extraction and identification of plant tissue samples.
zh_law_content: 本课程旨在培训学生分子生物学基本的实验方法和技术 在实验过程中使学生掌握基础分子生物学实验的基本原理和结果分析方法 并得到相应的实验技能和操作训练 课程主要包括以下几个部分 ：质粒 的分离纯化１． ＤＮＡ 的限制性内切酶消化２． ＤＮＡ 琼脂糖凝胶电泳３． ＤＮＡ 利用 技术扩增 基因４． ＰＣＲ ＧＦＰ 大肠杆菌感受态细胞制备及其外源 分子导入５． ＤＮＡ 阳性克隆的筛选及外源基因在原核细胞中的诱导表达６． 植物组织总 提取及鉴定

law_content: This course follows the guidance of the Science Teaching Guidance Committee and covers the fundamental knowledge and cutting-edge advancements in cell molecular biology. Supplementary reading materials are provided for important chapters. The main content focuses on the cell membrane system, cytoskeleton, organ system, and gene expression system to introduce the structure and functions of cells from a cellular biology perspective. Additionally, topics such as cell proliferation, differentiation, aging, as well as the origin and evolution of cells are also covered as fundamental knowledge in cell biology.
zh_law_content: 本课程按照理科教学指导委员会的指南 讲授细胞分子生物学的基础知识和前沿进展 并在重要章节安排课外阅读材料 主要内容以细胞的膜体系 骨架  体系和基因表达体系为框架 从细胞生物学的角度来介绍细胞的结构及其功能 同时还讲授有关细胞增殖 分化 衰老以及细胞的起源与进化等有关细胞  生物学的基本知识

law_content: Cell Biology Experiment is a basic laboratory course for undergraduate students. The aim of the course is to help students master the basic principles and operational methods of cell biology experiments through several representative experiments. Students will have the opportunity to visually observe diverse cells and their life activities, learn to record experimental results, and analyze them. The core experimental technique is microscopic imaging. The key biological concepts are the diversity of cell structure and function, as well as the adaptation between cell structure and function.
zh_law_content: 细胞生物学实验 是面向本科生的实验基础课 课程的宗旨是通过几个代表“ ” 性的实验 帮助学生掌握细胞生物学实验的基本原理和操作方法 直观观察多 样的细胞及细胞生命活动 学会记录实验结果并分析 其中最核心的实验技 术是显微成像技术 核心的生物学概念是 细胞结构与功能的多样性 及 细 “ ” “胞结构与功能相适应

law_content: With the rapid development of high-throughput biological measurement technologies, led by deep sequencing, life sciences have become a data-driven field. This course is based on the fundamentals and provides an introduction to the basic principles of bioinformatics, particularly the analysis and applications of typical -omics data, such as genomics, transcriptomics, and proteomics. It also covers cutting-edge research and publishes papers in top international journals for reading and discussion, aiming to establish a solid foundation for students' future learning and research.
zh_law_content: 随着以深度测序为代表的高通量生物学测量技术的快速发展 生命科学已经成为一门数据科学 本课程立足基础 系统介绍生物信息学领域的基本原理  特别是基因组学 转录组学 蛋白组学等典型组学数据的分析与应用 同时面向学科前沿 结合阅读和讨论发表在国际一流杂志上的论文和前沿研究成果 为同学后续的学习与科研奠定坚实基础

law_content: This course guides students to complete advanced experiments in the field of bioinformatics to help them understand the basic methods of bioinformatics experiments and cultivate their research literacy. It combines the experimental principles, design concepts, and experimental techniques of bioinformatics experiments.
zh_law_content: 本课程通过带领学生完成生物信息学领域具有代表性 先进性的实验 将生物 信息学实验的实验原理 设计思路和实验技术结合起来 帮助学生掌握生物信 息学实验的基本方法 培养学生的科研素养

law_content: This course aims to strengthen students' ability to integrate theory with practice and apply knowledge in a comprehensive way by understanding and mastering the basic life activities of microorganisms. It also aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the scope, problems, and prospects of microbiology, and to inspire them. The main topics covered in this course include pure cultivation and microscopy techniques of microorganisms, cell morphology and reproduction of microorganisms, structure and function of microorganisms, microbial nutrition, growth and control of viruses and microorganisms, and microbial genetics.
zh_law_content: 本课程使学生在了解和掌握微生物的基本生命活动规律的基础上 加强理论联系实际 综合应用知识的能力 了解微生物的应用范围 问题和前景 从而获   得较完整的微生物学基本理论和实践能力 并得到启示 本课程讲授的主要 内容有微生物的纯培养和显微技术 微生物的细胞形态与繁殖方式 微生物的 结构与功能 微生物的营养 病毒和微生物的生长及其控制 微生物的遗传等  内容

law_content: This course aims to teach undergraduate students the basic experimental techniques in microbiology, including the study of various microbial morphologies and structures, methods for isolation, purification, and cultivation, preparation of culture media, disinfection and sterilization techniques, as well as knowledge related to the physiological, biochemical reactions, growth, and preservation of microorganisms.
zh_law_content: 本课程旨在传授本科生掌握微生物学的基本实验技术 学习各类微生物的形态结构 分离纯化及培养方法 掌握培养基的配制及消毒灭菌技术 了解微生  物的生理生化反应 生长 保藏等相关知识

law_content: Research on modern biotechnology has rapidly advanced to the molecular level, with significant differences in research methods and detection techniques compared to traditional biotechnology. The focus of this course is to discuss the revolutionary changes that have occurred in various fields of biotechnology, allowing students to fully understand the similarities and differences between traditional and modern biotechnology. Moreover, modern biotechnology is a highly technical discipline that has developed on the basis of disciplines such as molecular biology, biochemistry, microbiology, and genetics. Therefore, this course will primarily focus on various application examples, introducing the common rules and principles in the application and development of modern biotechnology, as well as the principles and methods in certain special cases. This approach will enable students to learn problem-solving methods, not only understanding new technologies and advances, but also developing scientific thinking skills. It will help improve their ability to think independently and make judgments, which are essential qualities for conducting research in modern biotechnology.
zh_law_content: 现代生物技术的研究已经迅速进入分子水平 整个研究方法和检测手段都与传统生物技术有着巨大差异 这些差异决定了本课程的重点就是讨论生物技术各个领域所发生的革命性变化 让学生充分理解传统与现代生物技术的异同 另外 现代生物技术是在分子生物学 生物化学 微生物学 遗传学等学科    的基础上发展起来的一个技术性很强的学科 所以本课程将侧重以各种应用实例为素材 介绍现代生物技术应用与发展过程中所共有的一些规律 以及一 些特殊情况下的原理和方法 使学生能够学到一些解决问题的方法 不仅能了 解新技术和新进展 还能从中学到科学的思维方式 从而提高独立思考 独立  判断的能力 这种能力是从事现代生物技术研究所应具备的基本素质

law_content: This course introduces basic knowledge and latest developments in the field of biotechnology pharmaceuticals, focusing on the production of recombinant proteins, recombinant vaccines, and other biologically active proteins from a perspective of biopharmaceuticals. The course covers topics such as the basic concepts of biopharmaceuticals, the characteristics of biotechnology drugs, the principles and development process of successful biotechnology drugs, as well as their mechanisms of action and considerations in disease treatment. It also includes basic research methods in biotechnology pharmaceuticals and fundamental knowledge and advancements in major related fields such as animal cell production, genetic engineering vaccines, gene therapy, and molecular agriculture using plants as bioreactors. This course serves as an introductory course for students interested in biotechnology pharmaceuticals or aspiring to work in the biotechnology drug industry, providing a foundation for further exploration in the field of biotechnology pharmaceuticals.
zh_law_content: 本课程由浅入深地讲授生物技术制药相关的基础知识和最新进展 从生物医药的角度探讨生产重组蛋白 重组疫苗和其他生物活性蛋白的应用和基本策略 本课程的内容包括 生物药物的基本概念 生物技术药物的特点 成功的 ：  生物技术药物的原理 开发过程和对相关疾病治疗的机理和注意事项 还包括 ；生物技术药物的基本研究方法及一些主要相关领域的基本知识和进展 如动物细胞制药基础 基因工程疫苗 基因治疗 以及利用植物作为生物反应器的  分子农业相关内容等 本课程是对生物技术制药学感兴趣或将来想从事生物技术药物相关行业同学的入门课 可作为更深入了解生物技术药物相关领域的基础

law_content: Starting from basic mathematical concepts, this article introduces the process of mathematical modeling and allows undergraduate students to understand the usefulness of mathematics in biology. It nurtures their ability to think quantitatively in biology and therefore stimulates their strong interest in learning and scientific research.
zh_law_content: 从基本数理概念入手 介绍数学建模过程 让本科生体会到数学在生物学中 的用处 培养本科生对可定量化生物学的思考能力 进而调动起他们学习 科  研的浓厚兴趣

law_content: This course aims to train students to apply computational biology techniques to solve practical biological problems by introducing the major computational methods in bioinformatics research. The course content starts with the basic sequence alignment and gradually progresses to discuss cutting-edge topics such as deep sequencing data analysis and systems biology. The course provides an introduction and discussion of current research frontiers and hot topics.
zh_law_content: 本课程通过对生物信息学研究中主要计算方法的介绍 来训练学生应用计算生物学手段解决实际生物问题的能力 课程内容从基础的序列比对开始 循 序渐进 围绕深度测序数据分析 系统生物学等当前研究的前沿 热点内容进  ／行介绍与讨论

law_content: Ecology Basics and Applications is an introductory course on ecology, as well as a general education course related to ecology. Ecology studies the interrelationship between organisms and their environment. Organisms are both shaped by and shape their environments, so ecology also explores the relationships between organisms themselves. Humans are organisms, so ecology also investigates the relationships between humans and their environment, as well as between humans and other organisms. Ecology examines the forms, patterns, and underlying mechanisms of all these relationships and explores how ecological knowledge can be used to harmonize the relationship between humans and nature.
zh_law_content: 生态学基础与应用 是生态学入门课 也是关于生态学的普通教养课 生态“ ”  学研究生物与环境之间的相互关系 一生物是它生物的环境 所以生态学也 探讨生物与生物之间的关系 人类是生物 生态学还探讨人类与环境 人类与；  其他生物之间的关系 生态学探究所有这些关系的存在形式 变化规律及其 内在机理 探索如何利用生态学知识来协调人与大自然的关系

law_content: Animal biology is one of the fundamental courses in biology. It helps students grasp the basic characteristics, morphological structures, and functional relationships of the major categories involved in animal evolution. It also teaches the basic laws of animal life activities, the theory of biological evolution, important stages of biological evolution, animal geographical distribution, and their relationship with the environment. This course lays a solid foundation for subsequent studies. The main teaching contents include the basic characteristics of animals, concepts of animal tissues, organs, and systems, the distribution of basic tissues within animal bodies, their morphological structures and functions. It also covers the position of animals in biological classification, basic knowledge of animal classification, early embryonic development of animals including germ layer differentiation, types of body cavities, and animal body segmentation, as well as the progressive characteristics, adaptive features, and specialized features of key animal phyla that have significant evolutionary significance. The course also covers the process of systematic evolution and its significance in animal evolution, major animal groups representing species' classification status, the use of comparative anatomy to explain the structure and function of animal organ systems, variations and adaptive significance in evolution, understanding the basic laws of animal life activities and the unity of animal bodies. Additionally, students will learn about the history of life on Earth, important stages of animal evolution, the development of Darwin's theory of evolution and post-Darwinian evolution theory, and molecular evolution including neutral theory, microevolution, and macroevolution.
zh_law_content: 动物生物学是生物学的基础课程之一 利用课堂讲授 分组讨论等形式帮助 学生掌握动物演化过程中涉及的主要门类的基本特征 形态结构及功能的相互关系 动物生命活动的基本规律 生物进化理论及重要阶段 动物的地理分  布及与环境的关系等 为后续课程的学习奠定坚实基础 主要授课内容 动物的基本特征 动物组织 器官和系统的概念 动物基本组织： ；  ；在动物体内的分布 形态结构及其功能 动物在生物分界中的位置及动物分类 ；的基本知识 动物的早期胚胎发育 包括胚层分化 体腔类型以及动物体 分节；   等概念 具有重大演化意义的关键动物门类的进步性特征 适应性特征 特化；  特征 系统演化过程及其在动物演化中的意义 各主要门类动物重要类群 代 ； 表种的分类地位 运用比较解剖的方法 从动物的保护支撑和运动 排泄和水  盐平衡 呼吸 消化 循环 淋巴及免疫 神经 内分泌与调节以及生殖等方面讲     授动物器官系统的结构和功能在演化中的变化过程和适应意义 认识动物生命活动的基本规律和动物体的统一性 此外还要求通过本课程了解地球的生命史及动物进化的重要阶段 达尔文进化论和达尔文后进化理论的发展 以及 分子进化中性论 小进化 大进化等观点 并从生物多样性保护的角度 理解动物地理分布 区系 动物多样性及与生存环境关系等内容

law_content: Animal Biology is one of the fundamental courses in biology. The animal biology experiment aims to deepen students' understanding of animal biology theory through observations of real animals' morphology and dissections of their internal structures. It provides a comprehensive understanding of the morphology and physiological functions of various animal groups, delving into the basic principles of structures and functions that are adapted in organisms, as well as the evolutionary process from simplicity to complexity in animals. Meanwhile, it trains students' basic laboratory skills through hands-on dissection and enhances their ability to discover and observe wild animals through field observations. This lays the foundation for future biological scientific research. The teaching method primarily involves teacher-led lectures with a focus on practical student operations, supplemented with interactive multimedia, individual tutoring, and field practice.
zh_law_content: 动物生物学是生物学的基础课程之一 动物生物学实验则通过对真实动物的形态观察和内部结构的解剖来加深学生对动物生物学理论的理解 更全面地认识各个门类动物的形态 生理功能 深入了解结构与功能相适应的生命基本 规律 以及动物由简单到复杂的演化过程 同时通过动手解剖的训练来提高 学生基本实验技能 并通过野外观察任务来提高学生发现和观察野生动物的能力 为后续生物科学实验研究奠定基础 以教师讲授 学生实际操作为主要  教学方式 辅助以多媒体互动 个别辅导和野外实践

law_content: Plant biology is a comprehensive botanical course that includes traditional plant morphology, physiology, developmental biology, taxonomy, ecology, biogeography, and evolutionary biology. It introduces the growth and development, structure and function of plants, as well as the processes and outcomes of individual and systematic plant development. It systematically introduces the variation patterns and rules of different plant groups in terms of morphological structure, growth and development, reproduction, diversity, classification, and distribution, as well as their systems and evolution. The course aims to better understand and explain the relationship between the morphological structure, function, evolutionary adaptation, and diversity of plants. The teaching methods include classroom lectures, group discussions, and small topic research, aiming to cultivate and train students in the basic theory, fundamental knowledge, and basic professional skills of plant biology. It also focuses on the history and development dynamics of important theories and major discoveries in plant biology. The course emphasizes the cultivation of students' innovative thinking ability, as well as their ability to independently observe, analyze, and solve problems. It also serves the cultivation of high-quality plant biology professionals who can adapt to the requirements of modern society.

law_content: The plant biology laboratory course is a practical course offered in conjunction with the theoretical plant biology course. It is a mandatory core course for undergraduate students at the School of Life Sciences. The content of the laboratory course includes basic experiments in various branches of plant biology, such as plant cytology, plant morphology, plant taxonomy, and plant physiology. The aim is to deepen students' understanding of the fundamental theories and experimental principles of plant biology, while mastering the basic skills of plant biology experimentation. Additionally, it aims to stimulate students' interest in studying plant biology and further cultivate their scientific thinking skills to discover, analyze, and solve problems through practical application.

law_content: Signals and Systems is a core foundational course in the field of communications and signal processing. Many concepts and methods from this course are widely applied in various fields such as communication, automatic control, signal and information processing, circuits, and systems. In recent years, with the continuous development of information technology theory and applications, the concept of signals and systems has been expanding. Besides traditional disciplines, this course is influencing more and more other disciplines and fields. For the convenience of teaching and learning, this course can be roughly divided into two parts: signal analysis and system analysis. For each part, multiple effective analysis methods can be derived, including time domain analysis, frequency domain analysis, and complex frequency domain analysis. The teaching objective of this course is to enable students to understand various classical signal and system analysis methods and master some commonly used analysis methods and techniques. At the same time, through studying this course, students are expected to further understand new theories and methods related to signals and systems, providing a solid foundation for their future learning and development in the field of information technology.

It aims to help students master the theoretical framework and fundamental principles of ecology, laying the foundation for successful completion of subsequent courses and engagement in ecological research and environmental conservation work.

law_content: This course is a professional course for second-year university students, which includes the content of community ecology and ecosystem ecology. It mainly introduces the basic theories and methods of community ecology and ecosystem ecology. Through detailed analysis of the structure, function, and dynamic characteristics of communities and ecosystems, students can preliminarily grasp the basic theoretical knowledge of community and ecosystem ecology and the necessary methods for ecosystem analysis, laying a solid foundation for further scientific research and practical applications.

law_content: General Ecology is a compulsory course for undergraduate students majoring in Ecology at the School of Urban and Environmental Sciences. It mainly includes two parts: Landscape Ecology and Global Ecology. The course is divided into 15 lectures, with 4 lectures on Landscape Ecology and 11 lectures on Global Ecology. In addition, there are practical sessions arranged for both indoor and outdoor activities to introduce the basic concepts, development process, major research topics, and research methods of Landscape Ecology and Global Ecology. This course aims to provide an understanding of the fundamental principles and methods of Landscape Ecology and Global Ecology.

law_content: Botany is an important foundational discipline in biological science and a major core course in higher education biology programs. This field of study explores the morphology, structure, physiological functions, growth and development patterns of plants, as well as the relationships between plants and their environments, and the distribution patterns and evolution and classification of plants. This course includes two parts: seed plant morphology and plant experiments. The seed plant morphology section mainly covers the morphology, structure, development, and functions of seed plant tissues and major organs, as well as the connections between these organs. Through the study of this course, students will understand and master the morphology, structure, functions, and developmental processes of major organs of seed plants, including roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and seeds. By studying the relationships between different organs, students will also understand the inherent unity and coherence of plant organisms in terms of structure and function. Through the experiments in this course, students will acquire basic skills in botany, such as operating microscopes, making hand sections, creating simple mounts, bio-staining, preparing permanent slides, and biological drawing techniques.

law_content: This course is an elective course for the Environmental Science and Engineering major. Through the study of this course, students will gain a correct understanding of the basic knowledge of microbial classification, structure, and physiological activities. They will also learn about the roles and impacts of microorganisms in environmental ecology, as well as their applications in environmental pollution control engineering. The course aims to provide a foundation for further professional study and future work practice. The main topics covered in this course include the classification and cell structure of microorganisms, the general morphological characteristics of various types of microorganisms, understanding the special morphological structure and viruses of microorganisms, familiarity with bacteria, actinomycetes, cyanobacteria, eukaryotic microorganisms, and other microorganisms related to environmental engineering, the growth and reproduction of microorganisms, nutritional structure and types, metabolism and respiratory activities, the effects of environmental factors such as temperature, oxygen, toxic and harmful substances, and radiation on microorganisms, grasping the basic concepts of genetics and variation, understanding the application of genetic engineering in the environment, the role of microorganisms in natural substance cycles, understanding the use mechanisms of microorganisms in environmental pollution control, familiarity with the distribution of microorganisms and detection techniques in natural ecosystems, understanding the interactions between microorganisms, the mechanisms of microbial action on major pollutants, and the mechanisms of microbial treatment of wastewater and soil pollution.

law_content: Contemporary life sciences and medicine are heading towards the era of big data represented by high-throughput sequencing. How we model, analyze, and interpret genomic big data will determine whether we can rapidly and accurately discover new phenomena and patterns in organisms and provide precision medicine for patients. This course will introduce common data types in genomics, such as single-cell sequencing, as well as commonly used statistical analysis and visualization methods in data analysis, including exploratory data analysis, linear regression, analysis of variance, Bayesian models, data dimensionality reduction, and clustering. Genomics literature and data will be discussed in this course, and practical exercises in data analysis and visualization will be conducted using programming languages such as R.

law_content:
The basic principles and usage methods of physiological experimental instruments can be summarized as follows:

1. In order to study the biological electrical characteristics and physiological functions of excitable tissues such as nerves and muscles, stimulation signals are used to elicit responses.
2. The unique electrophysiological properties of the heart as a blood circulation pump and its relationship with cardiac physiological functions.
3. The regulation of the respiratory and cardiovascular systems by the nervous system and endocrine system.
4. The characteristics of neural innervation of visceral organs and the regulatory factors of visceral activities.
5. The characteristics of the regulation of body movements by the central nervous system, particularly the brain, and its localization in the cortex.

law_content:
An overall understanding of the experimental approaches in ecological research, the basic principles of experimental design, and the characteristics of experimental data:

1. Characteristics of Experimental Data: The data collected in ecological experiments are typically diverse and multi-dimensional, including information on individual organisms, populations, communities, and ecosystems. These data are often non-normal and exhibit spatial and temporal autocorrelation.

2. Statistical Analysis and Scientific Interpretation of Experimental Results: Experimental data in ecology require appropriate statistical analyses to identify patterns, test hypotheses, and draw conclusions. The results of these analyses provide scientific explanations and interpretations of the experimental outcomes.

Classroom instruction covers experimental designs at different levels of ecological organization, including individual organisms, populations, communities, and ecosystems. This includes specific experimental approaches such as:

2.1. Population Growth Experiments: These experiments study the population dynamics and growth rates of different species.

2.2. Molecular Ecology Experiments: These experiments investigate the genetic structure and diversity of species populations using molecular techniques.

2.3. Plant Physiology and Ecophysiology Experiments: These experiments examine the physiological and biochemical responses of plants to environmental factors.

2.4. Community Biodiversity and Productivity Experiments: These experiments focus on the diversity and productivity of ecological communities.

2.5. Experimental Control of Global Change: These experiments manipulate environmental conditions to study the impact of global change on ecosystems.

Furthermore, classic ecological experiments that have had a significant impact on ecological theory and methods are also discussed in the classroom.

3. Laboratory Skills in Experimental Ecology: Practical skills necessary for conducting ecological experiments include the cultivation and manipulation of animal and plant materials, measurement of key ecological processes, such as bird population counts, soil microbial indicators, and carbon and nitrogen cycling in ecosystems, as well as surveys of plant communities, functional traits of leaves and roots, DNA extraction, amplification, sequencing, data analysis, fish diversity analysis, measurement of photosynthesis, preparation and microscopy of plant samples, and statistical processing of survey data.

law_content: Evolutionary Biology is a required course for students majoring in Ecology. This course helps students to gain a deeper understanding of the origin of biodiversity in the biological world, the mechanisms of evolution and maintenance. Its fundamental theories include Darwin's theory of evolution, neo-Darwinism, and the neutral theory of evolution. The content covers the theories of population genetics, the theory of natural selection, genetic drift, speciation, molecular evolution and phylogenetics, microevolution and macroevolution, the relationship and distinction between ecology and evolution, human evolution, as well as the formation and conservation of biodiversity.

law_content: This course consists of six parts. The first part introduces the basic concepts of environmental science, the basic research methods, and the situation of relevant disciplines. The second part introduces the main characteristics of the Earth's environmental system from both natural and socio-human perspectives. The third part focuses on environmental pollution, primarily introducing various environmental media such as air, water, and soil. The fourth part discusses ecological issues, while the fifth part covers global environmental problems. The sixth part introduces environmental disasters and their risks. By studying this course, students can have a preliminary and comprehensive understanding of the basic features of environmental science, which will help them in future research, teaching, and practical activities in related fields. It also lays a foundation for further study in other subsequent courses in the field of environmental science.
zh_law_content: 本课程包括六个部分 第一部分介绍环境科学的基本概念 基本研究方法和相 关学科的情况 第二部分从自然和社会人文两个角度介绍地球环境系统的主；要特征 第三部分是环境污染问题 主要介绍各类环境介质 气 水 土壤 的；  （   ）环境污染 第四部分是生态问题 第五部分是全球环境问题 第六部分介绍环； ； ；境灾害及其风险 通过该课程的学习 学生可以比较初步和全面的了解环境 科学的基本特征 为未来从事相关的科研 教学和实践活动提供帮助 也可为  进一步学习环境科学领域的其他后续课程打好基础

law_name: 环境科学野外综合实习
law_content: This summer course emphasizes the combination of classroom-based teaching, simulated demonstrations, field practice, hands-on activities. Students will receive specific guidance from teachers in relevant majors, and will learn theoretical principles in the early stage of the classroom.
zh_law_content: 该项暑期课程突出将课堂基础教学 模拟效果演示与野外现场实践 动手操作 活动相结合 学生在各相关专业教师具体指导下 在前期课堂理论 原理学习

law_name: 环境科学前沿秋季讲座
law_content: The course covers various cutting-edge research areas in environmental science, including the sources and emissions of environmental pollutants, the environmental behavior and fate of pollutants, the migration and transformation of pollutants at the micro-interface, the ecological toxicity and risk of pollutants, the relationship between environmental pollution and human health, the remediation of polluted environments, the link between environmental pollution and global climate change, the environmental standards and criteria of pollutants, environmental quality monitoring, environmental economics and management, etc.
zh_law_content: 课程内容涉及环境科学的各个前沿研究领域 包括环境污染物的来源与排放 污染物的环境行为与归趋 污染物在微界面的迁移转化 污染物的生态毒性与 风险 环境污染与人体健康 污染环境的修复 环境污染与全球气候变化 污染   物的环境基准与标准 环境质量监测 环境经济与管理等

law_content: This course adopts multimedia-assisted teaching and aims to provide students with visual aids and animated demonstrations to facilitate understanding of the text. It guides students to integrate English learning with their professional studies, enabling them to master the basic English terminology, vocabulary, expressions, and writing techniques in various major fields of environmental science. This course also lays a foundation for students' future English literature reading and scientific paper writing. At the same time, it enhances students' knowledge in environmental science and engineering and improves their listening and speaking skills in professional English.
zh_law_content: 本课程教学采用多媒体辅助教学 尽可能为学生提供一些便于理解课文的图解和动画演示 引导学生将英语学习和专业学习有机地结合起来 使学生掌握 环境科学各主要领域的基本英语术语 词汇 表达方式 和写作方法 为学生今   后的英文文献阅读和英语论文写作奠定基础 同时增进学生关于环境科学与工程的专业知识 提高学生专业英语的听说能力

law_content: Atmospheric physics is a discipline that studies the physical phenomena and evolutionary laws of the atmosphere, focusing on the processes of sound, light, electricity, and radiation in the atmosphere, as well as clouds and precipitation. It encompasses the physics of the near-surface atmospheric layer, the stratosphere, and the mesosphere. It serves as both a fundamental theoretical component of atmospheric science and a major discipline within environmental science, particularly in relation to atmospheric environments.
zh_law_content: 大气物理学是研究大气的物理现象及其演变规律的学科 主要研究大气中的声 光 电 辐射过程 云和降水 近地面层大气物理 平流层和中层大气物理      既是大气科学的基础理论部分 又是环境科学 特别是大气环境的一个主要学 科

law_content: The research object of environmental science is often random phenomena influenced by numerous complex factors. Mathematical statistics methods are effective means to study these random phenomena. This course, from an applied perspective, combines research examples to systematically explain classical mathematical statistics methods. The teaching focuses on the basic characteristics of random variables, describing and testing variable size, dispersion, and distribution features. Specific topics include data preprocessing, characterization of population features, hypothesis testing for comparing sizes, hypothesis testing for comparing dispersion, distribution testing, variance analysis, and regression analysis. The biggest difference between this course and other statistics courses is that it does not focus on the derivation process of statistical methods, but rather emphasizes the application prerequisites and basic requirements of specific methods, emphasizing the correct use of corresponding statistical methods.
zh_law_content: 环境科学的研究对象多是受诸多复杂因素影响的随机现象 数理统计方法是研究这些随机现象的有效手段之一本课程从应用角度出发 结合研究实例 系统阐述经典数理统计方法 教  学以随机变量的基本特征为主线 阐述关于变量大小 离散和分布特征的描述 和检验 具体内容包括 数据预处理 总体特征表征 大小比较的假设检验 离 ：   散程度比较的假设检验 分布检验 方差分析和回归分析  本课程与其他统计课程的最大区别在于 本课程不注重统计方法的导出过程 而是特别强调具体方法的应用前提和基本要求 强调如何正确使用相应 的统计方法

law_content: This course focuses on introducing the basic concepts, components, and relationships of atmospheric environmental science. It mainly covers the processes of atmospheric pollution, climate change, ecological health effects, and environmental policies. The content involves urban haze, smog weather, Antarctic ozone hole, photochemical smog, acid rain, epidemiological investigations, and policy measures to address atmospheric pollution issues. The course is designed as an introductory course for undergraduate students to understand the research in atmospheric environmental science. Students are expected to have a basic background in higher mathematics and gain a preliminary understanding and mastery of a series of basic research techniques and scientific knowledge in the field of atmospheric environment. The course will emphasize fostering students' interest in atmospheric environmental science research, as well as their ability to apply mathematical and physical methods to analyze and solve practical problems.
zh_law_content: 本课程着重介绍大气环境科学的基本概念 体系组成及其相互关系 主要包括 大气污染过程 气候变化 生态健康效应和环境政策等方面 内容涉及城市灰  霾天气 南极臭氧洞 光化学烟雾 酸雨 流行病学调查 以及解决大气污染问    题的政策手段等本课程定位为本科生了解大气环境科学研究的入门级课程 学生应具有基本的高等数学的学习背景 并希望初步了解和掌握大气环境领域相关的一系列基本研究技术手段和科学知识 课程将重点培养学生对大气环境科学的研究兴趣以及运用数学和物理方法综合分析解决实际问题的能力

law_content:
1. The teaching objectives of the course: Environmental Biology is one of the main branches of Environmental Science, which studies the laws and regulatory mechanisms of the interactions between organisms, including humans, and the environment affected by human interventions. The teaching objectives of the course of Environmental Biology are to help undergraduate students majoring in Environmental Science establish a solid foundation in the biological aspects required by the discipline, understand the biological effects of environmental pollutants and their behaviors in ecosystems, comprehend the roles of organisms in purifying environmental pollution, understand the interactions between environmental pollutants and organisms, master the basic knowledge, basic theories, and relevant experimental skills of Environmental Biology, broaden the academic horizon and knowledge structure of students, improve their overall comprehensive quality, and lay a solid professional foundation for their future learning and work.

2. The teaching contents of the course: The course focuses on the biological effects of environmental pollution, the interactions between organisms and the environment, and the biological restoration of polluted environments. It primarily covers the basic knowledge, related theories, and research methods of the core contents. It also involves some basic knowledge and methods from traditional biology, modern molecular biology, cell biology, biochemistry, genetics, ecology, toxicology, and bioinformatics. The course combines theory, computer exercises, and experiments, using a credit distribution model of theory classes (2 credits) + computer exercises (credits) + experimental classes (credits).
zh_law_content: 一 课程的教学目标 环境生物学是环境科学的主要分支之一 是研究生物 包 ：  （括人类 与受人类干预的环境之间相互作用的规律及其调控机制的学科 环） 境生物学课程的教学目标是帮助环境科学专业本科生打下学习环境科学专业所需生物学之基础 帮助学生了解环境污染物的生物学效应及其在生态系统中的行为 了解生物在净化环境污染中的作用 理解环境污染物与生物之间的 相互作用 掌握环境生物学的基本知识 基本理论及相关的实验技能 达到帮  助学生拓宽学术视野和知识结构 提高整体综合素质 为今后学习和工作打下 坚实专业基础的目的二 课程的教学内容 课程围绕环境污染的生物效应及生态破坏作用 生 ： 物与环境的相互作用和污染环境的生物修复三个核心内容 重点讲述核心内容的基础知识 相关理论和研究方法 也会涉及传统生物学 现代分子生物学   细胞学 生物化学 遗传学 生态学 毒理学 生物信息学等学科的一些基础知    识和方法课程将理论 计算机实习与实验相结合 采用理论课 学分 计算机实  （２ ）＋习 学分 实验课 学分 模式

law_content: Energy is an important foundation for human survival and social development. Energy and the environment are important themes in global development. The generation and resolution of many environmental problems are directly related to energy consumption and structural changes. This course does not require any prerequisites and aims to help students understand the basic concepts, terms, and definitions of energy and the environment. Students will also learn about the characteristics, formation, classification, resource characteristics, and development of fossil energy and renewable energy, as well as the relationship between the utilization and development of fossil energy, renewable energy, and the environment. They will become familiar with the principles and characteristics of major energy-saving and emission reduction technologies, and understand the basic ideas of sustainable development, as well as the energy development strategies and environmental protection requirements in the process of sustainable development.
zh_law_content: 能源是人类生存和社会发展的重要基础 能源与环境是世界发展的重要主题 许多环境问题的产生和解决都与能源消耗和结构变迁直接相关 本课程 无先修课程要求 将通过课程讲授和学习 让学生了解能与环境的基本概念  术语和定义 掌握化石能源 可再生能源的特征 形成 分类 资源特性 产能发     展等 以及化石能源和可再生能源利用和发展与环境的关系 熟悉主要节能减 排技术的原理和特点 了解可持续发展的基本理念 清楚在可持续发展过程中 的能源发展战略和环境保护要求

law_content: Climate Change Science Introduction is an elective course for undergraduate students at the College of Urban and Environmental Sciences. It covers 16 lectures on the global-scale changes in Earth's system functions caused by natural factors and human activities. In recent decades, climate change, characterized by global warming, has become a prominent manifestation of global change. Climate change has had profound impacts on natural systems, such as freshwater resources, terrestrial and freshwater ecosystems, coastal areas, and marine ecosystems, as well as on human systems, such as population, economy, food security, and human health. The facts, causes, and predictions of climate change are widely concerned topics in the scientific community, while adaptation and mitigation of climate change have become core issues for sustainable socio-economic development. Therefore, this course mainly focuses on the current understanding of climate change science, its impacts on nature and socio-economic aspects, and possible strategies for adaptation and mitigation. It aims to equip students with fundamental knowledge and principles of climate change science, understanding of its impacts, and the development of basic qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques through climate change research. Ultimately, the course aims to enlighten students, clarify concepts, and cultivate an exploratory and practical spirit.
zh_law_content: 气候变化科学概论是城市与环境学院本科生的选修课 共 讲 １６ 气候变化是指由自然因素和人类活动导致的全球尺度地球系统功能的变化 近几十年来 以全球变暖为突出标识的气候变化是全球变化的重要表现  气候变化对自然系统 如 淡水资源 陆地和淡水生态系统 海岸带和海洋生态（ ：  系统等 和人类系统 如 人口 经济 粮食安全和人类健康等 造成了深刻影） （ ：   ）响 目前 气候变化的事实 成因和预测等是科学界普遍关注的前沿科学问  题 而如何适应和减缓气候变化则已成为经济社会可持续发展的核心议题 为此 本课程主要从气候变化科学认知的现状 气候变化对自然和社会经济的 影响 以及适应和减缓气候变化的可能对策 个方面系统讲授全球变化科学 ３的基本原理与方法本课程旨在使同学们掌握气候变化科学的基础知识和基本原理 了解气候变化的影响 并通过气候变化科学研究的基本定性和定量分析技术的培养 掌握气候变化科学研究的基本技能和方法论 最终达到启蒙 澄清概念和培养 学生探索求实精神的目的

law_content: Environmental issues are an interdisciplinary scientific problem that involves various fields, including environmental science and environmental engineering. However, environmental economics is a discipline that applies economic principles to solve environmental problems. It provides important information for management, planning, and policy-making. The study of environmental economics includes basic theories and methods, such as the relationship between environmental problems and externalities, economic analysis of environmental costs and benefits, estimation of economic losses from environmental pollution and degradation, methods for evaluating the effectiveness of environmental governance, and the use of economic instruments to manage the environment and develop environmental economic policies. This interdisciplinary field integrates environmental science, environmental management, environmental engineering, economics, resource science, ecology, geography, and other disciplines. It is an applied discipline that not only emphasizes the teaching of relevant theories but also emphasizes specific working methods.
zh_law_content: 环境问题是涉及许多学科的一个交叉性科学问题 与环境科学 环境工程学不 同 环境经济学是应用经济学原理解决环境问题的一门学科 它可以为管理  规划 政策制订等提供重要的依据环境经济学的研究内容主要有 环境经济学的基本理论和方法 包：（１） 括环境问题与外部性 公共商品的关系等 环境费用和效益的经济分析 ；（２） 包括环境污染和破坏的经济损失估价 环境治理效益估价的方法等 运用 ；（３）经济手段对环境进行管理 制订环境经济政策 研究如何运用税收 财政 信   贷等经济杠杆调节经济活动与环境保护之间的关系 污染者与受污染者之间的关系环境经济学是一门交叉学科 涉及环境科学 环境管理 环境工程 经济   学 资源科学 生态学 地理学等许多领域 它也是一门应用学科 不但强调教    给学生相关的理论 更强调具体的工作方法

law_content: Environmental geography is an interdisciplinary field that combines environmental science and earth science. It focuses on studying the composition, structure, formation, and evolution of the Earth's natural environment, as well as the interactions and impacts between human activities and the environment. It applies theories and methods from various branches of earth science to research environmental issues and protect the environment. As an emerging discipline, the content and discipline system of environmental geography are not yet well-defined. Currently, some relatively clear branches of this field include environmental geology, environmental geochemistry, environmental meteorology, environmental hydrology, environmental oceanography, and environmental soil science.
zh_law_content: 环境地学是环境科学与地球科学的交叉学科 它是以人类 环境系统为研究 －对象 主要研究地球自然环境的组成 结构 形成 演变以及人类活动与环境的   相互作用和影响 并应用地球科学一系列分支学科的理论和方法来研究环境问题和保护环境的学科 作为新兴学科的环境地学 其内容和学科体系尚未 定型 目前已相对明确的分支学科有 环境地质学 环境地球化学 环境地理 ：  学 污染气象学 环境水文学 环境海洋湖沼学 环境土壤学等

law_content: Environmental engineering uses sound engineering theory and practice to address environmental issues, including the control of water, soil, and air pollution, the safety of drinking water, and the disposal and recycling of wastewater and solid waste. The course content includes modules on water treatment, wastewater treatment, air pollution control, and solid waste disposal. It is primarily designed for undergraduate students in non-environmental engineering majors, with a focus on introducing the scientific principles of the main engineering methods to prevent and control environmental pollution and improve environmental quality. Through this course, students will gain knowledge and understanding of the basic principles of major pollution control methods and develop analytical and problem-solving skills for practical environmental pollution issues.
zh_law_content: 环境工程通过健全的工程理论与实践来解决环境问题 包括水 土壤和空气污 染的控制 饮用水安全 废水和固体废物的处置与循环使用等 课程内容包括  水处理 废水处理 大气污染控制和固体废物处置 个模块 主要面向非环境  ４ 工程专业的本科生开设 着重介绍防治环境污染 改善环境质量的主要工程技 术方法的相关科学原理 通过本课程的学习 认识和了解主要污染控制方法 的基本原理 培养对实际环境污染问题的分析和解决能力

law_content: Modern life highly relies on various artificially synthesized chemicals, which has also created an environment filled with chemical substances. Therefore, people are constantly exposed to chemicals through contact with air, water, food, cosmetics, building materials, and various daily products. Especially in recent years, with the rapid development of the economy, environmental pollution incidents have occurred frequently in our country, such as the melamine problem in milk and the increase in children's blood lead levels caused by heavy metal pollution. The health effects of chemical substances have attracted increasing attention from the public. Therefore, how to effectively manage chemicals and prevent them from posing threats to human health and ecological safety is a problem that governments and the scientific community are seriously considering. The United Nations first proposed the basic concept of chemical risk management, emphasizing that enterprises should conduct independent risk management based on risk assessment in 1992. Currently, risk assessment has become an indispensable means of managing chemicals in countries such as the European Union and the United States. In recent years, the scientific community in our country has started to focus on the issue of chemical risk management, and related research is booming. However, regrettably, there are some unclear understandings and a lack of necessary methodological support on the concept of risk assessment in our country, making it difficult to deepen research related to risk assessment and hindering the application of risk assessment methods in chemical management in our country. Therefore, this course focuses on teaching the methodology of chemical risk assessment, enabling students to grasp the basic concepts and methods of risk assessment and, with the help of case analyses, be able to apply these concepts and methods in practice.
zh_law_content: 现代生活高度依赖各种人工合成的化学物质 也造就了充满化学物质的环境 因此 人们通过接触空气 水 食品 化妆品 建筑材料以及各种生活用品 每时     每刻都暴露于化学物质之中 特别是近年来随着经济的高速发展 环境污染 事件在我国时有发生 如牛奶中的三聚氰胺问题 重金属污染导致的儿童血铅 增高问题等 有关化学物质的健康影响引起公众越来越高的关注 因此 如何  在充分享受化学物质带来的便利的同时 有效管理好化学物质 防止化学物质 威胁人类健康和生态安全是各国政府和科学界在认真思考的一个问题年联合国第一次提出了化学品风险管理的基本理念 强调企业要进１９９２ 行基于风险评价的自主风险管理 目前 风险评价已经成为欧盟 美国等国家  管理化学品的一个不可或缺的手段 近年来 我国科学界开始关注化学物质 的风险管理问题 相关研究方兴未艾 但是 遗憾的是我国在风险评价概念上  存在一些模糊的认识 也缺乏必要的方法学支持 使得一些有关风险评价的研 究难以深入下去 也阻碍了风险评价方法在我国化学品管理上的应用 因此  本课程着重化学物质风险评价的方法学的教授 使选课学生能够掌握风险评价的基本概念和基本方法 并借助于一些案例分析 能够对各种化学物质的健 康以及生态风险进行定量评价人的化学物质暴露途径多种多样 而且每个人的职业 生活方式 生活空  间 年龄 性别 经济状况等的不同 都会导致其暴露化学物质的量和种类产生   显著差异 同时 不同的化学物质有着不同的物理化学性质和用途 这也就决  定了其不同的环境行为 这些暴露途径和环境行为的复杂性给化学物质的暴露评价带来了不少困难 因此 弄清化学物质的暴露因素并进行暴露量预测 尤为重要 另一方面 不同化学物质的毒性大小和致毒机制差异非常之大 而  且 毒性数据来源也很广泛 有些来自专门机构提供的动物暴露数据 有些来  自流行病调查数据 处于不同立场的人往往会引用不同的毒性数据 但是不 管利用那一类毒性数据 每个数据背后都隐含着许多假设 在处理毒理学和流 行病学模型或者在进行剂量效应解析之前 有必要了解这些假定 最后 任何  化学物质都是有毒的 只是呈现毒性的剂量不同而已 因此 将危害性评价和  暴露评价有机结合是风险评价的核心课程从人类健康风险和生态风险这两个角度系统讲解化学物质风险评价的原理和方法 并以作者的研究成果为主介绍了若干应用案例 主要内容包 括 介绍国际上风险评价与风险管理的发展历史 以便帮助读者思考风险评：１． 价的本质 以人类健康风险评价为主题 介绍化学物质的人类暴露评估 致

law_name: 遥感基础与图像解译原理
law_content: Remote sensing is a discipline related to geography, natural resources, environment, and planning. The basic knowledge and basic techniques that undergraduate students majoring in remote sensing should master include remote sensing fundamentals and image interpretation principles. The purpose of the course on remote sensing fundamentals and image interpretation principles is to introduce students to the basic principles of remote sensing and the basic methods of modern remote sensing technology. The main content includes an introduction to remote sensing and its current development status, the physical basis and technical systems of remote sensing, aerial remote sensing fundamentals, aerial photograph interpretation, satellite remote sensing fundamentals, satellite photograph interpretation, remote sensing digital image processing, remote sensing image analysis, microwave remote sensing topics, vegetation remote sensing topics, and atmospheric remote sensing topics. There are no prerequisites for enrollment in this course, but students are expected to have a basic understanding of calculations.

law_content: Water environmental chemistry is an important branch of environmental chemistry, which mainly studies the formation, distribution, and cycling processes of various elements, compounds, both natural and artificially synthesized in natural water. It also explores the connections between water environment and other environmental media, vividly reflecting the interdisciplinary nature of geology and chemistry. The Earth's water environment mainly includes terrestrial and marine water bodies, which are closely related yet significantly different. Since global industrialization, human activities have had a much greater impact on the water environment than most natural processes, with large amounts of pollutants being discharged. Water bodies are extremely important receptors in the natural world. Understanding the migration, transformation, fate, and related biological and ecological effects of pollutants at different spatial scales and time ranges, such as teratogenic, carcinogenic, mutagenic, and aquatic ecotoxicological changes, plays a crucial role. The main content of the course includes terrestrial water bodies (freshwater) and marine water bodies (saltwater), involving the formation, distribution, and environmental conditions of natural water chemistry, in order to comprehensively understand the overall chemical status of natural water environment. Based on this, it explores the migration, transformation laws of various major pollutants, such as heavy metals, persistent organic pollutants, endocrine disruptors, etc., and their corresponding biological and ecological effects. Additionally, it introduces the latest methods and technologies in current international research on water environmental chemistry. The arrangement of the course content is presented in a simple to complex manner with abundant illustrations, focusing on dynamic introductions and presentations of literature and materials. It particularly highlights the international attention in today's water environmental chemistry research.

law_content: Environmental pollution is a common problem both domestically and internationally. In order to protect the environment and human health, it is necessary to repair the polluted environment by removing pollutants from the environmental media. This course mainly introduces the basic principles, techniques, and practices of environmental remediation. The content includes the remediation of polluted soil, contaminated groundwater, polluted sediment, and polluted surface water. In addition, investigations, methods, risk assessments, remediation standards, and regulatory systems for polluted environments are also presented. Case studies of remediation for each environmental medium are conducted.

law_content: By taking this course, students will be able to understand the absorption, migration, distribution, transformation, and excretion processes of toxic and harmful substances in biological systems. They will also gain knowledge on the toxic pathways and sites of action for environmental toxic and harmful substances, as well as the mechanisms behind three toxic effects: carcinogenicity, teratogenicity, and mutagenicity. Additionally, students will learn about the toxic mechanisms and pathophysiology of neurotoxicity, immune toxicity, endocrine disruption effects, liver toxicity, renal toxicity, and skeletal toxicity, among other target organ toxicities. They will also acquire fundamental research methods and experimental skills in environmental toxicology, as well as an understanding of the current research progress and development trends in this field both domestically and internationally.

law_content: Environmental monitoring technology is a fundamental technical approach in environmental research. It primarily involves the use of sample extraction, purification, and instrument analysis techniques to effectively and sensitively separate target pollutants from complex sample media, and to accurately quantify them. This process aims to understand the pollution characteristics, migration and transformation behavior, and ecological health of environmental pollutants.
zh_law_content: 环境监测技术是环境研究中的基础技术手段 主要是通过利用样品提取 净化 和仪器分析等分析技术 从复杂样品介质中高效灵敏地分离出目标污染物 并 进行准确定性定量的过程 为环境污染物的污染特征 迁移转化行为和生态健

law_content: Environmental pollution numerical simulation and modeling are the main tools and techniques to understand the physical and chemical processes of environmental pollution, quantify the relationships between pollution sources and sinks, and forecast the occurrence and development of environmental pollution. In recent years, they have rapidly developed and been widely applied in environmental pollution research and early warning, becoming indispensable tools. It is expected that they will continue to develop and be applied more rapidly. Environmental pollution forecasting models encompass various knowledge fields, including computational mathematics, physics and chemistry, weather and climate, data processing and integration. Through this course, students will become familiar with and master the basic knowledge of environmental pollution numerical modeling, modeling ideas and platforms, and big data processing. Through practical training, they will acquire preliminary skills in running and using atmospheric pollution numerical models. Through the study of models, they will further understand and consolidate the theories and knowledge of atmospheric chemistry, physics, atmospheric environment, and the causes of atmospheric pollution, and apply them to the theoretical and practical aspects of numerical modeling in other environmental media.

law_content: Groundwater is an important water resource. However, groundwater pollution in China is becoming increasingly severe. Understanding the migration of pollutants in groundwater is crucial for preventing, managing, and remedying groundwater pollution. This course will introduce the occurrence, transformation, and migration processes of pollutants in underground environments, as well as simulation methods for pollutant migration. Specific topics covered include an introduction to groundwater and its pollution, types, properties, and sources of inorganic and organic pollutants in groundwater, material transport in saturated media, solute transformation and retention, fluid and material transport in the unsaturated zone, simulation of solute migration in saturated media, multiphase fluid, groundwater and soil monitoring, and groundwater pollution remediation technologies.

law_content: This course mainly introduces the basic theories and methods of environmental planning, element environmental planning, integrated environmental planning, as well as typical case studies of environmental planning. The specific contents include: Introduction, Theoretical foundation, Planning content, Technical aspects: Water environment planning, Atmospheric environment planning, Land use planning, Solid waste management planning, Ecological city planning, and Environmental planning decision support systems.

law_content: Introduction to Physical Geography is a fundamental course for undergraduate students majoring in Geography at Peking University. This course proposes a "system, two main lines, three stages" teaching system, which examines the transfer of energy and cycling of matter as the two main threads. It comprehensively explores the atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere, pedosphere, biosphere, and anthroposphere of the Earth's surface system. In terms of content arrangement, it follows a general-part-general order in the three stages. Firstly, it introduces the disciplinary system, systemic approach, and basic characteristics of the Earth's surface system in a general sense. Secondly, it discusses the processes of energy transfer and matter cycling in the Earth's surface system in detail. Lastly, it presents the overall characteristics of the Earth's surface system, including its structure, function, and conceptual models in a general sense.

law_content: Geomorphology is the scientific study of the characteristics, causes, development, structure, and distribution patterns of landforms on the Earth's surface. The classroom teaching of geomorphology focuses on the geomorphic force system, with an emphasis on external forces. Landforms formed primarily by external forces include slope landforms, river landforms, karst landforms, glacial landforms, permafrost landforms, desert landforms, loess landforms, and coastal landforms. Landforms formed mainly by internal forces include tectonic landforms, fold landforms, fault landforms, and volcanic landforms. The summer course in geomorphology includes field practical training, which is an important supplementary content of this course. Two weeks of field teaching and practical training are conducted in the Datong Basin and Qinhuangdao coastal area.

law_content: This course is one of the foundational courses in the disciplines of geography, ecology, and urban and environmental studies. It provides a comprehensive and systematic introduction to the basic knowledge of meteorology, including advancements in atmospheric science. It serves as an introductory course for further study and the thinking methods involved are fundamental to scientific thinking in geography-related disciplines. The course covers topics such as atmospheric physics, weather science, and climatology, introducing the fundamental principles and elements of the atmosphere, weather systems and forecasting, the physical processes behind climate formation, the geographical distribution of climate, and the basic knowledge of climate change. It aims to enable students to acquire a basic understanding of meteorology and research methods. Throughout the course, practical exercises such as meteorological observations, weather forecasting, and climatic analysis are incorporated to facilitate comprehension and develop practical skills, thus laying a foundation for future scientific research.

law_content: Hydrology is the science that studies the properties, distribution, circulation, and variations of water on Earth. In recent decades, with the increasingly severe issues of resources and environment facing humanity, many of these problems are directly or indirectly related to the movement, changes, and distribution of water. Therefore, the research work in hydrology is increasingly associated with these issues, such as water resources management. In this course, we will first briefly introduce the research objects, development history, branches, and basic conditions of water on Earth in hydrology. We will then explain the principles and significance of water cycle and water balance, including the main basic processes or mechanisms of precipitation, evaporation, infiltration, and runoff. We will further discuss the main hydrological characteristics of major water bodies on land, such as rivers, lakes, wetlands, estuaries, and groundwater. Lastly, we will address the basic situation of water sources.

law_content: Key focus on the main contents of soil science and soil geography research. This course is divided into four parts. The first part systematically explains the physicochemical properties of soil and the process of nutrient cycling. The second part focuses on the formation and development of soil and soil classification systems. The third part emphasizes the major soil types in China and their spatial distribution, as well as the main principles and methods of soil survey and zoning. The fourth part discusses soil quality degradation, its influencing factors, and management strategies from the perspective of soil resources.
zh_law_content: 重点关注土壤学与土壤地理研究的主要内容 本课程分四部分 第一部分系统 ：阐述土壤的理化性质及其养分循环过程 第二部分重点介绍土壤的形成与发；育 土壤分类系统 第三部分 着重讲述我国主要的土壤类型及其空间分布特 ； 征 以及土壤调查与区划的主要原则 方法 第四部分 从土壤资源的视角论述  ； 土壤质量退化及其影响因素与管理对策

law_content: The integration of various disciplines is one of the fundamental characteristics of geography. Integrated physical geography, a discipline founded by Chinese scholars and named " ", has a close connection with Peking University. It has always been a compulsory course for geography undergraduate students at Peking University, taught by renowned geographers such as Professor Lin Chao and Professor Chen Chuankang. This course introduces the research objects, contents, objectives, and characteristics of integrated physical geography, as well as its relation to other disciplines in physical geography. It elucidates the overall nature of the natural geographical environment, first by exploring the spatial and temporal geographic laws. The spatial laws mainly examine the regional differentiation and combination laws of the natural geographical environment, while the temporal laws mainly explore the causes, occurrences, developments, successions, and changes of the natural geographical environment. Secondly, it discusses the division of natural geographic hierarchical units at the regional scale and the theories and methods of natural zoning. It focuses on studying the principles, methods, and hierarchical systems of integrated natural zoning. Thirdly, it discusses the division of natural geographic hierarchical units at the local scale, focusing on the principles and research methods of land typology, including land classification, grading, and principles. Fourthly, it systematically introduces the forefront of research in integrated physical geography, mainly involving land change science, comprehensive evaluation of ecosystems, and landscape ecology. Fifthly, from the perspective of the development of human-environment relationship thinking and sustainable development, it explores the dialectical relationship between human beings and the natural geographical environment. zh_law_content: 综合性是地理学的基本特点之一 综合自然地理学 是中国学者创立和命 “ ”名的学科 其产生与北京大学有着直接的渊源 长期以来 综合自然地理  “学 都是北京大学地理类本科生的专业必修课 著名地理学家林超教授 陈传”  康教授都曾讲授过该门课程 本课程在介绍综合自然地理学的研究对象 内 容 目的 特点及与部门自然地理学各学科内容之间关系的基础上 阐述自然  地理环境的整体性 首先 探讨了自然地理环境的空间地理规律及时间地理 规律 其中 空间地理规律主要探讨自然地理环境的地域分异规律和组合规 律 时间地理规律则主要探讨自然地理环境的成因 发生 发展 演替和变化规；   律 其次 探讨了区域尺度的自然地理等级单位的划分 自然区划的理论与；  ———方法 重点研究综合自然区划的原则 方法和等级系统 再次 探讨了局地尺度  ； 的自然地理等级单位的划分 土地类型学 重点研究土地分级 分类和分等———  的原理和研究方法 第四 系统介绍了综合自然地理学的研究前沿 主要涉及；  土地变化科学 生态系统综合评价以及景观生态学等方面的内容 第五 从人 ； 地关系思想的发展及可持续发展的角度探讨了人类与自然地理环境的辩证关系 最后 分析了综合自然地理学在农业发展 景观生态设计 旅游开发 城市；    规划 区域开发以及自然环境发展预测等方面的应用 本课程为培养学生从事地理学综合研究 土地科学 区域科学研究 自然区划 土地资源调查 区域    开发及国土整治 城市规划等工作奠定基础

law_content: This course is divided into four parts, focusing on the coupling relationship between natural resources and human development. The first part provides a systematic elucidation of the nature of natural resources, the international and domestic situation of resource scarcity and conflict, academic debates on resource scarcity, and the characteristics of resource scarcity. The second part primarily discusses the principles of ecological science in natural resource management, including the ecological processes of natural resources, the interaction between natural resources and human ecology, and the evaluation methods for the ecological impacts of resource utilization. The third part explores the basic problems of natural resource economics, such as the connection between natural resources and the economy and society, as well as the principles of resource allocation and value reconstruction. The fourth part discusses the principles of natural resource management from the perspective of users, including natural resource evaluation, the input-output relationship of resource utilization, decision-making in resource development, and the protection and sustainable management of natural resources.
zh_law_content: 围绕自然资源与人类发展耦合关联 本课程分四部分 第一部分系统阐述了自 然资源的性质 自然资源稀缺与冲突的国际国内态势 关于自然资源稀缺的学 术争论 自然资源稀缺的性质 第二部分重点论述了自然资源生态学原理 包 ； 括自然资源生态过程 自然资源与人类生态 自然资源利用的生态影响极其评 价方法 第三部分 从自然资源与经济社会的关联 自然资源经济学基本问题；   自然资源配置与价值重建等方面探讨了自然资源的经济学原理 第四部分 从； 使用者的视角论述了自然资源管理学原理 包括自然资源评价 资源利用的投 入 产出关系 自然资源开发决策 自然资源保护与自然资源可持续管理

law_content: Why economic activities are concentrated in a few areas? Where should companies choose to invest? What industries should be developed in a city or region? Why do some cities grow fast while others grow slowly? What cities have the potential to become world cities? Why do two regions engage in commodity trade? Why do migrant workers from the central and western regions of China flow to the eastern coastal areas? Why has China become the world's factory? Why do multinational companies flock to the Chinese market? All these economic questions have one thing in common, which is the involvement of space. Economic geography can answer these questions by focusing on economic activities from a spatial perspective, emphasizing the influence of space or location on economic activities and the restructuring of economic spatial patterns.  This course is an introductory course on economic geography, aiming to introduce students to the research objects, content, research methods, and theoretical system of economic geography. The arrangement of course content follows the research objects of economic geography from micro to macro, including factors, companies, industries, cities, and regions. The main focus is on location selection, spatial distribution, spatial structure, and the laws of spatial interactions, introducing relevant theoretical models, analysis methods, and research findings. Through studying this course, students can grasp the basic principles of economic geography and learn preliminary economic geographical analysis, laying a foundation for further study of economic geography.
zh_law_content: 经济活动为什么会集中在少数地区 企业应该选择在什么进行地方投资 一？ ？个城市或区域应该发展什么产业 为什么一些城市增长快 另外一些增长慢？  ？什么城市可能发展成为世界城市 为什么两个区域会发生商品贸易 为什么？ ？农民工从中西部地区流入东部沿海地区 中国为什么能够成为世界工厂 为？ ？什么跨国公司涌入中国市场 这些经济问题有一个共同点 就是都涉及空间？  经济地理学能够回答这些问题 经济地理学从空间视角关注经济活动 强调空 间或者区位对于经济活动的影响以及经济空间布局对空间的重构本课程是经济地理学的入门课 旨在向学生介绍经济地理学的研究对象 研究内容 研究方法以及理论体系 课程内容的安排按照经济地理学的研究对象从微观到宏观包括有要素 企业 产业 城市与区域 以这些研究对象的区   位选择 空间分布 空间结构及空间相互作用规律为主线 介绍相关的理论模  型 分析方法和研究成果 通过本课程的学习 学生可以掌握经济地理学的基  本原理 学会初步的经济地理分析 为进一步学习经济地理学打下基础

law_content: Urban geography studies the development of cities from the perspective of geographical space, focusing on the issues and patterns of urban development in both regional and urban systems. The core content of urban geography includes the spatial organization of cities at both regional and intra-urban levels. The purpose of teaching urban geography is to enable students to grasp the basic theories and methodologies of urban geography, including the conditions for the formation and development of cities, regional urbanization, regional urban systems, and intra-urban spatial organization. Students will also gain knowledge about the distribution and development of Chinese cities, the unique path of urbanization in China, and the ability to independently analyze urban issues. They will learn the basic principles and methods of regional urban systems planning and are encouraged to read additional materials, connect theoretical knowledge with practical development, actively think, ask questions, and refrain from rote memorization. Students are expected to have a certain foundation in geographical knowledge, and are encouraged to bring a map of Chinese provinces to class. Interactive teaching is encouraged, and students are welcome to raise questions and engage in discussions during class.

law_content: In brief, quantitative geography is a discipline that studies and advances mathematical and quantitative methods in geography. The development of quantitative geography is based on geographical thinking, mathematical methods, and computational technology. It is primarily utilized as a tool to organize geographical observation data, establish hypotheses, construct mathematical models in geography, and provide a feasible methodological foundation for the development of geographical theories. The main activities of quantitative geography consist of numerical analysis of spatial data, development of spatial theory, and construction and verification of mathematical models. The ultimate goal of these activities is to enhance the understanding of spatial processes by researchers. The understanding of spatial processes can be direct or indirect, with the latter requiring logical inference. The basic purpose of quantitative geography is to train fundamental mathematical thinking, including abstraction, symbolization, modeling, reasoning, computation, and mathematical experimentation. It also aims to guide students in organizing spatial observation data using mathematical methods and foster their ability to construct hypotheses and deduce basic approaches to geographical theoretical models. The main topics in this process involve the development history of quantitative geography, spatial measurement methods, principles of regression analysis, methods of principal component analysis, spatial autocorrelation analysis, and spatial interaction analysis, among others.

law_content: Industrial geography is a sub-discipline of economic geography, which mainly focuses on describing and explaining the spatial changes in industries. It seeks to understand the impact of human industrialization on the geographical landscape, as well as the effects of global uneven development on local areas. Research in this field investigates the location choices and influencing factors of businesses, as well as the macro-level industrial spatial patterns and the evolution of regional development policies. It specifically examines the impact of technological innovation on regional industrialization, how local environments affect industrial technological innovation, and consequently, the sustained advantages in regional industrial development. This course, through teaching the general principles of industrial geography and sector-specific discussions, aims to help students understand the main factors influencing the changes in industrial locations, the landscape transformations closely related to human industrialization, and the environmental impacts. It also combines regional development, urban planning, and management practices to cultivate students' ability to conduct industry technology and economic analysis in specific areas.

law_content: Introduction to Historical Geography is a course offered to undergraduate students in the School of Urban and Environmental Studies. Its main objective is to introduce the formation and development process of China's geographical pattern. The course includes the basic theories and research methods of historical geography, changes in China's territory, the division and management of administrative regions, the formation and development of water and land transportation routes, the rise and decline of cities, the shift of political, economic, and cultural centers, population growth, loss and migration, ethnic exchange and integration, as well as the natural environmental changes in China's history, such as river diversion, lake disappearance, and deforestation, among others. The course content covers both human geography and natural geography in Chinese history, serving as an introductory course for students majoring in geography-related fields to understand the development and changes in China's geography. The course is mainly taught through lectures by the instructor, utilizing multimedia and teaching tools such as pictures and slides to vividly and intuitively show the changes in China's geographical pattern. While imparting knowledge, the instructor also pays attention to guiding students to... [untranslated].
