law_content: Urban Planning Principles is an important basic course required for urban planning and related majors. Its content almost covers the basic principles of professional knowledge involved in the entire process of urban planning. This course is based on urban planning theories, principles, and layout methods, with the core content being the planning and layout of various components of the city. Based on the composition of the modern urban planning system and the evolution trajectory of urban planning ideas, theories, methods, and practice at home and abroad, this course focuses on the preparation methods and basic content of urban planning in China, elucidates the interrelation between urban planning and regional planning, analyzes the natural conditions and environmental factors influencing urban construction, and introduces the nature and scale of cities, as well as the various elements of cities, such as industry, warehousing logistics, external transportation, urban road systems, residential communities, and public spaces, according to the requirements of preparing urban master plans.
zh_law_content: 城市规划原理 是城市规划及相关专业必修的一门重要的专业基础课程 内“ ” 容几乎涵盖了城市规划过程所涉及的全方位专业知识的基本原理 本课程以城市规划理论 原则和布局方法作为基础 以城市各组成要素的规划布局作为 核心内容 本课程在阐述现代城市规划体系构成及国内外城市规划思想 理 论方法和实践演进轨迹的基础上 着重讲授我国城市规划的编制方法和基本内容 阐述城市规划与区域规划的相互关系 分析影响城市建设的自然条件和 环境因素 按编制城市总体规划的要求分别介绍城市的性质和发展规模 城市； 各组成要素 工业 仓储物流 对外交通 城市道路系统 居住社区 公共空间的

law_content: This course mainly consists of four parts: Comprehensive road traffic, Sector road traffic, Regional road traffic, and Urban road traffic. Comprehensive road traffic focuses on analyzing the macro influencing factors of road traffic, including natural factors, natural environment, natural resources, socioeconomic factors, population and cities, industry and economy, technological and policy factors. These three major factors consist of six factors. It also elucidates the overall principles of road traffic transportation layout and explains the composition and economic geographical significance of the main transportation corridors of the Eight Verticals and Eight Horizontals in our country. Sector road traffic introduces the main five transportation modes one by one, including railways, highways, aviation, shipping, and pipelines. While understanding their respective technological characteristics, it emphasizes on teaching the relationship between different transportation modes and cities, as well as their layout in cities, such as railway stations, bus stations, airports, and corresponding transportation routes. This is also an important content of urban road traffic planning. Regional road traffic focuses on exploring the relationship between regional transportation and urban development, such as the impact on the nature, scale, layout, and industrial prosperity and decline of cities. Especially, it discusses the important influence of linear economic belts such as the Qinghai-Tibet Railway, Beijing-Kowloon Railway, and rivers on regional socioeconomic development. Meanwhile, it introduces the content and methods of regional road traffic planning through practical examples. Urban road traffic is the most important part of this course. Based on a comprehensive review of the historical development and conceptual changes of urban road systems at home and abroad, it teaches the content and methods of urban road system planning and design.

law_content: This course is a professional core course offered to senior undergraduate students from the third year and above, majoring in urban and rural planning, human geography, economic geography, public management, and regional economics. The course consists of 51 hours in total, with a weekly learning hour. The course objective is for students to accurately grasp the basic concepts of regions, the systemic composition of regions, the laws of regional development and evolution, familiarize themselves with basic methods and theories of regional analysis, understand the methods and procedures of regional planning and formulation, and comprehend the current international and domestic regional issues and their development trends. The course covers the following topics: regional concepts and related concepts, regional characteristics and elements, regional systemic composition, the process, factors, and influences of regional evolution, theories of regional development and evolution, regional population, economy, and production.

law_name: 人文地理专业综合实习
law_content: This course is aimed at students majoring in human geography and urban and rural planning who have completed basic professional courses and some professional courses. It belongs to the category of comprehensive internship courses. The course focuses on the study of urban and rural development, resource utilization, typical business formats, and human geography phenomena in urban and rural settlements. Students will choose typical elements or regional development as their research objects and independently complete internship reports after comprehensively understanding the spatial development of urban and rural areas.
zh_law_content: 本课程面向人文地理与城乡规划专业已完成专业基础课学习和部分专业课学习的学生 属于专业综合实习类课程 课程集中 天时间考察城乡发展  ７～１０中的资源利用 典型业态 城乡聚落发展中的人文地理现象 学生在综合了解  城乡区域空间发展的基础上 选择典型要素或典型地域发展作为研究对象 独 立完成实习报告

law_name: 人文地理综合社会实践实习
law_content: This course is aimed at senior students majoring in human geography and urban and rural planning. It belongs to the category of comprehensive practical internship courses. The course is mainly conducted during the summer vacation. Students are divided into groups to participate in theoretical and practical scientific research projects under the guidance of the teacher. They will participate in overall project discussions and undertake specific research tasks. Through practical internships, students will gain comprehensive understanding of geographical phenomena and spatial rules in urban and rural development practices. They will also learn about the basic procedures and methods of using human geography theories and methods to participate in social services.
zh_law_content: 本课程面向人文地理与城乡规划专业高年级学生 属于综合实践实习类课程 课程以在暑期开展为主 学生分组参与老师主持的理论和实践类科研项目 参 与项目整体讨论 并承担具体的科研工作任务 通过实践实习 综合了解城乡  发展实践中的地理现象和空间规律 了解运用人文地理理论方法参与社会服务的基本程序和方法

law_content: This course is a compulsory course for undergraduate students majoring in urban planning in a five-year program. The purpose of the course is to enable students to master the basic concepts, theories, and methods of urban design, as well as the means and techniques of investigation, conception, design, and expression in urban design projects. Students need to have a comprehensive understanding and grasp of urban space, landscape, architecture, details, and facilities design in order to adapt to future urban planning and management practices. In the first half of the semester, students will be assigned several spatial cognition and design exercises, including site visits, spatial analysis, and small-scale hypothetical designs, to train their abilities and skills in recognizing urban spatial elements, structural relationships, coordination, and behavioral flow organization. In the second half of the semester, a comprehensive design project will be assigned to train students' practical operational abilities in comprehensively investigating urban spatial phenomena, identifying problems, and solving them. Throughout the course, there will be lectures on the theories, history, methods, and future trends of urban design, as well as the introduction of basic knowledge. Students are required to read a certain amount of urban design literature to have a certain level of theoretical literacy.

law_content: The ability to conduct comprehensive social surveys and practices is a fundamental professional skill that urban planning students must master, and it is also one of the basic requirements for urban planning education proposed by the National Higher Education Urban Planning Committee. Social comprehensive practice investigation is a course that emphasizes both theory and practice. In this course, students are required to choose urban issues, conduct field surveys, questionnaires, and related interviews, and finally complete a social investigation report. Outstanding assignments are selected to participate in the national urban planning professional competition of that year. Through the course offering, urban planning students develop the following abilities: the ability to collect data and information through observation, interviews, and questionnaires; the ability to apply qualitative and quantitative methods to analyze, predict, and evaluate various types of data and information; the ability to study planning and related issues and propose basic planning solutions.

law_content: Land spatial planning management and regulations are an important part of the discipline of urban planning. China implements a qualification certification system for urban planners, and an important content of obtaining the title of urban planner is urban planning management and regulations. This course is a compulsory course for personnel engaged in urban planning management, urban planning design, and technical work, as well as personnel engaged in real estate development, operation, and management. This course is divided into two parts. The first part is the theoretical part, which involves knowledge related to administrative management and administrative law, and basic knowledge of urban planning management. The second part is management operation, which is based on the composition of the urban planning management system, covering urban planning formulation and approval management, site selection management for construction projects, land use planning management, construction engineering planning management, and supervision and inspection of urban planning implementation. It introduces the concepts, management tasks, management objects and characteristics, management content and basis, management procedures and operational requirements, as well as the planning requirements for the protection of historical and cultural heritage. Based on this, according to the characteristics of the department, the course also includes relevant content of real estate management law and land management law and their relationship with urban planning management.

law_content: Urban infrastructure planning is one of the main components of urban planning and is also one of the essential deliverables for urban planning review and approval. This course combines urban planning principles and teaches the basic principles and methods of urban infrastructure planning. The main topics include an introduction to urban infrastructure, urban water and sewage engineering planning, urban power supply planning, and vertical land use planning in cities.

law_content: Detailed Planning is a compulsory course for undergraduate students majoring in urban and rural planning in China. It is a theory and practice-based course that emphasizes both theoretical understanding and practical application. The course curriculum is centered around teaching the theory of controlling detailed planning, and includes activities such as case study interpretation and group discussions. Students are expected to conduct surveys, analyze data, and complete course design projects based on specific topics.

Rural-urban spatial cognition internship is a necessary component of the five-year undergraduate education in urban planning. It is also a content of professional assessment and evaluation. The internship selects the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Metropolitan Region as the base and starts with systematic internship teaching in Tianjin urban area, Binhai New Area, Beijing, and Tangshan. When conditions are mature, it will gradually expand to cities such as Shijiazhuang, Chengde, and Zhangjiakou, forming a internship base centered around the Beijing-Tianjin-Tangshan Metropolitan Region. Taking the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Metropolitan Region as the teaching and internship base can fully reflect the distinctive features of our urban planning program, which is based on geography and combines natural sciences and engineering. It also leverages our department's strengths in research fields such as regional research and planning, innovative space and innovative groups, and economic geography. Through continuous internship teaching, the effect of mutual learning and teaching can be achieved.

The Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei and Bohai Rim Urban Agglomeration is one of the three main urban agglomerations in China. Binhai New Area in Tianjin plays the role of exploring new regional development models and providing experience and demonstration for national development and reform. Using this region as the internship base is conducive to students understanding the forefront issues in China's urbanization process. Each city in the Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Metropolitan Region has its own characteristics in terms of nature, scale, industry, history, and culture, which facilitates the adjustment and organization of internship routes according to teaching tasks. The Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei Metropolitan Region is centered around Beijing and has convenient transportation, making it suitable for conducting internships. law_content: Urban planning is a discipline that combines theory and practice closely. It is a comprehensive social practice internship course that requires students to directly participate in the specific research or practice projects of teachers. This enables students to apply the theoretical knowledge they have learned in relevant practical situations, deepen their understanding of classroom knowledge, and gain a preliminary grasp of research and practice through investigations, data analysis, data retrieval, and basic methods such as drawing charts. This course is jointly undertaken by all the teachers from the Department of Urban and Regional Planning and the Department of Urban and Economic Geography. Each teacher will arrange internship tasks for students based on their own research projects. The research directions of the two departments cover various relevant areas of human geography and urban planning.

law_content: This course is one of the core compulsory courses in urban planning determined by the Teaching Guidance Committee for Urban Planning. The teaching content revolves around the basic knowledge and application of ecology. Students are required to master the basic knowledge of ecology, an introduction to urban environmental studies and the environmental effects of urbanization, and the characteristics of urban ecosystems. They should also be familiar with the relationship between humans and the environment in cities, as well as the relationships closely related to urban research and urban planning. They should have a comprehensive understanding of the application areas of ecology, including biodiversity conservation, ecosystem management, ecological restoration, ecological engineering, ecological planning, ecological city construction, industrial ecology, and circular economy. They should be able to apply these knowledge and skills to urban environmental planning practice with the guidance of teaching plans, mainly for students in urban and rural planning and landscape design, as well as for students interested in ecology and its application. The goal of this course is to enable students to fully understand the basic concepts and laws of ecology, and to apply this knowledge flexibly to land use, urban and rural planning, and resource utilization and protection research and practical applications by combining specific cases. In the process of coordinating urbanization practice, students should be proactive, forward-looking, and able to handle the various complex relationships encountered.

law_content: The map, as a form of graphical representation of geoscientific research findings, is referred to as the second language of geography. Geographic Information Systems (GIS), as an extension of cartography, uses information technology to store, analyze, and display geographical information, and is also known as the third language of geography. Therefore, cartography and GIS are fundamental aspects that must be mastered by various disciplines within geography. The course "GIS Fundamentals" is a newly introduced mandatory course for natural geography majors. Its main objective is to develop students' comprehensive knowledge of cartography and geographic information systems. This includes understanding GIS data models and structures, spatial data processing and editing, spatial analysis methods, cartographic principles, and the basic functionalities of commonly used software. The course aims to cultivate students' ability to apply cartography and GIS theory to practical situations, and to effectively utilize GIS as a tool for mapping and spatial analysis to solve real-world geographic problems.

law_content: In recent years, remote sensing technology has witnessed vigorous development in China, with various domestic satellites being launched successively. Remote sensing technology plays an increasingly important role in resource and environmental monitoring and management. This course introduces the basic concepts and characteristics of remote sensing, and discusses the principles of remote sensing information acquisition, including the physical foundations of remote sensing, remote sensing platforms, sensors, remote sensing imagery, and their characteristics. It also briefly discusses the main methods of remote sensing image processing. Based on this, the course focuses on several major applications of remote sensing data, including land cover classification, vegetation remote sensing, hydrology remote sensing, and geological remote sensing, as well as their applications in land and resources disasters and global changes. The organization structure of this course on remote sensing principles and applications aims to present the basic content of remote sensing while reflecting the new achievements and development trends of modern remote sensing technology. The course adopts a teaching method that combines classroom lectures, field experiments, practical exercises, student reports, and classroom discussions, aiming to help students comprehensively understand the principles and applications of remote sensing, as well as the processing and analysis methods of remote sensing data. Through this course, students are expected to master the basic principles of remote sensing and its extensive application prospects in Earth observation, understand the spectral characteristics of common land cover types, types and characteristics of remote sensing platforms and sensors, remote sensing image processing principles, and methods of land cover identification and classification. Furthermore, they should also have an understanding of the applications of remote sensing in resource and environmental monitoring and Earth system observation.

law_content: On the one hand, surface process models have become a fundamental tool for understanding and studying the Earth's surface system, which is closely connected to our existence. On the other hand, with the rapid development of surface process observation systems, the integrated application of surface process models and observational data has become an important method in the scientific research of Earth's surface system. This course starts from the theoretical understanding, formulation, and parameterization of surface process simulation, systematically introduces the composition and implementation of surface process models, the observation system of Earth's surface system, and conducts case studies on relevant scientific research.

law_name: 自然地理与资源环境研究方法
law_content:
Introduction section: Based on the special characteristics of the research object of physical geography, this section analyzes the methodology of research in physical geography from a scientific and philosophical perspective. It introduces the scientific thinking and basic methods of research in physical geography, as well as the development and trends of physical geography research. The content includes field observation and description, explanation of natural geographical phenomena, comprehensive analysis of physical geography, systematic research in physical geography, positional experimental research in physical geography, quantitative research in physical geography, and model simulation research in physical geography. Additionally, it focuses on the literature search, acquiring secondary data, social and economic surveys, positioning stations, semi-position monitoring, and the methods of presenting research results. 

Hydrology section: This section emphasizes the application of hydrological models and focuses on practical operations. The content includes the compilation of hydrological data, the basic knowledge of distributed hydrological models, lumped hydrological models, and black box models, as well as their applications. The operations include the processing of rainfall, runoff, and evaporation data, generation of flood processes, and generation of continuous series. The topics covered in this section include: 
1) Hydrological process division and parameter estimation and calibration methods for rainfall-runoff models, involving parameters such as evaporation parameters. 
2) Ground surface runoff parameters, groundwater runoff parameters, slope runoff and convergence parameters, and surface and river runoff parameters. 
3) Model simulation error analysis and accuracy evaluation. 

Phenology section: This section emphasizes the spatiotemporal coupling of natural landscape phenology. The content includes plant phenology, their occurrence, and basic understanding.

law_content:
The various departments of the research on China's natural geography examine how the natural geographical elements interact and relate to China and different geographical regions at different scales, and how they form comprehensive regional natural geographical features. It also focuses on how to develop, utilize, protect, and govern based on different characteristics and problems, and embodies the characteristics of geography, systematicness, comprehensiveness, and regionality.

China's natural geography is an important basic course in geography, which covers the following aspects: the characteristics, formation, and evolution of China's natural environment; the status and development of China's natural resources; the regional differentiation laws, structure, and characteristics of different levels of geographical regions; and major geographical projects in land development, protection, and management.

Through studying this course, students can develop their comprehensive analytical ability and relevant analytical ability, have a preliminary grasp of the basic theory and research methods of regional natural geography, and have a thorough understanding of China's natural geographical conditions, laying a foundation for subsequent learning, work, and research.
zh_law_content: 中国自然地理研究各部门自然地理要素如何作用于中国及不同尺度的地理区域 在它们之间的相互作用与联系下 如何形成了综合的区域自然地理特征；  以及针对不同特征和问题 如何因地制宜地开发 利用 保护与治理 本课程   集中体现了地理学的特点 系统性 综合性与区域性———  中国自然地理 是地理学的一门重要的基础课程 其内容涉及以下几方面“ ”  ：中国自然环境的特征 形成与演变１．  ；中国自然资源状况与开发利用２． ；区域分异规律 中国自然区划 不同等级地理区域的结构与特征３．   ；国土开发 保护与整治方面的重大地理工程４．  通过本课程的学习 培养学生的综合分析能力和相关分析能力 初步掌握区域 自然地理的基本理论和研究方法 并对中国的自然地理状况有充分的了解 为 后续的学习 工作和研究打下基础

law_content: This course is an important foundation course for the majors of Human Geography and Urban and Rural Planning and Management, and Urban and Rural Planning. This course strives to reform the traditional teaching methods of human geography, emphasizing the stimulation of students' interests and the equal importance of theory and practice. Through the combination of theoretical knowledge in human geography and case studies of urban and rural planning and local development strategies, it emphasizes the background and characteristics of Peking University's urban and rural planning carried out with a scientific mindset. It emphasizes the usefulness of human geography in national economic construction, especially in urban and rural planning practice. As a foundational course for the majors of Human Geography and Urban and Rural Planning and Management, it is suitable for the characteristics of undergraduate students in the first and second years of these majors to stimulate their interest in further studying the major, understand the characteristics of various branches of human geography, and understand the specific uses and important thinking characteristics of the discipline of human geography in the professional cultivation of students with a scientific background in urban and rural planning and management. The accompanying textbook for this course, "Theory and Application of Human Geography," complements the teaching process, especially emphasizing the following three characteristics: 1) the shift from purely focusing on knowledge to emphasizing interest, including concepts such as "fun" and "entertainment"; 2) the shift from purely emphasizing theory to balancing theory and practical application; and 3) the shift from focusing on subject introductions to building disciplinary thinking characteristics.
zh_law_content: 本课程是人文地理与城乡规划管理专业和城乡规划专业的重要基础课程本课程力争对传统的人文地理学教学思路进行一定的改革 注重引发学生的兴趣点 强调理论与实践并重 通过人文地理学科理论知识与城乡规划和地方 发展战略研究案例的结合 强调北京大学以理科思维开展城乡规划的背景和特色 强调人文地理学在国民经济建设 尤其在城乡规划实践中的用途 作为  专业基础课 上述教学思路正适合人文地理与城乡规划管理 城乡规划专业 一 二年级的本科生的特点 引发他们进一步学习专业的兴趣 了解人文地理  学各个分支学科的特点 明白人文地理学这一学科的具体用途和重要的思维特征 对理科背景下的城乡规划专业和人文地理与城乡规划管理的学生培养起到重要作用本课程的配套教材 人文地理 理论与应用 与教学过程相辅相成 尤其注重《 ： 》 强调以下三个方面的特点 一 由单纯侧重 知识性 向强调 趣味性 转变：  “ ” “ ” ；二 由单纯侧重 理论 向 理论与实践应用并重 转变 三 由侧重 学科介绍 “ ” “ ” ；  “ ”向 建立学科思维特点 转变

law_content: Human geography is an important branch of behavioral geography, which studies the daily behavioral characteristics of individuals, individual decision-making, and influencing factors. This course will systematically introduce the theoretical foundation and methodology of behavioral geography, as well as its applications in urban research and planning. Combining with classical literature from both domestic and international sources, the course will outline the development of behavioral geography and teach research methods such as behavioral geography and temporal geography. It will explore the forefront and development direction of the application of behavioral geography in urban planning and spatial governance practice in China.

law_content: Cities and regions are highly concentrated socio-economic units in modern society. The spatial arrangement and organization of residential and various economic and social activities within them form a highly complex and dynamic system. Within this system, two main forces play a major role: the market force and the government force. Cities and regions are shaped by both the market and government influences.

law_content: The system teaches the planning and construction of cities in China and foreign countries, comparing the historical processes of urban planning and construction in both the East and the West. It analyzes the ideas and practical experiences of urban planning throughout history, with a focus on the social context, planning trends, and the interaction between planning and construction in each historical period. In addition to introducing historical facts, the course also aims to enhance students' knowledge of urban history and improve their theoretical understanding of urban construction, providing a solid foundation for studying urban planning as a major.
zh_law_content: 系统讲授中外城市规划与城市建设 以历史进程为轴对比中西 梳理城市规划 思想与建设实践的脉络 在介绍史实之余 重点分析各历史时期社会背景 规  划思潮与城市建设的互动关系 以期充实学生的城市历史知识 提高其对城市 建设史的理论认识水平 为城市规划专业学习打好基础

law_content: According to the traditional definition, ecology is the science that studies the relationship between organisms and their environment. However, modern ecology has expanded to encompass life phenomena at different scales and address ecological and environmental issues at different scales. Ecology is a discipline that is both theoretical and experimental. Modern ecology consists of various sub-disciplines, including molecular ecology, individual ecology, population ecology, community ecology, ecosystem ecology, landscape ecology, regional ecology, and global ecology. The research methods used involve biology, geology, remote sensing, and other disciplines, making ecology an interdisciplinary field that intersects with life science, geology, environmental science, remote sensing, and information science. On the one hand, ecology is relatively independent and has a complete disciplinary system. On the other hand, ecology also has strong applicability and practicality. Various aspects of modern social development involve ecology and environmental issues, such as climate change, desertification, urbanization, soil erosion and land degradation, biodiversity conservation, invasive species, ecological assessment of large-scale projects, ecological restoration of cities and mines, and ecological problems in new rural construction. All of these require the application of ecological principles as a theoretical basis for research and problem-solving. Therefore, this course will include three main parts: the basic theory of ecology, the application of ecological principles, and the analysis of important environmental issues through case studies. Based on the emphasis on explaining the theories and practices of ecology at various levels, case studies will be conducted on environmental pollution of air, water, and soil, enabling students to have a comprehensive understanding of the basic principles and laws of ecology, as well as their application in solving practical ecological and environmental problems.
zh_law_content: 按照传统的定义 生态学是研究生物及其与环境关系的科学 但现代生态学已 经扩展到不同尺度的生命现象和解决不同尺度的生态学与环境问题生态学是一门理论性和实验性很强的学科 现代的生态学由分子生态学 个 体生态学 种群生态学 群落生态学 生态系统生态学 景观生态学 区域生态    学 以及全球生态学等分支学科所构成 采用的研究手段涉及生物学 地学 遥   感等学科 是生命科学 地学 环境科学 遥感及信息科学等相互交叉的学科    但它本身相对独立 具有完整的学科体系 另一方面 生态学又具有很强的应用性和实践性 现代社会发展的方方面面都 涉及生态学与环境问题 比如 气候变化 荒漠化 城镇化 水土流失与土地退    化 生物多样性保护 外来种 大型工程的生态评估 城镇及矿山的生态恢复    新农村建设中的生态问题等等都需要以生态学原理为理论基础 进行研究和解决因此 本课程将包括三大部分 生态学的基本理论 生态学原理的应用 以及重 ：  要环境问题案例解析 在重点讲解各层次生态学理论和实践的基础上 对大 气 水和土壤的环境污染做案例分析 使学生全面了解生态学的基本原理 基  本规律 以及在解决实际的生态与环境问题中的应用 提高保护生态与环境的 自觉性与积极性 培养学习生态和环境科学的兴趣

law_name: 地理信息系统的规划应用
law_content: Urban and rural planning is a multidisciplinary field that utilizes systematic and creative approaches to spatially plan and manage human habitats. Its scope includes communities, towns, cities, and urban clusters, and covers land use, transportation, environmental and natural resource conservation, economic development, urban design, and heritage preservation. Spatial analysis is an important implementation method in urban and rural planning. Geographic Information Systems (GIS) is a scientific and technological system that focuses on the location aspect (Science of Where). GIS creates, manages, analyzes, and maps spatial data to identify, monitor, and predict spatial issues. This course is based on specific practical problems in the field of urban and rural planning and provides instruction on relevant GIS techniques, while also strengthening students' ability to integrate theory and practice through practical exercises.
zh_law_content: 城乡规划学是一门跨多个学科的 通过系统的且有创意的方式去空间上规划和管理人居环境 其尺度包括社区 镇 城市 城市群 其范围包括土地利用 交     通 环境和自然资源保护 经济发展 城市设计 历史遗产保护等 而空间的分    析是城乡规划中的重要实现途径 地理信息系统 （Ｇｅｏｇｒａｐｈｉｃ Ｉｎｆｏｒｍａｔｉｏｎ简称 下同 是一门关于位置的科学技术Ｓｙｓｔｅｍ ＧＩＳ ） （Ｓｃｉｅｎｃｅ ｏｆ Ｗｈｅｒｅ）ＧＩＳ通过创造 管理 分析 和地图化空间数据 对空间的问题进行识别 监测 预     测等 本课程以城乡规划领域的具体实践问题为出发点 将 中相关的技  ＧＩＳ术进行讲解 并通过实际操作 锻炼学生理论结合实践的能力

law_name: 国土空间规划管理与法规
law_content: Based on the introduction to the characteristics and requirements of planning management activities, this course teaches the national spatial planning system and its current management features. It covers topics such as land use management, urban and rural planning management, historical and cultural heritage protection management, environmental protection management, as well as forest, grassland, and ocean management. The course will discuss relevant regulations regarding the preparation, implementation, and supervision of major planning initiatives.
zh_law_content: 本课程在介绍规划管理活动特点和要求的基础上 讲授国土空间规划体系及其现行管理特征 按照土地利用管理 城乡规划管理 历史文化遗产保护管理   环境保护管理 以及森林 草原 海洋管理等有关领域进行讲解 涉及主要规   划的编制管理 实施管理 监督管理等的相关规定

law_name: 城乡社区空间规划与设计
law_content: Urban-rural Community Space Planning and Design is an essential practical course for undergraduate students majoring in urban-rural planning in China. The course is designed to teach the theory of urban-rural community planning and design, and includes case studies, analysis of current situations, and group discussions. Students are required to complete course design and research reports based on topics provided by the instructor.
zh_law_content: 城乡社区空间规划与设计 是我国城乡规划专业本科生重要的实践必修课“ ” 课程设置在讲授城乡社区规划理论的基础上 结合案例解读 现状分析讨论  让同学们根据教师提供的题目完成课程设计和调研报告

law_content: In recent years, amidst global environmental changes, there has been a new wave of research on land resources, making land use a new hot topic in geography. Land evaluation and management have long been essential courses in the Geography Science program at Peking University. Renowned geographers, Professor Lin Chao and Professor Chen Chuankang, have both taught this course. Building upon years of teaching experience at Peking University, this course tightly integrates the two components of land evaluation and land management. In the land evaluation section, after briefly discussing the general issues in land evaluation research, it sequentially introduces the evaluation of current land use status, land potential, land suitability, land use sustainability, land ecology, and land economics. In the land management section, after introducing land systems, it focuses on the basic theories of land use planning and primarily covers the comprehensive land planning and specialized land planning. Finally, it presents the main contents of land administrative management. Additionally, this course incorporates the development trend of land science in the context of global changes, timely presenting topics such as land quality indicators, sustainable land use, land ecological evaluation, land consolidation, and land use regulation. This course lays a foundation for students to engage in land resource management, comprehensive geographical research, resource development and environmental protection, land resource surveys, regional development and land governance, as well as urban planning.

law_content: With the rapid development of society and the continuous improvement of people's living standards, environmental health issues have attracted high attention from countries around the world. Severe ecological problems have brought great health hazards to the people. According to statistics from the World Health Organization, 24% of the global disease burden and 23% of deaths can be attributed to environmental factors. In terms of regional differences, only 17% of deaths in developed countries can be attributed to environmental factors, while in developing countries, the figure can reach 25%. Specifically, environmental health refers to the study of the relationship between the natural environment and the health of the population, and reveals the occurrence and development patterns of the impact of environmental factors on the health of the population.

law_content: Spatial planning is a highly practical discipline. This course belongs to the design practice of national spatial planning. Based on the systematic summary of knowledge related to national spatial planning, this course provides basic data of specific cities for students to analyze and research. By understanding the characteristics and problems of this city, and determining the nature of the city based on regional development and conservation goals, students will be able to establish a plan.

law_content:
This course is an introductory course on biostatistical methods commonly used in public health and medical research. Through studying this course, students will master the basic concepts and methods of statistics and develop correct statistical analysis thinking, including the correspondence between data types and statistical methods, and the application conditions of statistical methods. The course aims to cultivate good statistical analysis habits and focus on training students' ability to solve practical problems.

The main content of this course includes the basic principles of biostatistics, basic models, and their software implementation. Specific topics include common probability distributions, parameter estimation and hypothesis testing, testing methods, analysis of variance (ANOVA), t-test models, correlation and regression models, as well as non-parametric statistical methods. The course covers basic theories of univariate and multivariate analysis, parametric and non-parametric methods, etc.

In addition, this course will also introduce Bayesian statistics and other cutting-edge theories in statistics. In addition to theoretical teaching, case studies using software such as SPSS will be conducted to further enhance students' understanding of statistical theory and its practical applications.
zh_law_content: 本课程是介绍公共卫生和医学研究中常用的生物统计方法的入门课程 通过对本课程的学习 使学生掌握统计学的基本概念与基本方法 树立正确的统计 分析思维 包括数据类型与统计方法的对应关系 统计方法的应用条件等（  ）培养良好的统计分析习惯 着重训练学生解决实际问题的能力 本课程的主要内容包括卫生统计学的基本原理 基本模型及其软件实现等三个部分 具体内容有常见的概率分布 参数估计和假设检验 检验方法 方差  ｔ 分析模型 相关和回归模型 以及非参数统计方法等内容 涵盖单变量 多变   ／量分析 参数 非参数方法等基础理论 ／ 此外 本课程还将介绍贝叶斯统计学和其他统计学的前沿理论 在理论教学 的同时 还将采用 软件进行案例教学 通过对实际数据集的分析训练 ＳＰＳＳ  让学生进一步理解统计理论及其实践

law_content: The research focuses on humans and their surrounding environment, elucidating the impacts of natural and living environments on human health and the response of the human body to the environment. The aim is to propose hygiene requirements and preventive measures in order to fully utilize beneficial environmental factors and control harmful environmental factors, thus improving human health and enhancing the overall health level of the population. The theoretical course mainly includes a brief history of environmental hygiene, the relationship between environment and health, research methods, atmospheric environmental hygiene, water body environmental hygiene, soil environmental hygiene, as well as residential and public place hygiene, environmental quality assessment, and health risk assessment. It also includes practical courses in environmental hygiene, such as laboratory testing of major pollutants in water and air, in order to cultivate students' practical abilities.
zh_law_content: 以人类及其周围的环境为研究对象 阐明人类赖以生存的自然环境和生活环境对人体健康的影响及人体对环境的作用产生的反应 旨在为充分利用有益环境因素和控制有害环境因素提出卫生要求和预防对策 增进人体健康 提高 整体人群健康水平 理论课主要包括环境卫生学发展简史 环境与健康的关 系及其研究方法 大气环境卫生 水体环境卫生 土壤环境卫生 以及住宅与公   共场所卫生 环境质量评价和健康危险度评价 同时还包括环境卫生学实习课程 实验室检测水中主要污染物和大气中主要污染物等 培养学生的实践能 力

law_name: 地球科学概论（地球系统科学）
law_content: Earth is the only known planet with existing life forms, and since its formation, it has been a dynamic system sustained by energy from the Earth's interior and solar radiation. Earth is composed of various layers: the outermost layer, the atmosphere; the hydrosphere, which consists of water; the biosphere, where life exists; the innermost layer, the lithosphere; the asthenosphere; and the Earth's core. The movement of materials within each layer and the interactions between layers result in various geological processes and the birth of life, leading to the formation of the Earth as it is today. This course, based on systemic thinking, will be divided into modules, including an overview of the Earth system, Earth's subsystems, the dynamic Earth, historical Earth, and the research methods of the Earth system, particularly focusing on the climate system and the tectonic system, as well as their interactions. It will explain the basic concepts of the Earth system and its major geological processes, providing students with comprehensive scientific knowledge for further studies.
zh_law_content: 地球是迄今已知唯一存续生命的星球 形成以来一直是一个充满活力的动力系统 来自地球内部和太阳辐射能量维持这个动力系统持续的运转 地球是 由外圈 大气圈 水圈 生物圈 和内圈 岩石圈 软流圈 中圈和地核 构成的（   ） （   ）系统 各个圈层的物质运动和圈层之间发生的物理 化学和生物的相互作用 导致了各种各样的地质过程发生 导致了生命的诞生 造就了现今地球 本门  课程将立足系统论思想 分 个模块 分别为 地球系统概述 地球的子系 ５  “ ”“统 充满活力的地球 历史地球 和 地球系统的研究方法 特别从气候系”“ ”“ ” “ ”统和构造系统以及两个系统的相互作用视角 讲述地球系统的基本概念和主要的地质过程 使学生对地球系统的相关知识有一个全面的科学启蒙 为后续 学习打下基础

law_name: 地球科学概论（地球物理与空间物理）
law_content: Introduction to Earth Science covers the fundamental knowledge of various disciplines within the College of Earth and Space Science. It serves as a foundational course that guides students towards the realm of Earth science. It is also a compulsory course for all majors within the College of Earth and Space Science. The course aims to introduce the basic knowledge, research methods, and frontier topics in geophysics and space physics research.
zh_law_content: 地球科学概论 涵盖了地球与空间科学学院各二级学科的基础知识 是引导“ ” 学生进入地球科学之门的基础课程 也是地球与空间科学学院各专业的必修课 主旨为介绍地球物理学和空间物理学研究的基本知识 研究方法和前沿热 点

law_name: 地球科学概论（空间信息科学基础）
law_content: This course is one of the core courses for undergraduate students in the School of Earth and Space Sciences. It mainly teaches the basic theories and methods of spatial information science, enabling students to have a basic understanding and mastery of the theoretical foundation, mathematical foundation, method foundation, and technology foundation of spatial information science and technology. The course content is divided into two parts: remote sensing information science and geographic information science. While teaching scientific foundations, it deepens students' understanding of knowledge through rich application examples and preliminarily cultivates students' ability to analyze and solve problems using spatial information science and technology.
zh_law_content: 本课程为地球与空间科学学院大一本科学生的核心课程之一 主要讲授空间信息科学的基础理论和方法 使学生能基本理解和掌握空间信息科学和技术的理论基础 数学基础 方法基础和技术基础 课程内容分为遥感信息科学   地理信息科学两个部分 在讲授科学基础的同时 通过丰富的应用实例 加深  学生对知识的理解 并初步培养学生利用空间信息科学和技术方法分析问题和解决问题的能力

law_content: The Earth is composed of the atmosphere, hydrosphere, lithosphere, and biosphere, forming a system known as the Earth system. The evolution of the Earth system involves interactions among these spheres. Earth formed billions of years ago and, through a long process of evolution, gradually became a habitable planet for humans and other organisms. The evolution of habitable planets provides a historical and theoretical basis for predicting the future of the Earth and for exploring exoplanets and extraterrestrial civilizations.
zh_law_content: 地球是由大气圈 水圈 岩石圈 生物圈构成的系统 地球系统的演化涉及各个   ；圈层之间的相互作用 地球从 亿年之前形成 通过漫长的演化逐渐形成了 ４６ 适合人类 生物 居住的宜居行星 宜居行星的演化历程将为人类预测地球（ ） 的未来提供了历史的宜居 也为探寻地外宜居行星和地外文明提供了理论的

law_content: Geochemistry is a scientific discipline that studies the chemical composition, chemical activities, and chemical evolution of the Earth, using chemistry as its theoretical foundation. It focuses on elements, isotopes, and their chemical reactions and evolution. It is one of the fundamental courses in geology. The objective of this course is to integrate the geochemical behavior of elements with geological processes, with an emphasis on exploring the distribution, migration, and evolution of elements and isotopes in celestial bodies, the Earth, and geological bodies, as well as the physical and chemical environments during their formation. This course applies modern scientific technology and basic theories to analyze the important significance of geochemical processes in Earth's evolution, mineral resources, and human living environments. Through teaching, students will master the basic concepts, principles, and experimental techniques of geochemistry, understand the current research status and development trends in geochemistry. They will also learn the basic principles and methods of analyzing trace element content in geological samples through chemical analysis experiments, and acquire basic skills for conducting geochemical experiments.
zh_law_content: 地球化学是以化学类科学为理论基础来研究地球的化学组成 化学作用和化学演化的科学 以元素 同位素及其化学作用和化学演化为研究对象 是地学  专业的基础课程之一 课程的目的是以元素和同位素的地球化学性质为基础 把元素的地球化学行为与地质过程有机结合 重点探索元素和同位素在天 体 地球和地质体中的分布 迁移 演化等规律及形成时的物理化学环境 应用   现代科学技术和基本理论 分析地球化学过程在地球演化 矿产资源 人类生  存环境等方面的重要意义 通过教学使学生掌握地球化学的基本概念 基本 原理和实验技术方法 了解地球化学的研究现状和发展趋势 学生通过化学 分析实验 学会分析地质样品中微量元素含量的基本原理和方法 掌握从事地 球化学实验的基本技能

law_content: This course is a compulsory basic course for undergraduate students majoring in Solid Earth Geophysics. Its content serves as the foundation for other courses in the same major, such as Seismology, Geodynamics, etc. It also provides a basis for further study of subjects like Plasticity Mechanics, Fracture Mechanics, Viscoelasticity Mechanics, Nonlinear Mechanics, etc.
zh_law_content: 本课程是固体地球物理学专业本科生的必修专业基础课 其内容是本专业其他课程 如地震学 地球动力学等 的基础 同时也是进一步学习塑性力学 断（  ）  裂力学 黏弹性力学 非线性力学等力学课程的基础

law_content: Gravity is a branch of geophysics. The main task of this course is to study the shape of the Earth, the external gravitational field, the internal structure of the Earth, plate movement, and deformation. Through studying this course, students are required to master the basic knowledge of the Earth's gravitational field, the measurement and organization of gravity data, the analysis and interpretation of gravity data, research methods of gravimetry and Earth's shape, research methods of gravimetry and Earth's structure, and the Earth's gravity model and calculation methods. This course lays a solid foundation for further research on the Earth's gravitational field and related geological science issues.
zh_law_content: 重力学是地球物理学的一个分支学科 该课程的主要任务是研究地球形状 外部重力场 地球内部构造 板块运动及变形的科学 通过对本课程的学习要求学生掌握地球重力场的基础知识 重力数据的测量与整理 重力数据的分 析与解释 重力学与地球形状的研究方法 重力学与地球构造的研究方法 地  球重力模型与计算方法 为进一步研究地球重力场及相关地球科学问题打下坚实的基础

law_content: This course systematically introduces the theory and methods of signal processing in geophysics, focusing on the basic concepts and principles of digital signal processing. It lays a solid mathematical foundation for the analysis and processing of geophysical signals. In addition, it further covers specialized theories and methods for processing geophysical signals that are tailored to the characteristics of such signals.
zh_law_content: 本课程系统介绍地球物理学信号处理理论与方法 重点讲授数字信号处理理论的基本概念和原理 为地球物理信号的分析处理奠定扎实的数学理论基础 ；针对地球物理信号特点 进一步讲授相关的专门地球物理信号处理理论和方法

law_content: Seismology is an important part of geophysics. The purpose of this course is to introduce the theoretical foundations of modern seismology, laying the groundwork for further study or scientific research in the field of geophysics and related areas. The main topics include the basics of elastic mechanics and seismic waves, body wave and ray theory, surface waves and free oscillations, determination of internal structure of the Earth, and earthquake sources.
zh_law_content: 地震学是地球物理学的重要组成部分 本课程的目的是介绍现代地震学的理论基础 为进一步在地球物理学及相关领域的学习或从事科学研究奠定基础 主要内容包括 弹性力学基础与地震波 体波与射线理论 面波与自由震荡 地：   球内部结构的确定 地震震源

law_content: This course will focus on the basic principles, research methods, and classic research findings in geomagnetism and geoelectricity. Through the study of this course, it is hoped that students will have a clear overall understanding of the disciplines of geomagnetism and geoelectricity, laying a solid foundation for further in-depth study and engagement in geophysics or other Earth science research work.
zh_law_content: 本课程将着重讲授地磁学与地电学的基本原理 研究方法以及经典的研究成果 希望通过本课程的学习 使学生对地磁学与地电学学科有一个整体的 清  晰的图像 为进一步深入学习及从事地球物理学或其他地球科学研究工作奠定良好的基础

law_name: 地球物理数值计算方法
law_content: The numerical methods for solving partial differential equations in geophysics are an important component of various forward and inverse problems in geophysical studies. With the rapid development of computer hardware and software, their applications have become increasingly extensive. The purpose of this course is to introduce the numerical methods for solving partial differential equations in geophysics, laying a foundation for students to further study or conduct scientific research in the field of geophysics and related disciplines. The main contents include: introduction to partial differential equations in geophysics, finite difference method, spectral method, Fourier pseudospectral method, Chebyshev pseudospectral method, numerical calculation of seismic wave fields in complex Earth media. The course focuses on integrating theory and methods with program calculations. Through computational examples and result analysis, students will understand the theory and methods and learn several commonly used methods. They will also gain preliminary proficiency in the computational process through numerical experiments.
zh_law_content: 利用数值方法求解地球物理学中的偏微分方程 是各种地球物理正演问题和反演问题的重要内容 随着计算机硬件和软件的快速发展 其应用越来越广 泛 本课程的目的是介绍地球物理学中偏微分方程求解的数值方法 为学生 进一步在地球物理及相关领域的学习或科学研究奠定基础 主要内容包括 ：地球物理学中的偏微分方程介绍 有限差分方法 谱方法 傅立叶拟谱方法 切   比雪夫拟谱方法 复杂地球介质中地震波动场数值计算 特点是将理论和方 法介绍与程序计算紧密结合 通过计算实例和结果分析理解理论与方法 使 学生学到几种最常见的方法 并通过数值实验初步掌握计算过程

law_content: Learn basic knowledge of aerospace technology, including aerospace systems, spacecraft orbits, space transportation systems, spacecraft design and working principles, space environment and environmental testing.
zh_law_content: 学习基本的航天技术知识 包括 航天系统 航天器轨道 空间运输系统 航天 ：   器设计和工作原理 空间环境及环境试验

law_name: 空间等离子体物理基础
law_content: Mainly explains the basic theory of plasma physics and its application in relevant space physics. Introduces the basic concepts, fundamental properties, and research methods of plasma physics in a systematic manner.
zh_law_content: 主要讲解等离子体物理学的基本理论以及在相关空间物理中的应用 较为系统地介绍等离子体物理的基本概念 基本性质以及研究方法

law_content: Understanding the near-Earth space environment, the formation and dynamic processes of various regions of the magnetosphere, the main physical processes of aurora and substorms, understanding the mechanism and triggering mechanisms of magnetic storms, understanding artificial satellites, low-Earth orbit satellites, medium-Earth orbit satellites, geostationary orbit satellites, and geostationary transfer orbit satellites, and the dynamic changes in the space environment in which they are located (LEO, MEO, GEO, GTO).
zh_law_content: 认识近地空间环境 了解磁层各区域的形成和动力过程 极光亚暴的形成的主 要物理过程 认识磁暴的机理及其触发机制 认识人造卫星 低轨卫星 ； —中轨卫星 同步轨道卫星 和穿越轨道卫星 所处（ＬＥＯ） （ＭＥＯ） （ＧＥＯ） （ＧＴＯ）的空间环境的动力变化

law_name: 太阳大气层与日球层物理学
law_content: This course systematically explains the main detection results in the solar atmosphere and the photosphere, and the physical models established to explain the observational results. By comparing observations with theories, it elucidates the basic characteristics and physical processes of various layers in the solar atmosphere, including the photosphere, chromosphere, transition region, and corona, as well as their quiescent features and eruptive activities, such as chromospheric spicules, transition region explosive events, solar flares, and coronal mass ejections. It also discusses the origin of solar wind, the mechanisms of matter and energy supply, the structure in the interplanetary medium, and the interactions between the interplanetary magnetic cloud and the corona, including phenomena such as shocks, Alfvén waves, and turbulence (Alfvénic turbulence). The course also covers the outer boundary of the photosphere and the termination shock and the top of the solar atmosphere.
zh_law_content: 该课程系统地讲解在太阳大气层与日球层的主要探测结果 以及为解释观测结果建立的物理模型 通过把观测与理论比较 阐述基本特征和物理过程  该课程包括 太阳大气各层 光球 色球 过渡区和日冕 的宁静特征以及爆发： （   ）性活动 如色球针状物 过渡区爆发性事件 耀斑和日冕物质抛射 太阳风的（   ）起源 物质和能量的供应机制 行星际中的结构 行星际磁云和共转相互作（ ） （用区 波动 如激波 阿尔芬波 和湍流 阿尔芬湍流 外日球层 日球层边界） （  ） （ ） 终止激波和日球层顶

law_name: 电离层物理学与电波传播
law_content: The ionosphere is a part of the upper atmosphere of the Earth that undergoes ionization due to solar ultraviolet radiation. This ionization has a significant impact on the propagation of radio waves. This course primarily focuses on the historical research of the ionosphere, with emphasis on the formation, morphology, ion currents, and electromagnetic wave propagation in the ionosphere.
zh_law_content: 电离层是地球高层大气的一部分 该部分受到太阳紫外辐射的影响发生电离 该电离的部分足以影响到无线电波的传播 本课程以电离层研究历史为主．线 重点围绕电离层的形成 电离层的形态 电离层的电流 以及电磁波在电离   层中的传播等内容开展教学工作

law_content: Space weather is an emerging discipline in the field of space science. Space weather refers to the instantaneous or short-term variations in the state of the Sun's surface, solar wind, magnetosphere, ionosphere, and thermosphere. The state and changes in these phenomena can affect the performance and reliability of space and ground technology systems, endangering human life and health. Severe space weather can cause satellite malfunctions, communication disruptions, navigation problems, and power grid failures, resulting in significant socio-economic losses. This course primarily focuses on the impact of solar-induced space weather variations on Earth and its surface technology systems.
zh_law_content: 空间天气学是空间科学领域中一门新兴的学科 空间天气指的是瞬时或短时间内太阳表面 太阳风 磁层 电离层和热层的状态和变化 它们的状态和变   化可影响空间和地面技术系统的性能和可靠性 危及人类的生命和健康 恶 劣的空间天气可引起卫星运行 通信 导航以及电站输送网络的崩溃 造成各  方面的社会经济损失 本课程主要讲授的是由于太阳引起的空间天气变化对地球以及地球表面技术系统的影响

law_content: This course starts from the perspective of human-environment relationships, focusing on the basic principles, fundamental issues, fundamental knowledge, and basic research methods of physical geography and human geography. It is an essential knowledge content for undergraduate students majoring in geographic information systems and remote sensing. The course plays a vital role in students' mastery of the basic research and thinking methods of geography, correct understanding and solving of basic geographical problems in subsequent studies, as well as the establishment of the concept of harmonious development between humans and nature and sustainable socio-economic development. The course mainly includes two knowledge units: the foundation of physical geography and the foundation of human geography. The foundation of physical geography unit first introduces the research objects, tasks, and basic methods of physical geography, and then systematically introduces the formation process, basic characteristics, functions and positions, distribution and variation laws of various natural geographic elements of the earth's surface system, mainly including the crust, atmosphere, hydrology, biology, soil, and landforms. Based on this, in-depth study is conducted on the interrelationships and interactions between the various natural geographical elements, the basic integrity and differentiation laws of the natural geographical environment, and the relationship between humans and the natural geographical environment. The foundation of human geography unit first introduces the basic concepts and disciplinary system of human geography, and then introduces the theory of human-environment relationships, population growth and migration laws, classical location theory, regional and urban development strategies, and other basic principles. On this basis, the application of geographic information science in the fields of disaster, environment, health, social networks, smart cities, and other areas is discussed.
zh_law_content: 本课程从人地关系视角出发 重点讲授自然地理学和人文地理学的基本原理 基本问题 基础知识及基本研究方法 是地理信息系统和遥感等相关专业本科 学生必须掌握的地理学知识内容 课程对于学生掌握地理学基本研究和思考方法 正确理解和解决后续学习中所面对的基本地理问题 以及建立人与自然 协调发展以及社会经济持续发展的观念具有十分重要的作用课程主要包括自然地理学基础和人文地理学基础两个知识单元 自然地理学基础单元首先介绍自然地理学的研究对象 任务和基本方法 之后从地理 环境的整体性出发 依次对地球表层系统的各自然地理要素的形成过程 基本 特征 作用与地位 分布与变化规律等进行系统性的介绍 主要包括地壳 大   气 水文 生物 土壤及地貌等自然地理要素 在此基础上对各个自然地理要   素之间的相互关系和相互作用 自然地理环境的基本整体性和差异性规律 人 类与自然地理环境的关系等内容进行深入学习 人文地理学基础单元首先介绍人文地理学基本概念和学科体系 然后介绍人文地理学中的人地关系论 人 口增长和迁移规律 古典区位论 区域 城市发展战略等基本原理 在此基础  － 上 对地理信息科学在灾害 环境 健康 社交网络 智慧城市等领域的热点研究进行了简要的介绍

law_content:
Main content:
Basic concept of remote sensing, principles of remote sensing imaging, acquisition of remote sensing images, processing and interpretation of remote sensing images, and applications of remote sensing.

Characteristics of the course:
Emphasis on advanced and forward-looking nature, drawing on teaching systems and content from both domestic and international sources. Pay attention to the latest advancements in the field of remote sensing, maintaining systematic and scientific approach. Progressive introduction of basic knowledge with connected teaching content. Enhance the combination of foundational and practical aspects, focusing on remote sensing imaging principles, image processing, interpretation methods, and the close integration of remote sensing applications.

law_content: Cartography is one of the foundational subjects in Earth Information Science. This course follows the logical sequence of spatial object positioning on the Earth, conversion from spherical space to map plane, abstraction and simplification of spatial information, visualization of spatial information, and map application. The course emphasizes the introduction of commonly used Earth coordinate systems, map projections, geographic information synthesis, map visualization, as well as modern cartographic techniques and methods of map application. In terms of teaching format, the course adopts a combination of classroom teaching, post-class exercises, classroom internships, and self-study. Through systematic learning and practice in this course, students will acquire a solid understanding of the basic theories, techniques, and methods of map production, and develop the ability to process spatial data, spatial cognition, and basic map-making skills.

law_content: To enable students to have a comprehensive and complete understanding of the basic concepts, data structures, technical systems, and application methods of Geographic Information Systems (GIS), as well as to acquire preliminary operational skills in software. The fundamental principles and knowledge of GIS covered in this course include: basic concepts, components, and historical development of GIS; GIS data models and data structures; system architecture and main functions; spatial analysis models; application of GIS; GIS methodologies; application examples and future development prospects. Additionally, appropriate programming and software operation content will be included. The former aims to provide students with a intuitive understanding of the underlying principles through initial data structure coding, etc., and to establish the concept of graphical programming for GIS. The latter focuses on cultivating students' basic operational skills in GIS, from data input, database establishment, queries, analysis, to output.

law_content: Satellite navigation positioning technology is a very important development direction in the field of earth observation. Its applications cover a wide range of fields including military, public security, mapping, marine, geological, mining, agriculture, environment, aerospace, and even transportation, environment, meteorology, earthquakes, and other areas closely related to daily life. Satellite navigation devices have become indispensable tools in various fields. There are multiple global satellite navigation systems internationally, and China is also developing the Beidou global navigation system. The development and application of these satellite navigation systems have had a significant and far-reaching impact on the development of related fields in China and internationally. How to efficiently use the data obtained from satellite navigation devices to further analyze various dynamic information in related fields has become an important aspect of frontier exploration in these fields. Therefore, knowledge of satellite navigation positioning technology and its applications is essential for professionals in the field of earth observation. This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the basics of satellite navigation positioning, including its principles, methods, and simple applications. The course focuses on the composition of the U.S. system and the Chinese Beidou system, signal processing of GPS, calculation principles of single-point positioning and navigation, and methods of real-time dynamic positioning and navigation, among other topics. The course also combines laboratory sessions to enable students to master relevant algorithms and the use of user modules and receiver terminals. This lays the foundation for further in-depth study and application of the related theories and technologies of satellite navigation positioning.

law_content: Natural phenomena in space involve complex nonlinear physical processes. Human understanding of their essence is inseparable from computer-based simulation. This course systematically explains how to apply numerical simulation to space physics, in order to describe the basic physical processes of natural phenomena in space, including single particle dynamics, magnetohydrodynamics, mechanics, plasma dynamics, etc. It introduces the conditions for different numerical simulation methods and their applications. It also provides detailed guidance on how to conduct numerical simulations, such as problem definition, numerical format, initial and boundary conditions, program design, and multidimensional dynamic visualization.

law_content: Digital image processing is an important means of expressing spatial remote sensing information and is a direct and objective representation of ground geographical information. Remote sensing digital image processing includes a basic understanding of the system software and hardware of image processing, the digital representation of optical phenomena, mathematical transformations of images, enhancement, restoration, grayscale and binary processing, discrimination between true and false colors, image compression and decompression, image analysis, etc. Based on the above theories, through the flexible application of basic image software and relevant processing techniques, basic discrimination and analysis of remote sensing images can be achieved. The characteristic is to provide basic skills for analyzing problems using image processing methods in this field in the future.

law_content: Earth science is a highly interdisciplinary scientific field. Scientists use methods such as physics, chemistry, biology, and mathematics to understand the evolution of Earth and even the solar system. Planetary geoscience, as an introductory course to Earth science, aims to help lower-grade students establish basic concepts regarding scientific questions and thinking in the field of Earth science. Considering students' disciplinary interests, this course will focus on chemical principles to explore important geochemical processes that the solar system and Earth system have experienced during their formation and evolution. The content covers basic principles of geochemistry, the origin of elements, early chemical differentiation processes in the solar system, internal structure of the Earth, and plate tectonics, among others. This course combines classroom teaching, discussions, field observations, and participation in geochemical laboratories to enhance students' learning experiences and enjoyment.

law_content: Geophysics is a discipline that heavily relies on observational data. Through the analysis of a large amount of observational data, new phenomena and theories are discovered, leading to continuous development. The aim of this course is to deepen students' understanding of theoretical knowledge through practical field observation and data processing. It also aims to cultivate their ability to acquire, process, and interpret data, as well as develop their skills in problem discovery and solving. This course lays the foundation for students to further engage in scientific research in the field of geophysics and related areas. The main contents include field investigations of surface geological phenomena, learning advanced processing techniques in geophysics, designing seismic observation arrays, and processing and interpretation of seismic observation data.

The main content includes introduction, requirement investigation and feasibility analysis, system design, system implementation, system testing, system maintenance and evaluation, geospatial information system engineering management, geospatial information system engineering application, and discussions on trends and issues in geospatial information system engineering.

The content of the course mainly includes the following aspects: composition and current status of planetary surfaces, geological processes and their features on planetary surfaces, planetary surface processes and habitability, etc.

law_content: In the field of planetary science, minerals are letters and rocks are words. Planetary science is a captivating story written with letters and words to explore the unknown scientific questions in the field. To begin with, understanding planetary substances is essential. Planetary material science course is divided into four main parts. The first part is crystallography and mineralogy. It mainly includes the structure and properties of crystals, the fundamentals of crystal chemistry such as close-packing principles, chemical bonds, lattice types, coordination numbers and polyhedra, as well as the random packing of particles, including crystal packing density, porosity, and stacking characteristics. It also covers the types of water existing in mineral structures, their molecular refractive indices, volumes, and their impact on mineral physical properties. Furthermore, it discusses the classification and naming of mineral structures, the statistical crystallography problems and applications in silicate geology, according to Thompson. The second part focuses on mineral crystal optics. This is an important scientific process of identifying minerals under a polarizing microscope.

law_content: This course is one of the core foundational courses in the field of geoscience. It primarily introduces the various scales of structural formations and their possible dynamic processes on Earth and similar terrestrial planets. Earth is the main object of analysis and foundation, while the structures and dynamics of related terrestrial planets are also dissected. The course first explains the overall structure and layering of Earth from a physical perspective. It then provides a detailed introduction to the history, core content, and latest developments in plate tectonics theory, with a special focus on Earth's dynamics, particularly mantle dynamics including mantle plumes. After understanding Earth's dynamics, the course discusses the deformation of rocks under geological stress, covering both brittle and ductile deformation mechanisms and their structural implications. Subsequently, using structural dynamics as a guide, different types of structures in various geological environments such as extension, compression, and strike-slip are described. The final part of the course focuses on planetary structures. In addition to basic concepts in planetary tectonics, the course selects the Moon, Venus, and Mars as key objects of analysis, discussing their formation history, overall characteristics, and possible internal structures, with particular emphasis on interpreting planetary structural types. The course also explores the process of planetary structural evolution.

law_content: The basic purpose of this course is to help students understand the fundamental principles of paleobiology, become proficient in the basic research methods of paleobiology, gain knowledge of the research frontiers and hot topics in the field, and develop an understanding of the co-evolution of historical biodiversity and Earth's life.

law_content: Psychology is the science that studies human behavior and mental processes. Like most other textbooks that introduce "psychology," the main textbook for this course, "Psychology and Life," also starts with this line in Chapter 1. This may be a widely accepted definition of psychology: the study of human behavior and mental processes. We can understand the research and interesting but serious conclusions drawn by psychologists over the past century through various different means. In this course, I will serve as your guide and try to lead you into this magical journey with my own understanding. The general itinerary of the journey is as follows: first, we will construct a brain and then study how this brain senses and interprets information, how it reacts, gains consciousness, remembers and forgets, thinks, loves, and grieves, and how it develops over time with its own characteristics. Until the end of this course, we will see how terrifying and tragic it can be when the brain becomes sick... mistake. During this time, we will also explore how this brain forms a community with other brains, how they communicate with each other, and so on. In short, throughout our entire journey, we will always be accompanied by this fascinating brain. Also, please remember these relationships: genes and evolution, nature and nurture, individual and environment, individual and group. We will constantly emphasize these relationships in the course, which, at least for me, is the essence of psychology.

law_content: Psychological Statistics is the second statistics course for undergraduate students in the College of Psychology and Cognitive Science. It expands upon the content of Statistics in Psychology and covers the basic use of statistics in psychological research. The goal of this course is to teach students how to correctly handle various types of data in psychological research and applications. law_content: Experimental psychology is a branch of psychology that focuses on the use of experimental methods. Therefore, it can be said that experimental psychology is a foundational course in the study of psychology. Psychology is an experimental science, and all its branches require the use of experimental methods for research. Compared to traditional observational methods, experimental methods are a more effective way to discover causal relationships between phenomena under controlled conditions. Additionally, experiments can be repeated at any time. Therefore, experimental psychology is an important core course in psychology education. This course first introduces experimental methods, psychophysics, reaction time, and other general research methods. Then, it uses specific studies on attention, perception, vision and hearing, memory, thinking, consciousness, psycholinguistics, and social cognition to illustrate the application of these methods. The course focuses on the specific ideas and classical procedures in the study of various psychological processes. It not only introduces the main results of research, but also helps students understand how these experiments are designed and how the results are obtained from the experiments. In addition, this course also includes classic experiments from experimental psychology lab sessions to assist in developing students' basic skills in psychology, including understanding research literature and independent design.

law_content: Experimental psychology is a course that focuses on the research methods in psychology. It consists of both theoretical and practical components. In the experimental psychology lab, students learn about the fundamental principles of experimental design by conducting various teaching experiments. This helps them gain a deeper understanding of scientific research papers in psychology and lays a foundation for their future involvement in scientific research. In addition to familiarizing students with classic experimental methods in psychology, the lab also introduces them to new research methods and techniques that have emerged in the field. The experimental psychology lab includes nearly 10 experiments, covering a range of areas such as psychophysics, reaction time, visual and auditory perception, attention, memory, thinking, and language. Students are required to actively participate in the experiments, collect data, perform statistical analysis, and write experimental reports. This course provides comprehensive training in experimental design, implementation, data processing, and paper writing, enabling students to objectively evaluate the scientific and logical validity of experiments and develop the ability to independently engage in psychological experimental research. The lab is crucial for cultivating students' professional interests in the field.

law_content: The Experimental Class of Algorithm Design and Analysis is the specialized core course for second-year undergraduate students majoring in computer science and intelligent technology in the School of Information Science and Technology at Peking University. By studying this course, students not only establish a solid foundation for learning other specialized courses but also play an important role in cultivating their computational thinking and problem-solving abilities. In the face of numerous practical problems in various application fields, it is crucial to choose the correct solution approach based on the nature of the problem, that is, to find a good algorithm. Especially in the processing of complex and massive information, a good algorithm often plays a decisive role.

law_content: This course starts with algorithm design, systematically introducing general methods and common patterns for algorithm design. It revolves around issues such as algorithm correctness, algorithm complexity, and problem complexity. It introduces the basic methods for algorithm proof, mathematical foundations of algorithm analysis, and common techniques for analyzing problem complexity. The main content includes algorithm proof, asymptotic analysis, and recursive solution as the foundation of algorithm analysis. It covers commonly used algorithm design methods such as divide and conquer, greedy algorithms, dynamic programming, and backtracking. It also discusses completeness and polynomial reduction, NP computational complexity theory, approximation algorithms, random algorithms, local search, parallel algorithms, and online algorithms as advanced algorithm design methods and related analysis techniques.

law_content: Signals and Systems is a core foundational course in the field of communication and signal processing.
