law_content: This course is a basic course for undergraduate students majoring in Materials Science and Engineering. It is also an elective course for undergraduate students from other majors in the School of Engineering and graduate students from various disciplines. The course includes four parts: Fundamentals of Materials Chemistry, Principles and Methods of Material Chemistry Preparation, Functional Materials Chemistry, and Application of Material Chemistry in several research areas of new materials. In the first part, the discipline of materials chemistry is introduced from the perspectives of materials science, chemistry, and crystallography, providing students with the necessary basic knowledge for this course based on their own situation, and guiding them on how to study materials chemistry. The second part focuses on the principles and methods of chemical synthesis and preparation of materials, including solid-phase, liquid-phase, and gas-phase chemistry synthesis. The third part uses various types of functional materials as examples to reveal the relationship between the composition, chemical preparation, treatment of materials, and their structure and properties. The fourth part provides examples of the application of materials chemistry in the design and preparation of new materials. The latest advances in materials chemistry are introduced during the teaching process to cultivate students' interest in studying this course.
zh_law_content: 本课程是材料科学与工程系本科生的专业基础课 同时也是工学院其他专业本科生及各专业研究生的选修课 课程包括材料化学基础 材料化学制备原 理及方法 功能材料化学及材料化学在几类新型材料研究领域中的应用四个部分 第一部分从材料科学基础 化学基础 晶体学基础介绍材料化学的学科  基础 以便学生根据自己的情况有选择地完善该门课程所需的基础知识 同时 引导学生如何学习材料化学 第二部分别从固相 液相及气相化学合成等方 法着重阐述材料的化学合成与制备原理 第三部分以几类功能材料为例 揭 示材料的组成 化学制备及处理与材料的结构 性能之间的关系 第四部分举  例介绍材料化学在新型材料的设计和制备中的应用 授课过程中尽量介绍材料化学的最新进展 培养学生学习该门课程的兴趣

law_content: Feedback control is one of the key technologies in modern engineering and an important aspect in aerospace design. The main content of this course is to introduce the characteristics and design methods of feedback control systems, including the necessity and advantages of feedback control, the time-domain and frequency-domain response characteristics and performance indicators of the system, control PID design, stability and stability criteria, root locus design methods for single-input single-output linear systems, criteria, frequency domain design methods, and state space design methods. The Nyquist criterion for system response and controller design is also covered. The primary software used is [insert software name].

law_content: Computational simulation of materials has become an important branch of materials science, integrating various disciplines such as condensed matter physics, materials physics, theoretical chemistry, materials mechanics, engineering mechanics, and computational algorithms. By using calculations and simulations, we can not only understand the structure and functionality of materials from a microscopic viewpoint, but also design new materials from a fundamental perspective. This course mainly introduces the principles and methods of materials computation and simulation, as well as their applications in engineering. It enables students to apply their knowledge in basic physics and mathematics by numerically designing and developing novel structural and functional materials.
zh_law_content: 材料的计算模拟已成为材料科学的一个重要分支 它综合了凝聚态物理 材料 物理学 理论化学 材料力学和工程力学 机算法等多门相关学科 通过计算   模拟我们不仅可以从微观机理的角度理解材料的结构与功能 而且从原理的角度设计新材料 本课程主要介绍材料计算与模拟的基本原理与方法及其在工程中的应用 让学生把所学的基本物理理论和数学理论数值化 通过数值 模拟去设计和开发新型的结构材料和功能材料

law_content: Fundamentals of Engineering Fluid Mechanics is one of the main foundational courses for majors such as Thermal Energy and Power Engineering, Petroleum and Natural Gas Engineering, and Petroleum Machinery. The purpose of this course is to provide necessary theoretical and experimental skills for studying professional courses and engaging in engineering technical work. The teaching of this course focuses on explaining the basic principles of fluid mechanics and its applications in engineering, including introduction, fluid statics, fundamentals of ideal fluid dynamics, fundamentals of viscous fluid dynamics, rotational and potential flows, and fundamentals of gas dynamics.

law_content: Systemic anatomy is the study of the morphology, structure, position, and adjacency of various organs of the human body based on their respective systems. The taught subjects include the musculoskeletal system, digestive system, respiratory system, urinary system, reproductive system, vascular system, nervous system, endocrine system, and sensory organs. The teaching format consists of theoretical classes and practical sessions. The theoretical classes are primarily taught by teachers, while the practical sessions are conducted in the anatomy laboratory. The teaching involves small group classes, combining teacher lectures with student observation of human specimens. Interactive teaching and learning are emphasized, with the use of multimedia images, human specimens, models, atlases, etc., which are common auxiliary teaching materials and tools for studying anatomy.

law_content: Through theoretical learning, students will master the basic principles of the occurrence and regulatory mechanisms of various life processes in the human body, as well as understand the current development status of modern physiology, in order to lay a foundation for further studying pathology and various clinical courses.
zh_law_content: 通过理论学习 使学生掌握关于正常人体各种生命活动过程的发生原理及其调节机制的基本理论 了解现代生理学的发展状况 为进一步学习病理学及各 临床课程打下基础

law_content: This course is an important foundational course in electronic technology. It is the first circuit course for undergraduate students majoring in electronic and computer engineering, as well as robotics engineering. The course covers the assumptions of lumped circuits, including resistive elements and networks, independent and dependent sources, amplifiers, energy-storage elements, first and second-order dynamic networks, time-domain and frequency-domain analysis and design of analog circuits and applications. By studying this course, students will understand the principles of electrical engineering and be able to apply engineering abstraction models to analyze and design simple electronic circuits, as well as understand how nonlinear elements are represented using simple models in circuits. Furthermore, students will gain an understanding of the practical significance of the developed systems within the course, such as MOSFET. This course provides students with the basic knowledge, theories, and skills in analog electronic technology, laying a foundation for further study and application of electronic technology.
zh_law_content: 本课程是电子技术基础的一个门重要基础课程 是电子与计算机专业和机器人工程等专业本科生的第一门电路课程 课程介绍了集总电路假设 主要内 容包括电阻元件和网络 独立和非独立源 放大器 储能元件 一阶和二阶动态   网络 时频域分析和设计 模拟电路及应用 通过本课程的学习使学生了解电  气工程原理 并且能够应用工程抽象模型分析和设计简单的电子电路 理解 用简单的模型表示电路中的非线性元件 如 等 了解课程中开发的系 ＭＯＳＦＥＴ 统的实际意义 本课程通过对常用电子器件 模拟电路及其系统的分析和设 计学习 使学生获得模拟电子技术方面的基本知识 基本理论和基本技能 为  深入学习和应用电子技术打下基础

law_content: This course is a core course for undergraduate students and serves as a foundation for further research and design of electronic circuits. The course includes topics such as digital logic mathematics, digital circuit fundamentals, combinatorial logic analysis and design, sequential logic analysis and design, analog-to-digital conversion, interface circuits, hardware description language, etc. The course focuses on developing students' abilities, emphasizes integrating and applying their acquired knowledge, cultivates their problem identification and problem-solving skills, and emphasizes in-depth study of fundamental knowledge and its practical application.
zh_law_content: 该课程是本科生的专业核心课程 是进一步研究和设计电子电路的基础 课 程包括数字逻辑数学基础 数字电路电路基础 组合逻辑分析与设计 时序逻  辑分析与设计 模拟数字间转换 接口电路 硬件描述语言等内容   课程重视对学生能力的培养 注重将学生已学知识融会贯通 注重培养发 现问题能力 解决问题的能力在知识层面 注重基础知识的深入研究 注重知识的运用

law_content: Based on the foundation of mechanical design and theoretical mechanics courses, this course aims to develop students' abilities in dynamic modeling and analysis, as well as basic experiments related to robot kinematics and dynamics. It focuses on cultivating students' skills in analyzing interactive forces during robot operation. Through practical operations and mechanism design, students will master the functionality of typical mechanical structures and gain knowledge of cutting-edge technologies such as dual-arm collaboration, human-robot collaboration, and human-robot interaction. Students are encouraged to propose new experimental content and participate in hands-on activities in the classroom.
zh_law_content: 基于机械设计基础和理论力学课程 设计动力学建模分析与基础实验 重点培 养学生对于移动机器人运动学和动力学分析能力 机器人操作过程中的交互力分析能力 通过实际操作和机构设计 掌握典型机械结构功能 了解双臂  协作 人机协作 人机交互等前沿技术 鼓励学生自设实验新内容 实践课堂

law_content:
This course provides a comprehensive and systematic introduction to the basic knowledge of robotics and preliminary practical engineering of robots. The knowledge is divided into three parts. 

Part 1: Basic knowledge includes the definition of robots, their basic components, the history of robot development, ancient robots, bio-inspired robots, intelligent robots, robot competitions, etc. 

Part 2: Application of robots includes military robots, industrial robots, agricultural robots, medical robots, commercial robots, household robots, etc. 

Part 3: Development of robots includes soft robots, micro-nano robots, development of new technologies for robots, human-machine interaction, robot ethics, etc. 

The practical part, Cyborg, includes six practice units: wheeled robots, robotic arms, humanoid robots, aerial drones, biomimetic robots such as robotic fish. By combining pictures, videos, live demonstrations, and engineering practice, students will gain a comprehensive and systematic understanding of robotics and be inspired to study and research robots.
zh_law_content: 本课程全面系统介绍机器人学相关的基础知识和初步机器人工程实践 知识讲述分三个部分 一 基础知识部分包括什么是机器人 机器人的基本组成：（ ）  机器人发展简史 古代机器人 仿生机器人 智能机器人 机器人竞赛等    二 机器人应用部分包括军事机器人 工业机器人 农业机器人 医疗机器（ ）   人 商用机器人 家用机器人等 三 机器人发展部分包括软体机器人 微纳   （ ） 机器人 系统 发展机器人的新技术 人机交互 机器伦理等 实践部分Ｃｙｂｏｒｇ    包括 个实践单元 轮式机器人 机械手臂 仿人机器人 空中无人机 仿生机５ ：    器鱼 通过结合图片 视频 实物演示的讲解 以及工程实践环节 让学生对机    器人学有全面系统的认识和理解 激发学生对机器人的学习与研究兴趣

law_content: Environmental science is a problem-oriented interdisciplinary subject that emerged in response to various global and domestic environmental issues in our country. It has developed alongside the progress of human society. Today, environmental science has gained significant attention due to the endless emergence of environmental problems and their complex and ever-changing nature. The future sustainable development of human society will heavily rely on our ability to identify and solve environmental problems. Therefore, today's students, the talents of the future, should possess a strong environmental awareness and the comprehensive ability to analyze and solve environmental problems. The environmental issues course is offered by the College of Environmental Science and Engineering for undergraduate freshmen. It is taught by academic experts with the participation of multiple young and middle-aged teachers in case design and teaching. We also invite domestic and foreign experts to deliver special lectures and research assistants to establish a teaching website and provide online consultations. This teaching team will guide students to approach environmental problems, enter the door of environmental science, and select historical and current typical environmental problems as case studies, continuously updating environmental data or supplementary new environmental events. The course adopts heuristic and interactive teaching methods to lead students to face environmental problems, trace their root causes, evaluate their environmental hazards and ecological pressures, analyze their socioeconomic impacts, and propose possible solutions and coping strategies. In the process of understanding environmental problems, students learn basic methods for analyzing and evaluating environmental problems, understand the basic approaches to solving environmental problems, and cultivate an interest in exploring environmental science. There are no prerequisites for students who wish to take this course.

law_content: The environmental science and engineering field is highly practical. Students in this field need to participate in various experimental operations and field activities related to water, soil, air, and biology. Safety in laboratory and field internships is the foremost responsibility and essential knowledge. The facilities for environmental experiments have similar safety requirements to traditional chemistry, biology, and physics laboratories, but also have some unique safety procedures specific to this profession. These procedures involve hazardous substances.
zh_law_content: 环境科学与工程方向是实践性较强的学科 该方向的学生需要参与水土气生各项实验操作及野外实践活动 实验室及野外实习的安全是首要责任和必需的知识 环境类实验的场所与传统的化学实验室 生物实验室 物理实验室等  有相同的一些安全要求 也有本专业特色的一些安全操作规程 既涉及危险化

law_content: This course is a fundamental professional course in Environmental Science and Engineering. Building on the foundation of environmental issues, the course aims to stimulate students' interest in various disciplines and frontiers of Environmental Science and Engineering. Through studying this course, students will grasp and comprehend the current academic frontiers, focuses, and scientific problems in disciplines such as atmosphere, water, environmental management, and environmental health. The course aims to cultivate and guide students' interests in major disciplines related to environmental science and engineering, as well as their ability to recognize and analyze scientific problems.
zh_law_content: 本课程为环境科学与工程的基础专业课程 在环境问题的课程基础之上 以激 发学生对于环境科学与工程各学科方向及前沿的兴趣为目的 通过本课程的学习 使学生掌握和理解在大气 水 环境管理 环境健康等方向目前的学科前   沿 学科重点及存在的科学问题 解决途径 培养和引导学生在环境科学与工  程相关主要学科方向的兴趣及对科学问题的认知和分析能力

law_content: Environmental science is a core course for undergraduate students majoring in Environmental Science and Engineering. This course was awarded the national-level Excellent Course in 2011. While introducing the basic concepts and theories of environmental science, this course emphasizes the cultivation of students from the perspective of discovering, solving, predicting, and preventing environmental problems. It aims to enable students to systematically master the research methods of environmental science, including the analysis and judgment of problems, the inherent logical relationship of interdisciplinary science, and the approach to proposing solutions. This course consists of four parts: ecological problems and ecological laws, physical and chemical processes in the environment, biological processes in the environment and environment and health, and characteristics and causes of environmental problems. The teaching methods of this course mainly include course lectures and group discussions. At the beginning of the semester, students are divided into groups to choose a problem and gradually deepen their thinking about this problem at different stages throughout the semester. While learning to consult literature, they systematically analyze and discuss the problem's formulation, identification of causes, and thoughts and solutions for problem solving, and ultimately draw conclusions.
zh_law_content: 环境科学是环境科学与工程专业本科生的核心课 该课程在 年被评为国 ２０１１家级精品课程 本课程在介绍环境科学的基础概念和理论的同时 强调从环 境科学的本质 即从发现 解决问题到预测 预防问题的角度来培养学生 使他   们能系统掌握环境科学的研究方法 包括分析和判断问题的思路 交叉科学的 内在逻辑关系以及提出解决方案的途径 本课程由四部分组成 生态问题与 ：生态规律 环境中的物理与化学过程 环境中的生物过程及环境与健康 以及  环境问题的特征与成因 本课程的教学方式主要包括课程讲授与小组讨论 开学初学生分组 选择一个问题 在一学期中不同阶段针对这一问题逐步深入 思考 在学会查阅文献的同时 从问题的提出 问题成因的识别 解决问题的思   路和方案进行系统分析讨论 最终得出结论

law_content: This course focuses on monitoring the main pollutants in environmental media and environmental pollution. It teaches the basic principles and analytical techniques in various stages of environmental monitoring, as well as quality assurance in the process of environmental monitoring and the latest advancements in environmental monitoring technology. The content includes an introduction, monitoring of water pollution, atmospheric environment monitoring, soil and solid waste monitoring, noise and radioactive pollution monitoring, emergency monitoring, quality assurance and quality control in environmental monitoring. This course highlights the characteristics of environmental monitoring, such as sampling, site selection, testing methods, data processing, and quality assurance. It emphasizes the learning of fundamental theories and the integration of scientific research practices, closely linking the needs of environmental pollution monitoring in China. It takes into account both conventional monitoring methods and the application of new instruments, new methods, and new technologies in modern monitoring techniques. Through this course, students are expected to gain an understanding of the basic theories of environmental science involved in environmental monitoring, comprehend the trends of environmental problems and the methods for monitoring and evaluating environmental quality, develop the ability to conduct routine environmental monitoring and data analysis, and explore environmental monitoring research work in an exploratory manner.

law_content: This course is aimed at meeting the monitoring needs of the major pollutants in environmental media and environmental pollution. It provides training in sampling and analysis techniques for various stages of environmental monitoring. This course is complemented by the theoretical course on environmental monitoring, covering the analysis techniques for monitoring pollutants in the atmosphere, indoor air, water bodies, soil, and sediments. It includes experimental design, sampling, sample handling, instrument operation, data organization, and analysis, as well as quality assurance throughout the entire experimental process. It relies heavily on the monitoring and analysis capabilities of the Experimental Teaching Center of the School of Environmental Science and Engineering and the State Key Laboratory of Environmental Simulation and Pollution Control, as well as the City Atmospheric Observatory. Advanced monitoring and analytical instruments, such as atmospheric automatic monitoring instruments, ion chromatography, gas chromatography-mass spectrometry, and independently developed instruments by Peking University, are provided for independent operation training.
zh_law_content: 本课程针对环境介质和环境污染问题中主要污染物的监测需求 提供环境监测各个环节的采样 分析技术训练 本课程与环境监测理论课的讲述相配合  提供大气 室内空气 水体 土壤 沉积物中污染物监测的分析技术训练 涵盖    实验设计 采样 样品处理 仪器操作 数据整理和分析 实验质量保障的全过    程 充分依靠环境科学与工程学院实验教学中心和环境模拟与污染控制国家重点实验室以及城市大气定位观测站的监测和分析能力支持 提供先进的监测和分析仪器 如大气自动监测仪 离子色谱 气质联用 北大自主研发仪器等   的独立操作训练

law_content: Environmental Management is the most important social science foundation and core course in the field of environmental humanities and social sciences in the undergraduate program of environmental science. It covers the basic theories and applied knowledge of public administration, public policy, and environmental management, as well as the technical support and assurance system, technological methods, and institutional arrangements and policy measures of environmental management. It also focuses on specific management of various factors, such as enterprises, industries, regions, and global environmental management. The course aims to equip students with a grasp of the basic theories and methods of public administration, an understanding of the framework and main theories and methods of environmental management research, knowledge about the current status and progress of environmental management, familiarity with common environmental management tools and methods, and the ability to apply the acquired knowledge to analyze and solve actual environmental problems.
zh_law_content: 环境管理学 是环境科学本科专业环境人文社会科学领域的最重要的环境“ ”社会科学基础和核心课程 通过讲授公共管理与 公共政策与环境管理的基本 理论和应用知识 环境管理的技术支持和 保证体系和技术方法 环境管理的；  ；制度安排和政策手段 各类要素 企业 产业 区域与全球环境管理的具体管理；  ＼ 理论与实践 使学生掌握公共管理的基本理论和基本方法 掌握环境管理研究 ；的框架体系 及主要的理论和方法 了解环境管理学的现状及进展主要理论与 方法 熟悉和掌握常见的环境管理手段和方法 提高运用所学相关知识 分析； ； 和解决实际环境问题的能力

law_content: Environmental issues are a reflection of economic and social development. Solving environmental problems requires a deep understanding of the issues from a scientific perspective, as well as knowledge of the social and economic factors behind them. The design of research methodology courses takes into account the characteristics of environmental problems, providing a systematic introduction to the scientific thinking of environmental research. The course mainly focuses on logical reasoning methods, research design methods, data collection, analysis, and presentation methods. From a disciplinary perspective, it systematically introduces commonly used basic model research methods and conducts in-depth analysis of various methods, using examples from environmental science, anthropology, sociology, and economics. The aim of the course is to cultivate students' ability to engage in practical environmental research, enhance their logical thinking ability, research design ability, and data analysis ability.

law_content: The course on Analysis of Environmental Decision-making Cases is the last compulsory course in the undergraduate teaching system of the college. It guides students to integrate their previously learned theoretical knowledge in environmental science, environmental management, and environmental engineering to solve environmental problems. The distinctive features of this course are its openness, integration, and practicality. Its aim is to integrate the scattered knowledge acquired by students during their university stage into a unified whole, and to provide them with the opportunity to experience and actively participate before entering advanced research or work stages.
zh_law_content: 环境决策案例分析课程为学院本科生教学体系中的最后一门学科必修课程引导学生运用之前学习的环境科学 环境管理与环境工程等理论知识集成解决环境问题 其特点是开放性 整合性和实践性 其目标是将学生大学阶段学  到的分散的知识整合为统一整体 为学生提供进入高阶段研究学习或工作前的体验和实际参与机会

law_content: Engineering drawing is an engineering technical foundation course that studies the theory and methods of drawing engineering drawings using projection methods and solving spatial geometry problems. Engineering drawings are important technical materials in engineering technology and are essential tools for technical communication. The main content includes drafting geometry, drawing fundamentals, mechanical drawing, and computer-aided design. In addition to engineering students, this course is also compulsory for students in environmental and physics disciplines.

law_content: This course is one of the core courses for the major of environmental engineering. The course focuses on water purification, with an emphasis on treatment methods. It mainly teaches the basic principles and characteristics of physical and chemical treatment technologies for water and wastewater, as well as the basic calculation methods and application scopes of the processes. The course covers the composition and operational characteristics of major constituents, typical water and wastewater treatment processes, and the latest research progress in related technologies both domestically and internationally. This includes coagulation, sedimentation and clarification, flotation, filtration, disinfection, redox reactions, membrane separation, and desalination through softening. Through this course, students can deepen their understanding of water and wastewater physicochemical treatment theory, and improve their ability to analyze and solve problems.
zh_law_content: 本课程是环境工程专业的主干专业课之一 本课程以水质净化为目标 以处 理方法为主线 主要讲授水和废水物理化学处理技术单元的基本原理和特点 工艺的基本计算方法和应用范围 主要构成物的构成和运行特点 典型的水与 废水处理工艺以及相关技术的国内外最新研究进展 主要包括 混凝 沉淀与 ： 澄清 气浮 过滤 消毒 氧化还原 膜分离和软化除盐等 通过本课程的学习      加深学生对水和废水物化处理理论的理解 并提高学生分析和解决问题的能力

law_name: 水环境模型与数据分析
law_content: This course is a core course in the Environmental Science and Engineering major, specializing in Environmental Big Data. It aims to introduce watershed water resources and hydrological cycle processes, physical-chemical and ecological processes of water bodies, river and lake hydrodynamics, water quality, and aquatic ecological simulation models, machine learning, and water environment data analysis methods. Building on this foundation, it emphasizes case studies and exercises to enable students to understand and master the main physical, biological, ecological, and chemical processes of typical water bodies and familiarize them with the basic concepts of river and lake water environment. It also teaches the fundamental methods of water environment simulation, the technical ideas behind water environment simulation, and the main methods of water environment data analysis. Additionally, it provides basic applications of models in water environment management.

law_content: The curriculum has been significantly modified to adapt to the current economic development and the needs of training century talents, with reference to the latest textbooks from countries such as the UK, USA, and Russia. The teaching methods of this course include classroom instruction, discussions, in-class practice, and field trips, aiming to broaden students' knowledge and stimulate their curiosity. The course primarily focuses on addressing major issues such as population, resources, environment, and disaster reduction that humanity faces in the 21st century. It covers topics closely related to economic development such as resources and environment, geological hazards and protection, with the aim of laying a foundation for future research in related fields and expanding the scope of teaching.

law_content: Crystal optics mainly studies the basic principles and methods of identifying minerals under a polarizing microscope. Mineralogy studies the crystal structure and chemical composition characteristics of rock-forming minerals based on various optical phenomena produced when visible light passes through transparent crystals. Crystal optics and optical mineralogy are not only important foundations of petrology but are also widely applied in ceramics, casting, building materials, and other fields. Petrology is about the classification and classification principles of igneous rocks, including ultramafic rocks, mafic rocks, intermediate rocks, and felsic rocks. It also includes the basic characteristics, rock types, mineral compositions, structural features, and chemical compositions of various rock types, as well as the theories of rock formation and the tectonic environment of their formation. The course also introduces the basic theoretical principles of experimental petrology and its explanation of rock formation, the relationship between magmatism and plate tectonics and mantle plume structures, and the processes of crust-mantle interaction, as well as the significance of magmatism in the formation of continental crust.

law_content: Geohistory is a holistic geological discipline that mainly encompasses the fundamental concepts, theoretical principles, and research methods of geohistory. It also includes the basic characteristics and evolutionary history of geological development in various regions of China. Following the overall outline of Earth's evolution and the formation and evolution of Earth systems, it introduces the formation, development, and evolutionary patterns of the lithosphere, biosphere, hydrosphere, and atmosphere of the Earth's surface. Through (blank), students can learn and understand the evolutionary history of the Earth.

law_content: This field teaching internship is an important geological education for first-year students majoring in geology and geochemistry in the School of Earth and Space Sciences. It emphasizes basic geological concepts, fundamental knowledge, and basic skills training. Through short-term field practice, students will have a comprehensive understanding of the main contents and characteristics of geological studies. Through the internship, it aims to consolidate the classroom teaching content of the Introduction to Geology course and deepen understanding of related topics. Students will learn basic field work methods such as locating and describing geological points, using compasses and topographic maps, and identifying geological bodies and phenomena. They will also analyze the geological processes involved in their formation and gain knowledge of the geological evolution history of Beijing. Students are expected to compile a simple internship report to cultivate their love for nature, enhance their aesthetic taste, and increase their interest in geological research. At the same time, they will fully recognize the importance of geological practice in geological science research.
zh_law_content: 本次野外教学实习对地球与空间科学学院地质和地球化学专业一年级学生来说是一次地质启蒙教育 是一次重要的认识实习 重点强调地质基本概念 基  本知识和基本技能训练 通过短期的野外实践使同学们对地质学研究的主要内容和特点有一个比较全面的 概括的了解 通过野外实习来巩固 地球科学 ； 《概论 地质学部分的课堂教学内容 来加深对课程有关内容的理解 在实习中》  ；学习象地质点定点和描述 罗盘和地形图的使用等地质工作最基本的野外工作方法 认识基本的地质体和地质现象 学会描述这些地质体和地质现象 分；  析它们形成的地质作用过程 综合分析北京地区的地质作用过程 了解北京地 区地质演化历史 编制简单的实习报告 通过实习培养同学们对大自然的热爱 陶冶情操 提高对地质科学研究的兴趣 同时使同学们充分认识到地质实  ；践对于地质科学的重要性

law_content: Quantitative Cell Biology is a foundational course offered to second-year undergraduate students in the integrated science experiment class. It also welcomes students from other departments who have a certain mathematical background and are interested in multidisciplinary life sciences. In today's life science research, there is a move towards quantification and interdisciplinary approaches. As a result, many world-renowned universities have established the new and highly interdisciplinary field of Quantitative Biology. This course is designed to meet the growing importance of interdisciplinary studies. On one hand, the course requires students to have a good grasp of basic concepts, principles, and research methods in cell biology. On the other hand, the course will also teach the quantitative principles and models of various cellular processes, nurturing students' ability to analyze biological problems quantitatively using mathematical and physical tools. The teaching content includes core topics in cell biology and the quantitative principles and models in related fields. Students will also learn programming tools, such as MATLAB, to simulate and analyze cellular processes, in order to recognize the importance of interdisciplinary approaches in biology, physics, mathematics, chemistry, etc., and stimulate their interest and innovative spirit.
zh_law_content: 定量细胞生物学 是为整合科学实验班二年级本科生上学期开设的基础课《 》 同时也欢迎其他院系有一定数学基础的 微积分 对交叉型生命科学感兴趣（ ）的学生前来选修 当今的生命科学研究正向定量化和学科交叉的方向迈进 因此 不少世界知名大学纷纷建立了定量生物学这一新型的 高度交叉的学 科 本课程正是在学科交叉日益重要的背景下开设的 一方面 课程要求学生  较好地掌握细胞生物学的基本概念 基本原理 以及研究细胞生物学的基本方 法 另一方面 课程也将讲授各种细胞过程中的定量原理和模型 培养学生运；  用数学物理工具对生物学问题进行定量解析 从而深刻理解生物系统的运作规律 教学内容包括细胞生物学核心内容与相关领域的定量原理和模型 并 让学生学习用编程工具 比如 模拟和解析细胞过程 使学生认识到生（ Ｍａｔｌａｂ） 物物理数学化学等学科交叉的重要性 激发学生的兴趣及创新精神

law_content: This course introduces the field of quantitative molecular biology to freshmen in the Yuanpei College at Peking University. The course is offered in the first semester and includes basic molecular biology as well as four quantitative research topics. The first topic is the stochastic movement and rate equations of biological systems, which serves as an introduction to systems biology. The course is designed for freshmen who have just entered the university and have limited knowledge in mathematics, physics, chemistry, and biology. The course will provide necessary explanations and supplement the required knowledge. Therefore, no prerequisite courses are needed. The main feature of this course is to provide a simple introduction to the concept of quantification for young people who have just started their systematic study of life sciences in university. Quantitative research involves interdisciplinary collaboration across different fields and is a major trend in scientific research. In order to promote this, Peking University has established the Institute of Frontier Interdisciplinary Research, and the course instructor is a member of the Center for Quantitative Biology in this institute. Through this course, it is hoped that students can understand and embrace the idea of quantitative research from the beginning of their university studies and appreciate the charm of interdisciplinary studies. This is the main objective of this course. The content covered in this course is relatively simple and easy to understand, which can lay a solid foundation for students' future systematic learning.

law_content: This course is a basic course offered to undergraduate students in the integrated science experiment class in the second and third semesters. The main content integrates thermodynamics from physics and physical chemistry from chemistry. It also provides preliminary introduction to the ideas and methods of statistical physics. This course requires students to have a good grasp of the basic concepts, theories, knowledge, and research methods of thermodynamics and physical chemistry, and to develop scientific thinking and problem analysis abilities. The teaching content is combined with the regulation mechanisms of biological systems, enabling students to recognize the relationship between thermodynamics, physical chemistry, and life sciences, and inspiring their interests and innovative spirit.

law_content: This course lasts for one year and consists of 9 major experiments. The focus is on training students' hands-on skills in conducting basic experiments in physics, chemistry, electronics, and computer science, with an emphasis on their application to classic problems in life sciences. Each major experiment requires 2-3 weeks of continuous learning and operation, with one day dedicated to studying and conducting the experiment. Students are required to study the relevant theoretical knowledge before the class. The instructor is responsible for training students in basic experimental skills, guiding experiment discussions, providing background knowledge, and requiring students to write experiment reports. The course covers topics such as fluid mechanics and life phenomena at low Reynolds numbers, measuring yeast mutation rates, homemade photometers for measuring simulated bacterial growth rates, measuring Avogadro's constant and the Boltzmann constant, biological movement and chemotaxis, radiation and random phenomena, cell mechanics, basic chemical synthesis, geometric optics and imaging fundamentals. This course is a compulsory course for the integrated science experiment class.

law_content: This is an introductory course for the data science major. The main objective is to introduce the basic principles of data analysis. The course aims to provide practical experience in data analysis through models and algorithms. It emphasizes the integration of theory and practical experience. The course adopts a format of large-classroom teaching combined with small-group practical sessions. The main topics covered include data preprocessing, classification models, clustering models, regression models, feature extraction and model selection, dimensionality reduction, text analysis, graph algorithms and social network analysis, recommendation systems, neural networks and deep learning, and distributed computing.

law_content: Mathematical statistics is a widely applied foundational discipline that mainly investigates methods for scientifically analyzing and processing random samples. This includes how to effectively collect data, estimate parameters, perform tests, study relationships between variables, and make statistical decisions. As the most foundational course in the field of statistics, its main objective is to teach students the basic concepts and fundamental statistical thinking of this discipline. It aims to equip students with the ability to use commonly used statistical methods, combined with the mathematical and probability knowledge learned in prerequisite courses, to solve practical problems. Additionally, it provides an initial understanding of new developments in statistical research and helps students develop a preliminary statistical way of thinking.

law_content: Artificial intelligence is a postgraduate major, elective for senior undergraduate students, and a compulsory foundational course. The aim of this course is to teach the basic theories and methods related to artificial intelligence. The main contents of this course include intelligent agents, search techniques such as constraint satisfaction problems, first-order logic, automated reasoning, knowledge representation, planning methods, uncertain reasoning, and decision-making. Other topics covered in this course include machine learning, natural language processing, and robotics. Please refer to the lecture notes for more details on the course content.

law_content: Deep learning is the core technology that has made breakthroughs in artificial intelligence in recent years. This course will cover a series of topics in deep learning, including mathematical foundations, theories, algorithms, and important considerations in practical applications. The course requires students to be familiar with at least one programming language and have a basic understanding of machine learning. Course assignments will include applications of deep learning models in computer vision and natural language processing.

law_content: The basic methods for solving smooth nonlinear optimization problems with and without constraints will be learned in this course. The basic properties of these methods will also be covered. Through this course, students are expected to acquire a fundamental understanding of optimization methods and develop preliminary skills in theoretical analysis of algorithms. Additionally, students will also cultivate the ability to solve problems using optimization methods through computer computations.

law_content: The course aims to inspire students' interest and enthusiasm for aerospace by providing an overview of its historical development, current technological advancements, and future trends. The course introduces the composition, classification, and working principles of aircraft structures, propulsion systems, weapons equipment, electronic devices, and ground equipment.

law_content: As a hardware foundation course in the field of information science and technology, this course mainly covers introductory knowledge of microelectronics technology and circuit basics. It includes the working principles of semiconductor components, design and manufacturing processes of integrated circuits, the development of the microelectronics industry, the operational mechanisms of common electronic systems, and the construction and analysis methods of relatively simple analog and digital circuits.

law_content: This course is mainly focused on developing students' practical skills in electronic technology experiments, based on specific experiments. It starts with the basic recognition of electronic components, the use of instruments and equipment, and basic circuit soldering operations. Students will gradually be trained to master the design, assembly, measurement, debugging, and simulation techniques of analog circuits and digital logic circuits. The course also introduces new technologies and processes such as surface mount installation technology and integrated circuit technology. The course consists of 14 lectures totaling hours and a number of experiments. Each lecture lasts for a certain amount of time.

law_name: 空气动力学基础和实践
law_content: The desire to soar freely in the sky like a bird has been a long-standing dream of mankind. Today, with the advent of powered flight, the pursuit of safe, comfortable, and energy-efficient civilian aircraft, as well as high-speed, maneuverable, and stealthy military aircraft, continues to be the aspiration of aviation enthusiasts. As one of the most complex machines created by humans, an airplane integrates cutting-edge technologies in materials, structures, electronics, controls, and propulsion. However, the realization of flight heavily relies on the understanding and utilization of aerodynamics and flight mechanics. This introductory course in aeronautics succinctly introduces the thermodynamic properties, viscosity, compressibility, vortices, laminar flow, turbulent flow, wind tunnels, and the atmosphere, with a special focus on the aerodynamic characteristics of wings. The aim is to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the principles governing the generation of lift and drag on an aircraft, the interaction of airflow with the aircraft, fundamental theories, research methods, and testing techniques.
